review: Calm has always been a good app. As they grew, so did frustrating tech issues but they seem to have solved those and have added to their programs. It‚Äôs as if they have beautifully sculpted the app with time. I really appreciate the choices given when I open Calm. Sometimes I need a moving meditation. Sometimes I need the wisdom Sometimes a little humor and sometimes only Tamara‚Äôs calming voice will do. I really appreciate the meditating sounds of soft rain or a washing machine or waves ebbing & flowing. But my very tough Working K9 will only calm when going through his annual vet visit with blood tests and shots and such to Baby Shhh and it works every time. So I guess if Calms me and my dog, I have to give it five stars. I love the breathing part. I use it almost daily. Not a fan of the music but the sleep stories are the best and I love that I can use the search bar and find one of my favorites I may be in the mood for such as a dream over Paris or the history of the Library at Oxford or the train stories. Also the narrators offer excellent choices and their are certain ones whom I just need to hear at hard times because their soft melodic gift of storytelling puts me right out. I really appreciate the variety. I have had the Calm app I believe since not long after it launched and as others have come and gone and Calm has had its own growing pains, it‚Äôs the one with which I remain. So, thanks Calm, from my Tough Dog and I both.
title: Has become better with years

review:
I love the Calm app!  I stumbled upon a television commercial about it a few years ago and decided to give it a try.  I have had trouble falling asleep for years, and was honestly skeptical that an app would put me to sleep. Boy was I wrong!  I love the different options - sleep stories, music, meditation - each one is interesting, and while I can‚Äôt say I‚Äôve managed to get to end of a story‚Ä¶well that‚Äôs the point.  I‚Äôm out within five minutes.  I‚Äôve read some reviews about the expense - here‚Äôs the thing - what is your sleep and a relaxed mindset worth to you?  Divide that annual cost by 365 and you‚Äôre paying a pittance for your health.  Check back around the holidays - the makers of Calm run specials sometimes that make it even more worthwhile.  I had just renewed my annual fee two summers ago, when an end of year special came around.  It was a lifetime subscription that was going to save hundreds of dollars over the years. I knew I wouldn‚Äôt get the remainder of my annual fee (8 months left) refunded if I jumped on the lifetime subscription, but it was still worth the jump.  This is a must have app. 

*App makers - please put the sleep check-in back!  With the latest update it is gone, and it was something that really helped understanding factors that affect sleep.
title: Great app, use it every night

review:
I‚Äôm a 41 year old male who has struggled with OCD and panic since age 6. I‚Äôve gone through the doctors and medications. I thought I knew everything about diaphragmatic breathing, as it has been drilled into my head over the years. A couple weeks ago, my heart rate shot up. For the first time in my life, I was confident it wasn‚Äôt a panic attack and actually a heart attack. I stumbled out my apartment door, sweat dripping down my face and the few clothes covering my body. I dropped my phone on the way down the stairs but happened to call 911 right beforehand. Medics arrived. After about 10 minutes, they knew and I knew it was panic. I went back upstairs and started searching for every app I could think of. I found calm. I tried the first 7 days and was hooked. Some may think‚Ä¶ well I don‚Äôt have panic or OCD. It‚Äôs not for me. It‚Äôs so much more than that. I listened to a series by Lebron James that was amazing. There are different breathing techniques and meditations for sleep, work, anxiety, movement‚Ä¶ etc‚Ä¶

I know I‚Äôve said a lot and probably more than anyone needs. If I would have had the Calm app a few weeks ago during the worst panic attack of my life, I probably wouldn‚Äôt have had to call 911. At least try the trial. It‚Äôs very much worth it.
title: Why did I get the subscription?

review:
Calm has great stories, meditations and more. I love it and have the full version. I love Anna Acton, Eric Braa, and other soothing voices. Some of them, however, are just a bit...jarring. I know everyone has different tastes but I like to listen to voices directing me during meditation or towards sleep that don‚Äôt jump out at me. Please, Calm, add more voices like Eduardo Ballerini, Ramon Tikaram, Chik√© Okonkwo, May Charters and Jerome Flynn. Cillian Murphy is a great guest sleep story teller but please don‚Äôt just use celebrities because of name value. They don‚Äôt all make good storytellers/meditation guides. Some write the stories and I am grateful to those who come up with such wonderful sleep stories for adults. The ones that travel back in time, especially aboard old trains are outstanding! Just curate the voices a little better because some of us are too sensitive to the nuances of voice to listen to many of the meditations/stories. That‚Äôs kind of a waste. I end up listening to the same ones over and over. Please make the sleep stories at least 35 minutes, too. For those of us who need longer to drift away. 
Finally, since you are now making playlists, how about one that is just long train stories? Thanks so much!
title: Great App-Needs a few little tweaks

review:
I‚Äôm a 19 y/o college student that suffers from an anxiety disorder. I feel anxious most of the time and when things to actually feel anxious about present themselves it can be absolutely debilitating for me physically and emotionally.
However calm allows me to find hope in my current predicaments, and is amazing at calming me down. I really enjoy the soundscapes and meditation but my favorite thing is definitely the sleep story‚Äôs.
Listening to a bedtime story made for little kids mostly is really strangely therapeutic. There are more adult options but give the kiddy one‚Äôs a try. I feel like I‚Äôm one of the last demographics that these sleep story‚Äôs would reach but they make me feel more secure and able to connect back to the security of childhood. 
But anyways I highly recommend this app, the subscription is a bit pricey but the quality isn‚Äôt matched anywhere else. Falling asleep, calming down, feeling secure, and gaining more confidence & hope have all been easy and peaceful to do with this app. I‚Äôve been falling asleep with my headphones on every night so I can listen to this without disturbing my roommate. But I feel like he would enjoy it too.
After just the first day of the free trial I‚Äôm hooked.
title: The best way to calm anxiety

review: Hello, I really like the content on your app and it has really helped me to develop my practice. However because of the issues described in the title I probably will no longer subscribe to calm next year. I am blind, and use the screen reader voiceover. I can play the videos for the content well enough with play pause, fastforward but the biggest barrier I am facing is that the mountains which you tap on in the for you tab  to bring up the settings are unlabeled. I was trying to turn off the babbling Brook sound, accessible apps need to have text labels to accompany any clickable items. I would love to resubscribe once you have resolved these issues, buttons for the mood check-in feature are also unlabeled or nonexistent. The box breathing technique does not speak anything aloud or refresh on its own. A better way to accomplish that might be to use a metronome with 44 times signature. I am happy to speak to a developer more about my feedback and suggestions for how to resolve these issues, but I think that especially since healthcare providers are starting to recommend your service to their users, many of them who use Medicaid and Medicare and are disabled the app absolutely should be more accessible. Thank you for your timely consideration and namaste. I look forward to working with you in making the meditation community more inclusive.
title: App is in accessible for blind user, buttons unlabeled

review: I originally received a Calm membership for a year through Verizon and mostly knew it as a meditation app. I would probably give the meditation side of the app 3 stars. It has variety and guided options but if you are a meditator, it isn‚Äôt very helpful. The search feature also isn‚Äôt useful. I look for sound meditation with chimes at various times depending on how long I would like to meditate. And if I want a guided meditation, I want to be able to search by length, not topic. But all that being said, the sleep story side of this app is 5 stars. It has saved me from sleepless nights and eased me back to sleep when I‚Äôve woken in the night due to anxiety and illness. While I don‚Äôt use it every night, when I do, I am asleep within minutes. On nights when I‚Äôm having a hard time sleeping, one to two will ease me to sleep. There‚Äôs great variety from fiction to nonfiction, different types of narrators, and different journeys from walking through a bookstore to riding a train to taking a trip to space. I highly recommend the paid version for these sleep stories. I‚Äôve even enjoyed some of the children‚Äôs versions!
title: It will help you through sleepless nights - worth the annual membership

review:
I‚Äôve always struggled with anxiety and not being able to calm down. All of the features which this app has to offer really help me when I‚Äôm studying (I like having soundscapes or music on), relaxing (breathing exercises or meditation), and getting ready for bed (sleep stories and body scans). It is so worth it to pay for the subscription, and even before I paid for the subscription (my doctor recommended the app to me not knowing I had the free version of it for about 3 years already) there was a lot of content available. I love the calendar features as well, and the check-ins are a great way for me to reflect on my day and practice gratitude. 

One suggestion I have though are podcasts! I like to listen to people talking about any subject while I‚Äôm doing tasks around the house or just trying to sleep (sometimes the silence is a lot and I can‚Äôt focus on sleeping with my thoughts). If you guys made some soft spoken or any kind of podcast in which there wasn‚Äôt a lot of yelling and loud talking, I‚Äôd totally listen in. (I know there are some masterclasses and lesson type things available on the app already, but they‚Äôre just not podcasts)
title: My doctor recommended it to me and I love it

review: I really am indebted to Calm for working in my life during this pandemic helping me w my emotions, sleep help and maybe keeping me at a level arresting the memory decline that seemed to be coming on w it‚Äôs debilitating force. (I don‚Äôt use words like fighting it because most things should not be put into adversarial roles) I wish I had more from our guide Jeff on how to meditate. I really relate to his presentation because he seems quintessentially California to me. I‚Äôve been meditating since I was 6 or so, brought up Vedantist Hindu, born Jewish and am now a ChristianI am an aging hippie. I meditate w my cat on my lap, I simply press my hands on her sides and she grounds me and then is the anchor; her occasionally purring. I love the pictures and the nature scenes. By the way I have been meditating every single day since November. If I might be of assistance, I‚Äôm not sure how maybe I could do a Spark or something. I wish there were Something way to dialog - I have been on the site. Maybe I could look more deeply into community of Calm. Thanks for saving my life as a process. This is one place I like to be every single day (sometimes night) contact me if you are interested in my story of success.
title: Review of Calm

title: Amazing! (With updated review!)

review: This app is a must-have for everybody. Firstly, I love the student discount they offer. The regular subscription is a bit pricy for me currently as a college student but the student discount makes helpful mindfulness tools accessible to stressed college students. The app contains incredibly helpful grounding techniques, guided meditations, and breathing exercises. With anxiety especially, sometimes the physical symptoms can worsen the psychological symptoms. It‚Äôs very beneficial to be able to focus your attention on how you‚Äôre presently feeling, how slowly you‚Äôre breathing to help calm yourself down. I really love using the check-in tools in the mornings and before bed, to track how I‚Äôve been feeling over a span of time. It makes it easier to tell my psychiatrist and therapist how I‚Äôve been feeling and for how long. I also love the sleep stories and soundscape features to help me sleep. Sometimes with my anxiety, laying in bed in silence with my thoughts keeps me awake for hours after getting ready for sleep. It‚Äôs helpful to have a relaxing neutral stimulus to focus my attention on rather than my thoughts. All in all, a very useful app with plenty of tools.
title: Well worth the money

review: I want to say I tried this app back in 2015 or 2016. I took a break from it for a while after I found Insight Timer because I much preferred the content on that app (comes from thousands of creators and is free). I REALLY do not enjoy Tamara‚Äôs voice and refuse to listen to it which eliminates about 30% of the content on this app (previously her voice accounted for 90% so this is an improvement). This is what originally led me to explore other apps. They‚Äôre really beginning to expand on variety now and I don‚Äôt have to listen to that god-awful Mid-Atlantic-like accent while I‚Äôm trying to meditate or go to sleep. I love the sleep stories and my boyfriend has also grown to look forward to picking one out. One thing I noticed recently that I would like to call out to the developers was that I had turned on Jay Shetty‚Äôs sleep meditation and noticed I was able to still listen to my background music of choice from the home page. This was really really cool and something I hope I‚Äôm able to do to customize the background sounds for my other meditations. If it‚Äôs a new feature or something please continue to offer it! I like being able to choose from more than just ‚Äúmusic‚Äù or with ‚Äúrain‚Äù in the background sometimes. Thanks!
title: Improved over time

review:
There‚Äôs so much to this app there‚Äôs bed time stories, breathing exercises, music, sessions to help relax, meditate, and help u sleep, there‚Äôs also (one of my favorites) where u can have a calming background when on or off your phone, they have quotes to help motivate you, there‚Äôs daily check in‚Äôs you can do, you can set timers and reminders for things and so much more! There is a free app trial but you do have to pay after the trial ends but I think in my opinion it‚Äôs worth buying the app! My one recommendation though is that I think the calm app should add some more journaling to the app something more than the check ins because I think journaling is a great way to help you feel your releasing your past or just writing how happy you are if that makes sense plus if it‚Äôs not to much maybe add something to remind you to get off your phone and go outside or do some focusing hour on school work or something like that. Overall the calm app is a great app and I totally recommend if you have anxiety, or are having trouble sleeping! 
-if your reading this have a good day/night/rest of your day/night!
title: Love the app just one recommendation!

review: Impossible to give feedback on the app. I want to ask you to take out the dialog box asking me if ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sure?‚Äù If I have to get out my glasses to read it then I‚Äôm awake! Defeating the purpose of the app! Sometimes I want to listen again and I‚Äôm not going to do your little therapy session first. Please make it easy to listen to a story again without a lot of navigation. A good app should not require more than three steps to find things but now it is hit or miss. They eliminated some buttons so I can‚Äôt find what I want. I can‚Äôt find a favorites button anymore. The changes you made are not an improvement. There are good things here to help sleep if you can find them but by the time you do you will be wide awake. // I finally found the Favorites. You need to separate the Daily Calm Favorites from the others. It‚Äôs too many to find the stories. Like I said this App has good content but it‚Äôs badly organized// I wish you would make a text menu because with the icons it requires so much scrolling. Overall the navigation is a hassle for what should be a relaxing app.I
title: The navigation is worse than before not better

title: My opinion about the calm app.

review: The offer a 7 day FREE Trial and then auto bill your credit card thereafter. A friend was gracious enough to purchase me a 1 year gift certificate to the program; however, when I signed up, the app would not accept my gift certificate info and stated I would be billed on my credit card after the free trial was up. I have attempted for HOURS to go into the app  to cancel the premium subscription and to also delete my account. The app just takes you in circles and gives you no avenue to cancel. When I try to delete my account, I get an error stating I have to cancel my subscription first, which the app will not allow me to do. I have also tried deleting my credit card info from my phone in settings and removing the app subscription that way and it does not work either. I ultimately had to cancel my credit card and have it reissued to prevent the auto charge subscription from taking place and now am without my credit card for several days. I did not want to wait for the charge to go through and then have to wait 90 days for me to get the charge deleted/reversed. This practice with the developers to make it impossible to cancel is shady.. they also do not provide any contact customer service email or phone number to contact to cancel or address billing concerns.
title: FRAUD!  DO NOT SUBSCRIBE!!!

review: I never ever write reviews especially for Apple Store. Usually never worth my time, but this is the first app I‚Äôm going to give a review on. This is the best app to seriously go to sleep to. Last night was the first night I tried this and literally my wife and I passed out!! I have a very big night owl, with my sleeping schedule being so messed up I thought I was about to have to start taking sleep medication again. This app is worth the $70 a year and I‚Äôm legit day 1 into my free trial. I absolutely love it. For me to write a review and say I love this app comes to me as a big shocker. I thought it was going to be a trash app at first, but I definitely got proven wrong when one sleep soundtrack come on and I went from being so energetic to so CALM in a matter of minutes. One of the most relaxing nights I‚Äôve had in a while and I usually toss and turn all night long and it also takes me forever to go to sleep. I am just 23 years old and I worked in so many manufacturing and labor jobs on night shift I didn‚Äôt think I would ever go to sleep as fast as this app made me.
title: Amazingg!!!!!

review:
I paid $70 for this thing, and the sleep feature does not work correctly for me at all! I set it for three hours usually, because I like the noise to continue until I know for sure that I have fallen asleep. It never fails that once it stops, it jars me out of sleep, assuming I have fallen asleep quickly enough. Unfortunately that‚Äôs exactly what keeps happening to me. I use this app on my iPad, and usually after the first song, if I am listening to sleep music, it completely stops playing, and then I get a message telling me that my timer ran out. Even though the timer underneath clearly shows that I have close to three hours still left on it. This literally happens almost every night so I‚Äôve gotten to the point where I don‚Äôt even try to fall asleep until at least two songs have played. I like the app otherwise, but it‚Äôs absolutely ridiculous that I have to do that after having spent so much money on this thing!! 

I like the sleep stories as well, but I wish there was some way to set them on repeat because I don‚Äôt always fall asleep quickly enough and I wouldn‚Äôt mind having them play multiple times.
title: Doesn‚Äôt work as well as it should for the money

review: My doctor had shared with me about the benefits of meditation.... I needed something to help when I was anxious as well something to help me relax. Shortly after that doctor visit I found the Calm app. Its been 5 years. It had been a stressful day and there was an introduction to the app and I took the 10 minutes and did the breathing and really focused on relaxing. I went back to work and I immediately told everyone about Calm.... I have been using it ever since! The time I meditate is my time to focus, to breathe and to just be in the moment. I had horrible insomnia and started the body scans... I tried the sessions without buying the subscription but soon found that I wanted more of the sessions after I did the first; so I bought the subscription and have never regretted it once! It's been a godsend. I love the bedtime stories and the daily Calm.... there is so much on this app that has helped me. I love that the app is adding new things. Thank you Tamara and your wonderful team for sharing and helping me bring peace and calm into my life!
title: Thankful and learning each day to be Calm

review: This was such a wonderful app, At some point, a year ago? they redesigned the layout and made it stressful to use. It was so simple before, you wanted a sleep story? You could scroll through every one simply and fluidly. now they are all separated, train stories from nature from featured or whatsoever and you have to spend your time searching through multiple tabs, that shudder as you scroll, not fluid anymore, the last thing you want to do when you‚Äôre looking to get to sleep. And though on each there‚Äôs a See All tab, you only see all of that category - making it really difficult to just access all sleep stories. And these sleep categories are all buried among daytime use tabs, meditations, daily get up and go stuff, mental fitness. Who thought this was a good idea?? The layout design is too specified and difficult to just go and find what you want. Also, while I‚Äôm glad there is more kid content being added for parents it would be nice if they added other stories at the same pace, and also backed off some of the more cheesy approaches to new stories that seems to have begin to pervade. Bummer when a great thing is ‚Äúimproved‚Äù and made far less nice.
title: Latest layout just has so many design and access flaws

review: I‚Äôve suffered from tinnitus (ringing in my ears), migraines, and anxiety since a concussion several years ago. I never pay for apps, but the Calm App is so helpful that, after paying for 1 year, I‚Äôve decided to pay for a lifetime membership. I love that I can choose to listen to a male, as many female voices increase my symptoms. It‚Äôs wonderful to have such a vast choice of categories to turn to. I love the 4 to 7 day training sessions for things like decreasing pain, decreasing anxiety, decreasing headaches, and falling asleep. When my tinnitus is bad, I use one of the sleep meditations to help overpower the sound and allow ne to fall asleep. When I have a headache, I lie down and listen to a calming meditation, and the headache resolves, or at least decreases. These guided meditations really help soothe my anxiety. The different daily meditations help teach what to do for various issues, and you can save the ones you especially like. I highly recommend the 30 day Intro to Meditating, as it helps you become adept at meditation. This app is so worth getting!
title: So helpful for tinnitus, headaches, anxiety post concussion

review: During this time of isolation due to the pandemic, my daughter suggested I download this app. She‚Äôs been using it for a while and has premium. I downloaded it and I‚Äôm using the free service for now. This usually is not my ‚Äúcup of tea‚Äú and thought I would just try it. I have had a lot of anxiety and feel isolated and alone. I signed up and they have a very nice welcome letter. I tried one of the meditations and it is current with the times, it‚Äôs very relatable and because of that it has helped a lot. When I received the second long letter which I‚Äôm sure is a form letter but very well done, it has made me feel as if I am part of a community and a family which I do not have. Thank you from the bottom my heart for this wonderful app. There are plenty of meditations to choose from when you are first starting out and don‚Äôt understand the reviews about not having free meditations. This is a great stepping stone for someone who is new to meditation and I for one am very grateful. Great app. The meditations really are working for me and I recommend this to anyone who needs a little calm in their life.
title: I don‚Äôt feel alone

review: My daughter was on her computer after school one day and was searching for calming music when calm came up & she did the 7 days of anxiety day1 meditation & was so much calmer. Every scene then she has been using calm. She went through the next couple of times & each time she found a new meditation, she would do it. Then she started doing the meditation regularly & being so calm after. She even now does the 7 days of sleep meditation each night to help her sleep & has been sleeping phenomenally! She normally didn‚Äôt close her eyes during the meditations for months but she does now & is so quiet & still during the meditations & let‚Äôs nothing get in her way and distract her. She even on day did an hour of the different meditations with her dad & he loved it. She also has done nightly one with her dad & her grandma & they love it too. She is always raving about Calm so I thought I should give it 5 stars & say thank you for all the joy, peace, calmness & clarity you‚Äôve brought to my daughter‚Äôs life and the lives of millions of others. But she does hate that the amount of meditations is so limited. Can you fix that!
title: I think it‚Äôs wonderful

review:
Night shift nurse here! My first year as a nurse has lead to high anxiety and stress levels. My therapist recommended this app for mindful meditation and I‚Äôm enjoying it so far. I find Tamara‚Äôs voice very soothing‚Äînot annoying, and the soundscapes in the background are perfect.  It would be nice if there was a setting or a collection of audios for those who work nights and therefore sleep in the day time. It can be hard to sleep with all the noises of day (lawn mowers, car horns, noisy neighbors,etc.) It would also be nice if the daily check ins could take this into consideration as well‚Äîwhen I meditate in the morning after I get off work, the question is ‚Äúhow did you sleep last night?‚Äù Well I worked last night so that doesn‚Äôt apply. 

As far as the $70/year, this is affordable for me but I realize that isn‚Äôt the case for everyone‚Äîespecially in this economy. I definitely couldn‚Äôt have paid for this in college, maybe the developers should consider a discount for college students, teachers, etc. Access to mental health resources should ideally be available to all regardless of financial situation.
title: Needs a night shift worker version

review: Once, it was 3am and still dark out. Then, my power cut. I was absolutely terrified! So Al I did was curl up in a ball and hug my iPad as tight as a killer might choke you. I went on my iPad and scrolled through pages and pages of apps looking for messages so I could text my mother about the situation. Then, I came across one of my old apps called ‚ú®‚ÑÇùïíùïùùïû‚ú®. It‚Äôs been a while since I used this app. I think I stopped because I thought the format was crusty musty dusty wusty schmusty custy yusty gusty susty vusty busty lusty rusty tusty pusty fusty nusty kustywusty. But now, it looks better then ever! I love it! I am absolutely obsessed! Back to the story, I went into the app and started to use it, then my time on the app went from at least 3:00 to 4:00 in a heartbeat. It was so fast and I was and am obsessed! This really has helped me calm my mind and body. It helps me unwind all my thoughts for bed. This has changed my life! Thank you soooooo much for creating this app! Thank you for being so thoughtful about other people‚Äôs bodies and minds. Once again, thank you. Goodbye!
title: Absolutely amazing! ‚ú®‚ú®‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

review:
Two major concerns. First of all, I judge how sincere an app like this is about helping people by the availability of free content. I understand that it takes resources to produce content of this quality, but this app verges on hostile towards the non-paying user, and some people just can‚Äôt afford to pay. I saw someone saying that the master classes were available, so I looked into that - um, no. It‚Äôs the *trailers* that are available, and this sort of bait-and-switch is typical of the non-paying experience in this app.

Second, I have chronic pain, and there isn‚Äôt any content that comes up when I search for that - there apparently isn‚Äôt anything health-related at all. The one free guided meditation I found started triggering panic as it made me more aware of my pain, and I had to stop. 

The upshot is that this app seems targeted towards a ‚Äúbeautiful person‚Äù demographic whose problems really will all go away if they start meditating. The series by Lama Rod Owens seems like a step in the right direction, but it‚Äôs going to take a complete reevaluation of the goals and design to really address the problem. Right now, if you‚Äôre disabled, broke, aging ungracefully, traumatized, or whatever, this app will constantly remind you that you don‚Äôt belong in the ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù space.
title: I really wanted to love this, but

review: I suffer from what I call ‚Äòbusy brain‚Äô and was seeking help to unwind, destress and generally switch off after work when I bought this app, 40 days ago. I‚Äôve used it at least once a day ever since. I‚Äôm trying my best to meditate, still not very good at diverting those racing thoughts but I do enjoy the short ‚Äòpep talks‚Äô at the beginning of each meditation and breathing exercises help me to unwind a little. I love the sleep stories, particularly those narrated by Alan Sklar - I never reach the end though, I‚Äôm always asleep within 10 minutes! If I wake horribly early I use the sleep meditations to try to relax back into sleep. Then there‚Äôs the music and soundscapes to explore too. I see in these reviews that some people complain about the cost but if you use the app daily, it‚Äôs really only a few cents a day. Well worth the price if you determine to make time in your day to make use of the app. All in all, I think Calm is excellent value, well designed and offers something new to explore almost every day. Well done all!
title: Loving this app

review: This app is for anxiety and to help people who have trouble falling asleep and I can‚Äôt believe that an app that is supposed to help with things like that that people can‚Äôt control makes you pay $70 a year you might think that these people would be generous and let you at least have a few things unlocked but no literally every single thing is locked and you can‚Äôt use it unless you have the stupid extremely expensive subscription again this is especially insane because this is an app for people who have trouble falling asleep or anxiety and you make them pay for something they can‚Äôt control I feel like this app should be free or at least make it a $10 app because this is insane how much money you want people to pay so they can have better control on something that‚Äôs really hard for them to handle what you‚Äôre doing is greedy, selfish, and rude I honestly don‚Äôt know why there are so many good reviews about this because you literally cannot use anything without the expensive subscription other people might have enough money to pay for something like this but I definitely don‚Äôt have enough money to pay for something this expensive
title: You literally can‚Äôt use anything without the extremely expensive subscription

review: Calm has been such a blessing and absolutely paramount in helping deepen my meditation practice. The wide variety in types of meditations offered is just incredible. From detailed visualization and guided meditation, to simple breathing meditations with very little guidance, it offers it all. Sometimes I'm in the mood for a lot of guidance while meditating and other times I just want bells at different durations while meditating, and I like that I can easily switch it up, depending on that day's vibe.  I was a little thrown off by having to pay over $60 right out the gate, but after giving it a try, I've now paid that fee for the last 5 years with ZERO regret. It also keeps track of how many days in a row you've meditated and the total hours. I just LOVE being able to track my progress and also know when I'm slacking and need to spend more time on my biggest self care ritual, which is my meditation practice. Thank you sooooo much Tamara for this beautifully intricate, but very easy to operate app you've created!
title: Simply Fabulous!!!

review: This app has helped me through so much, I struggle with severe anxiety and I first discovered this app while on a trip‚Ä¶I was really anxious and I didn‚Äôt get any sleep the last 2 nights. I already had this app on my phone but I didn‚Äôt have the premium subscription so I had very limited options, I decided to do the free trial to the premium subscription and I fell in love with it, so I decided to spend the money because it was worth it! I have been using it for a year now and I can‚Äôt tell you how much this has helped me! Before I downloaded/started using this app,  I had weeks where I only slept 2 out of the 7 nights which can take a huge impact on your mental health but ever since I have been using this app that doesn‚Äôt happen anymore, this app is a dream to own! Thank you so much Calm for helping me with all of my struggles, this app is like a digital therapist and I am not lying! I doubted at first that this would never work but I judged to soon, it works!
title: It is definitely worth the money to unlock all the stories!

review: This app was fabulous originally, but they have ‚Äúimproved‚Äù some functions so they are not easy to use any more.  For example, we listen to the same Eric Braa episodes every night, but now they have moved them out of the instant display of my faves and buried them so I have to search for them in the middle of the night.  They no longer have new Eric Braa episodes and his voice is so soothing.  The recently used episodes should appear near the top of the category list so we can find them easily, not on the home page!  Give us a way to make our own category(s). Give us a way to remove all the children‚Äôs stories from the adult content.  Give us a way to totally delete content that is a trigger for us.  And finally, in the middle of the night, a dialog sometimes pops up that I have to put my glasses on to read so I can dismiss it!  That should NEVER happen.  I wish someone would listen.  I used to give feedback on each new story, but it never did any good so I stopped.  I don‚Äôt feel they listen anymore and I‚Äôm disappointed.
title: So disappointed lately

review: 3 years and counting and I still use this app almost every day. From sleep stories and nature sounds or music, to meditations and mini mastermind series. It is everything I need for my mental health at my fingertips - whenever, wherever. When I‚Äôm upset, I can find something here that will help calm myself (pun intended lol) but it also helps me learn how to self sooth, instead of self medicate. Nothing wrong with medication if someone needs it, but I don‚Äôt believe I need it and want to learn how to manage my anxiety and not to let my emotions get the best of me. I listen to sleep story‚Äôs almost every night and pass out within minutes. I don‚Äôt think I know the middle or end to ANY sleep story, because I can‚Äôt make it that far lol. If you‚Äôre looking for a more holistic way of creating inner peace, this is it for me. I am a life coach as well and recommend it to al my clients, friends and family. I always say if I would get paid for how much I recommend Calm, I would have a really nice chunk of money.
title: Calm is how I reconnect with myself

review: I absolutely love your app! To the calm creators, I think they worked hard on this app..but there are some suggestions. For example, I know that these things and apps cost a lot to make..but please don‚Äôt squeeze the person who doesn‚Äôt want to buy or doesn‚Äôt have the money to buy supreme,(to listen to everything/everyone) it really isn‚Äôt that nice. People who need to relieve stress or anxiety or listen to the voices/stories they want to. I personally think there is quite a lot of things to listen on calm..for free. But not even close to premium. But just remember, I love your app, and a lot of people do too!! But just please raise the stories for the people who can‚Äôt pay..especially animal ones!! (Those are my favorite). I‚Äôm just giving some helpful feedback on your app..hope you use this advice and put it in an update! But if you don‚Äôt and don‚Äôt take a lot of the viewers advice or mine..some people might start deleting your app. Sincerely from a Calm User to the Calm Creators.
title: Awesome app!! Few Suggestions

review: Ever since I began using Calm about 3 years ago , I noticed a tremendous difference and improvement in my life. The more I utilised the amazing features the app had to offer, the more I learned about myself. Among many of my favourite features is surprisingly the usage counter ; where it keeps track of how many days in a row one has used the app.  It is very motivating. I currently have about 5 months (153 days) in row! The more I incorporate Calm into my daily life, the more I grow , the more I learn and become more self aware. I am happier and Calm has truly changed my life in so many ways . When I started to really get into the lessons on Calm, an ‚ÄúAh ha‚Äù moment happened and the classes and meditations being taught, ‚Äúclicked‚Äù and I began to better understand the meanings, the concept, the teachings of mindfulness ‚Ä¶üßòüèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è But I credit the amazing teachers and mindfulness experts  for their approach and way of passing the lessons onto its users.  It‚Äôs worth the download, and definitely worth purchasing a lifetime subscription!
title: Perfect

review: I‚Äôve been using the Calm app for a few years now. There‚Äôs a lot of great free content but the premium content is outstanding! I bought a lifetime membership and have never ever regretted it. I use the daily meditations, the daily yoga, the sleep stories, the music, soundscapes, the master classes and the check-in‚Äôs. Calm as part of my daily routine. It‚Äôs a great way to start the day! I turned my husband on to Calm about a year ago. He struggles with anxiety and calm has helped him more than I can describe. He loves it so much he asked for a lifetime subscription as a birthday gift!  He also suffers from insomnia. The sleep stories and especially the sleep music have helped him to fall asleep and stay asleep without the aid of medication‚Äòs. I can‚Äôt recommend this app highly enough!!!   Enjoy the free content but if you want the full immersion and the maximum benefits I encourage the annual subscription or better yet the lifetime subscription.  Thank you Calm team for putting together such a great app! Keep up the good work!
title: I LOVE my Calm!!

review: I am very reluctant to use this type of apps. However, this one always called my attention and during my last insomnia crisis I decided to explore. Oh my God, this app is not just a help to sleep better but to Live better! It has been about 10 days since I started and I am in love with it. I am 58 y.o. Venezuelan Female, Medical Doctor, married to a Wonderful Woman - my Soul Mate- living in a foreign country. She is deep into meditation and I feel so behind but I met Jeff and he has  introduced me to meditation in such an easy and accessible way. I have attempted for many many year with others but I always fell asleep. Besides and like now, I am at work and have some boring stuff to do. I just have to look for some new music on the app to switch my mood and be able to ‚Äúkeep walking‚Äù. So, Thanks Jeff! and thanks the lady with the sweet voice- can‚Äôt remember her name!- and thanks to all the talented people that make possible this unbelievable tool. My year subscription is really worthy to be paid!
title: Helpful beyond description

review:
Whenever I use this app I usually use it only for breathing, mainly because that‚Äôs all I can because of premium. My mental health has been horrible these past days and this app could probably help, but it‚Äôs not free. My family might do the 7 day trial but sense my mental health is most likely going to get better I‚Äôm sure they would think it‚Äôs a waste but not everyone is lucky to have the money for these things. 
There could be family‚Äôs in need that don‚Äôt have the money for fancy memberships like this. Though I‚Äôm sure my family would get the subscription some people don‚Äôt have the money to do. 

What I‚Äôm saying is if you see this could you please look into some stuff that could be free because I‚Äôm sure it wouldn‚Äôt hurt to take at least a couple of things off the premium even if it‚Äôs just 1 story or anything that could help. Even if you have to watch a ad every time. It would help a lot for people and it would even help me too.
title: Premium for almost everything

review: I‚Äôve bought and listened to at least twenty of these ‚ÄúSleepyTime Apps‚Äù and I‚Äôve learned a few things. Most of them are pretty cheeseball. Looping, cheap sound recordings that sound like they were recorded by your father‚Äôs cassette tape recorder from Sears, circa 1976. If those are the Chevrolets of the industry this is the Cadillac that they are ALL trying to rip off. I could go on about sound quality or originality but the real thing that sets CALM apart is that they never stop making themselves better, hiring more and more celebrity pros to come in and create their own new sleep songs, narrate their own bedtime stories. What makes CALM different is that they take most of that extra money you pay for their service and immediately re-invest it in the app, snowballing it, making it better every day. The CALM app that I will have a month from now will be better than the one I enjoy today. And they‚Äôve kept this simple formula for as long as they‚Äôve been in business. It works.
title: EXPENSIVE- AND WORTH EVERY PENNY

review: I made mindfulness and intention my goals for 2021 and wanted to start meditating but didn‚Äôt know how or where to begin. I searched mediation apps and found Calm to be top-rated. Although skeptical of the whole practice, I started my free trial. I was hooked after my first Daily Calm session. Meditating, I learned, isn‚Äôt difficult, doesn‚Äôt require any special energy, and packs a mighty self-care punch. This app helps you rest and recharge in 10 short minutes a day (or more if you like!) I love the messages Tamara embeds in the Daily Calm, I love the thought provoking ideas Jeff brings to Daily Trips, and sleep stories really do help us sleep! My 10 year old listens to one very single night. I‚Äôm especially excited about the new Calm Kids feature and look forward to more kid‚Äôs meditations. This app has introduced life changing practices to my family over the last 9 months and I‚Äôm so grateful. We‚Äôll continue to renew each year. Would recommend for anyone 100%!
title: Life changer: Perfect for Beginners

review: Although majority of folks have rated this app 5 stars, I am in the minority that I find the sleep content lacking. Or perhaps new content does not easily appear when opening the app and selecting sleep. I use this app solely for the sleep content, so I cannot comment on the other areas of what Calm has to offer. I also subscribe to a couple of other apps for sleep stories and meditations - one of which I pay for yearly and the other free through apple podcast. I noticed that both other apps I use (paid and free) update their content weekly and easily show the new sleep stories upon opening the app. Calm doesn‚Äôt seem to update with new sleep content nearly as often or perhaps it requires you to dig for it. Add to that, the cost of Calm is nearly double what I pay for the other sleep app I use which produces 1-3 new episodes per week. Apple Podcasts also have new free content that is updated weekly. I am nearing the end of my 1 year subscription and do not plan to renew. I do not feel the money is worth what you get from the sleep section.
title: New content for sleep seems lacking

review: I had been struggling with falling asleep and plenty of mental illnesses with anxiety, overcoming trauma, trying to heal myself, and depression. The premium is 100% worth it I can‚Äôt imagine my life without this app and even if I‚Äôm not finding time to use the meditations like I do want to (still working on finding time for those and making time for my mental health) the daily check ins and gratitudes I do each day take less than five minutes and help me see that even if I felt like it was a horrible day so many good things also happened. The daily reflections are also amazing helping me realize thoughts and answers I didn‚Äôt know I had if I didn‚Äôt just sit back think and listen. Overall this app has been incredible and I wouldn‚Äôt change a thing 1000% worth the money such a large variety of things and tools to listen and work with to the people who made this app thank you so much for helping the millions of people out there like me‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Worth it changed my life‚ù§Ô∏è

review:
Turning my brain off and getting to sleep has always been a problem for me. I was iffy when I bought a year‚Äôs subscription to Calm but it has 100% been worth it. I‚Äôve never fallen asleep as easily as with Calm‚Äôs sleep meditations.  However, lately I‚Äôve found myself waking up shortly after the track stops playing and I‚Äôll fumble with my phone to turn on another. This is now happening 2-3 times a night. I looked for an autoplay function but found that it only exists in the music portion of the app. I‚Äôd be fully awake by the time I navigate to music, select a track, and set to autoplay. 

I don‚Äôt necessarily need to listen to meditations all night but it would be great if I were able to queue up the sleep music or a soundscape to begin playing once the meditation track is over. 

In the meantime I‚Äôll be trying to rig up something with my Alexa to keep the room from falling too silent. Overall, I think Calm is a wonderful app with great content and my only wish is that it could keep going all night!
title: Almost Perfect

review:
One day not to long ago I was struggling to get some sleep and so was my sister was too when I would try to sleep my sister kicked and rolled when she was trying to sleep and she also sometimes kicked me off the bed and then I had to sleep in another room and her snores were so loud I had to go sleep in the basement and I slept on the couch there was also a TV down there sometimes I would watch TV so I could sleep and now I‚Äôm happy to have Calm also my sister stoped kicking and snoringüòÇ. Thank you Calm.

My favorite sleep story is the New Nifty and the Halloween scare there‚Äôs something that happened to me there was a bat on my front door it was really scary though. title: The Journey to find Peace ‚úåÔ∏è‚òÆÔ∏è

review: This app is great! I love that I can customize the background picture and sounds. The background and sounds can still be present during the meditation if you set the settings to allow it. Otherwise, you could set the background sounds to silent during meditations. I love the daily calm and various meditations and sound scapes! I really appreciate that I can even set the length of calm sessions or body scans to fit my work day. The one thing I would add to make this app perfect is a mood tracker! They do have one but it doesn‚Äôt give good statistical data. I like to keep track of my mood and compare it weekly, monthly, and yearly. Having a line graph of sorts would help me track my mood better for my mental health goals. The lack of this one feature is why I still have a mood journal app that I keep forgetting to use. If the mood tracker in Calm was better at displaying patterns then I would just use this app for all my mindfulness, gratitude, reflection, and mood tracking. I really would like to see that feature added!
title: Great app! Would love to see a mood tracker added

review: I love the Calm app. I‚Äôve had it for years and love all the changes the app makes with the premium version. I‚Äôve used all the features including the meditation but mostly use the sleep stories. I have insomnia and the sleep stores are the only thing that help me fall back asleep more quickly. I listen to the Calm curated playlist as I like to listen all night. The playlists haven‚Äôt been updated in a while and I would really love the option to make my own or at least have a play all downloads feature.  I have made suggestions over the years to allow users to curate their own playlists but this option isn‚Äôt available yet. Please make that update next. I wake often and end up having to find another sleep story to listen to in the night since I can‚Äôt auto set another to play when one ends. I love the app and all the content. I really wish this feature would be done. It‚Äôs the only thing keeping the app from being perfect.
title: Love the app but need playlists for sleep stories

review:
I just wanted to explore the app but immediate I was faced with signing up(here comes the spam marketing emails), and choosing a pricy subscription(is it worthy it‚Ä¶.. I‚Äôd not know I haven‚Äôt seen anything yet).
Then you find the way out of the subscription screen and Bamm they hit you with another one‚Ä¶ a bit cheaper though. After that finally I got to the app. Almost everything is locked. But I tried clicking anyways right cause that‚Äôs why I‚Äôm here. Bammm they hit you with the subscription page because you need to pay to view that content. ‚Ä¶ Okay I‚Äôll got back and look for something free so that I can see this app in use. ‚Ä¶.Scrolling scrolling scrolling almost nothing is unlocked. And them Bammm‚Ä¶. Pop up‚Ä¶They want a app review‚Ä¶. I just got here, I can‚Äôt review yet. 
All that to say I gave up at that point and I still dont know if it‚Äôs good app. Maybe. But it was a stressful experience getting almost nowhere. And then hours later after I‚Äôve given up and deleted the app and moved on‚Ä¶ Bammm‚Ä¶ email comes in from Calm offering a discounted subscription. 

Ironically the most stressful thing in my day was this Calm app.
title: Ironic

review:
I have zero complaints and I absolutely love this app. I had some suggestions for the developers that I think could make it even better. I would love to be able to find my favorites faster and easier. Maybe a heart icon at the bottom of the screen, like next to the discover icon? 
Also, have you considered adding a little daily challenge that users can accept? Something simple like ‚Äúhave your fav herbal tea‚Äù, ‚Äútake a 15 min walk‚Äù, ‚Äúwatch the sunrise or sunset‚Äù etc. You could have a time limit to finish the challenge and an option to post a photo as ‚Äúproof‚Äù. I think this would be a lot of fun and make it more interactive. And finally, I would love a daily journal prompt along with the others. Something thought-provoking and a little bit deeper than the other gratitude and reflection prompts. 
Again, I love using this app and it has really changed my thought processes and put me more in tune with my emotions. Great job!
title: Love this!

review:
Hello, I‚Äôm a 21 years old young male adult. 

(Jeff Warren, I think when calm sees the review they‚Äôll show it to.)

I personally have to thank you, then calm of course. 

I was a 20 year old male living in Long Island, NY Hispanic; very normal life, ‚Äúcool kid‚Äù, stable family, with honesty a very good life I would say. But I was t happy, I was in a very bad relationship that left me suicidal, where I actually got to the point of considering it many times and even in a way attempt it. Not only that but I felt very out of my mind. I didn‚Äôt like my life, I did the 30 days session and I felt like a different individual; thank you again, this helped me understand so much about myself and who I was. It gave me awards of me, to the point that I wanted it all to change, I became very emotionally aware and left my relationship, spoke to my family about who I was, then moved to Miami with little money and now I‚Äôm much happier even though I‚Äôve been alone for a year and no sex. I can say that I‚Äôm also making much more money doing something I enjoy more, and I can say it‚Äôs changing for the better. I still have fun as now I‚Äôm 21 and I‚Äôm living in the ‚Äúnormal world‚Äù but very much self conscious about everything and every decision I make. This has helped a lot in me feeling like Im very capable in life and enjoy it so much more. Thank you again for helping people. I was lucky enough to have tried it and recommend it to everyone.
title: How this app changed my Life.

review:
I like the app and have had it for a week so far and the layout is easy to navigate. The only downside is that you can‚Äôt put anything in your queue to play. For instance if you do a 15 minute mediation and want sleep sounds to play during the night, you have to go back in your phone after meditation to choose the sleep sound and manually start it. It seems counter productive to me to have to go back into your phone after a sleep meditation to play sleep sounds. If this app would allow users to put things in a queue to play more than one meditation without having to break the practice or to play a sleep sound after meditation without breaking practice by allowing users to use a queue, it would be perfect. Especially since we‚Äôre paying so much for this app and it‚Äôs not necessarily cheap. Otherwise has
great features and numerous different options for a tranquil experience
title: Great but missing some features

review: This use to be my favorite app and I even talked some friends into using it. However I wouldn‚Äôt suggest it anymore. The new layout has taken all the categories away. It is now difficult to use. It‚Äôs hard to find anything specific. It is completely unorganized. I can‚Äôt imagine a newbie having to get started on it. It‚Äôs truly horrible. I bought a lifetime subscription a couple years ago but I may move on to something else, something well organized and easy to find content. This new layout is awful and I don‚Äôt want to struggle to find content. I‚Äôm disappointed as well as angry because this was totally unnecessary. They‚Äôve done this a couple of times now and have never been able to do better than the original well-organized, easy to find content due to clearly labeled categories layout. I do not suggest this app anymore. You won‚Äôt find anything Calm any longer.
title: Just rolled out a horrible new layout

review:
First let me say that while some reviews have requested more diverse voices for the daily meditations, In my case, I wish Tamara‚Äôs voice was used for everything including sleep stories as it‚Äôs the perfect formula to center me. I don‚Äôt know what it is, but her sleep stories put me to sleep in seconds.

I could write a lengthy review, but to summarize, this app brings me to center when I use it every time. I am someone who is always analyzing everything, wakes up in the middle of the night stressed about work or bills or family things, and misses the quiet within myself. I generally have difficulty sleeping through the night. But when I commit to mediations and sleep stories, it completely does the trick. It‚Äôs unbelievable, and I was a disbeliever before a friend recommended meditation with a different app which led me to Calm. It has so many tools to calm and center me so that I can sleep, be more effective at work, be happier in relationships, and be at peace within myself.
title: Found my center and my sleep

review: I‚Äôve had a couple of different doctors recommend Calm and finally decided to try it. I‚Äôve had chronic insomnia since childhood and was very skeptical, so I was pleasantly surprised with the results. The sleep stories are my favorite feature, but I often find that the story ends just as I‚Äôm drifting off, so I have to start another one, which completely wakes me up again. The anthologies have been great since they are longer and I‚Äôm more likely to be fully asleep when they end. Can we please have more long stories or anthologies?? Or could you develop a feature that allows me to queue several stories so I don‚Äôt have to manually start another?? If that feature already exists, please tell me how to find it and use it!! To those who complain about the cost...if you really cared about good sleep and how it benefits your health, you would think $5 a month is a bargain!! That‚Äôs what most of us pay for a generic prescription med to help us sleep!
title: Love Calm - can we have more anthologies please?

review: So, I have had a difficult time sleeping ALLüëè MYüëè LIFE! When I decided to try Calm, I was a bit skeptical because I had tried so many different apps, skills, and techniques in the past, and NOTHING worked. I was still up for HOURS at a time each and every night, and waking up with 5-6 hours of sleep each and every morning. When I downloaded Calm, I did not have the membership. I was a bit disappointed with how little I could do, and how expensive the membership was. But the investment was worth it! The sleep stories and meditations have me asleep in 30 minutes TOPS (with the help of some anti-anxiety and sleep pills). I also have depression and anxiety, and the guided meditations are amazing! Every morning, I stretch with the guided stretches, and I do the Daily Calm and check-ins each day. No matter how dedicated to mindfulness and meditation you would like to be, this app is worth your time and money. I feel so much happier and more well-rested. I give an 11/10!
title: 100% YES!!

review:
As a lifetime user of calm I have a request to make. Please allow users to make their own sleep story playlists. I have certain sleep stories that I really enjoy however, I sometimes don't fall asleep before the story is over.  Having to engage with my phone when the story ends and encounter the "Still Awake? Choose another sleep story." screen mentally causes me to have to become alert enough to find another of my favorite stories and completely unravels the progress I've made to try and fall asleep.  I know you have curated playlists but I have my favorites and would like to create a variety of personalized playlists according to my preferences.  I also have sleep stories for my young son and would love to create playlists that include his favorites as well, which are much different from my own.  

This would be a great selling point for me and others to share with friends and family who do not currently use Calm.  I would greatly appreciate it if you implemented this feedback.

Calm regards.
title: Need customizable user playlists!

review: Before using this app, I was going through a bad breakup and had anxiety, panic attacks and this constant fear of the future. I also had trouble sleeping at night because of intrusive thoughts. I was lucky to get 3 hours of sleep. I‚Äôve never been this emotionally wounded before. I called multiple emotional support crisis lines because I was just trying to hang on until my next appointment with my therapist. This kind lady recommended the Calm app. It‚Äôs $70 a year (equivalent to a Starbucks drink a month) and it was so worth it. I didn‚Äôt see improvement right away, but I tried out the mediation exercises and it seriously helped me out a lot. I never really knew how to mediate, but this app taught me how to manage my thoughts and strengthen my mind. I use Calm every night and every morning and it seriously works. I believe the meditation & calming anxiety exercises worked out better for me than anything else.
title: Great for anxiety and depression

review:
You want the program to exude calm before sleep, yet many of your stories just do not meet your goals.  The Dragon Story is an excellent example of missing the mark. As a Counselor,  it is not a relaxing story at all. It depands attention, visualization that is mysteriously dark and it simply misses the mark on helping anyone reach a stage of calm. If you are serious about helping those prepare fir sleep you MUST make major changes. Changed must include the following: 
1. Have a Relaxation Exercise that emphasizes breathing techniques, Walk Through the Relaxation Exercises step-by-step. Never ask your users to automatically do them.
2. Get Rid of telling stories. You are forcing people to listen and the idea is to Turn Off the brain so slumber can flow.
3. Slow down music! Have you ever considered watching a yoga session or other relaxation programs offered at parks or recreation facilities? They are slow moving and quiet. Use that as your inner movement.
4. Look at your fabulous name, ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù. DO NOT GIVE UP. YOU WILL DO THIS! I will be in the midst of writing my book. If you would like to set up a meeting, please let‚Äôs discuss a date after 12/02
title: Focus on you Mission and Nessage

review:
I am normally get tired of sponsored adds, but I was going through a breakup. I saw calm on an add and then looked a little into it. My girlfriend, now an ex, passed away shortly after I started my meditation journey. I tried to do it every day but through mourning it was hard to motivate myself to put the work in. 

Over time I continued making myself do it. Not constantly, but consistently. I did it when I felt unsettled or off center. I never understood this feeling until I stated meditation. Now I am able to recognize this feeling and address it with myself in the moment. I cannot express how much this app has held my hand throughout the grief.

I am grateful for the peace I find in meditation. Calm gave me a beginners guide to meditation and continues to guide my mind. It‚Äôs worth the money of course. It‚Äôs also worth sharing with your friends and family. Calm is a great app that shares a great purpose.
title: Right place at the right time

review:
I started off years ago using Calm and paying monthly. I now have a lifetime subscription and that was the best investment.
I‚Äôm in the habit of waking up in the morning and meditating with Daily Calm, then journaling within the app (check-ins and gratitude practice). I often use sleep stories (I have quite a few favorites) when I have trouble falling asleep. Short nap time stories are perfect for me when I want a refreshing daytime break. I also use various music options for different times of the day and moods I‚Äôm in.
There are new features added to the app on a regular basis so I know I‚Äôll never run out of fresh content. I have yet to try Daily Movement (Yoga and stretching). And the app has more to offer.
I find myself recommending Calm App to everyone for a lot of different reasons. And as a subscriber I can gift 30days of free app usage to anyone interested in trying it out. A very cool feature!
title: Constant Life Companion

review: My toddler likes the Thomas the tank meditations. I got the premium subscription for $70 a year out of desperation to get my kiddo to sleep. Apparently I was pretty sleep deprived myself because I bought it twice, as explained by the company representative. One under the App Store and one online with an email. When I asked if she could stop one of them, she ghosted me. I still can‚Äôt seem to cancel one of them, and the other had been paid for the year anyway. It was one day until the free trial ended, and the rep refused to help me. Regardless of the content, which I don‚Äôt personally find helpful, I think ethically the company should not take advantage of people like that. I‚Äôve led groups on mindfulness meditation for years as a therapist, and I think this content is just okay. Search for mindfulness meditations and lots of free videos will pop up. Or try reading or listening to real mindfulness like jon kabat-zin. Glad some people find this app useful, but I wish I‚Äôd never signed up. Paying for two premium subscriptions I barely use (and the one I can‚Äôt find auto renews!), feeling duped.
title: Charging me premium twice despite requests to stop

review: First off, I would like to say everyone is different and how this app effects them may vary. In my experience though it has helped me so much with my anxiety. It‚Äôs helped me sleep better and just feel much better about myself. I was struggling the last couple months with anxiety and it was causing me panic attacks and I started to get full blown insomnia. For two weeks I had totaled at 8 and a half hours of sleep the whole week (not one night). My cousin gifted me a yearly subscription for this app and genuinely have never been more grateful. If you have the resources to spend on this app and you really need it, I would definitely recommend giving it a chance. If you don‚Äôt have the money I‚Äôm not sure what the free version is like but it may be good. And a word of advice, also use resources outside the app for help as well! You got this and stay strong!
title: Genuinely did Not Expect such Great Results

review:
I love you. But please either let us make playlists or at least elect to have a soundscape start after the story ends (or run in the background at the same time, or whatever) so that I don‚Äôt get awakened by my air conditioner compressor kicking on or the neighbor‚Äôs dog barking and have to fumble with starting up rain on car windows or brown noise or whatever. 

My kids and I rely heavily on your app for entertainment/comfort as we drift off and background noise while we sleep, and at the steep subscription cost, I feel like I should either be able to select something to automatically come on after Erik Braa or Nick Offerman‚Äôs warm hug of a voice has rocked me to sleep. The playlists you have are not set up for 30-45 minutes of story and then 8 hours of soundscapes. Please make that change or give us the ability to request specific playlists. It would make my evenings and my kids‚Äô sleep much better.
title: Love the stories/soundscapes, hate lack of playlist or default soundscape for after story ends

review:
This is a great overall app. The stories for kids are amazing, the breathing techniques are great, etc. all the good things you have read from all of the other reviews. 

One of the reasons I download the app was to combat insomnia. I wake up in the middle of the night and find the sleep meditations helpful for drifting back to sleep. This got frustrating quickly because the voice of the narrator for 90% of the sleep meditations is wildly irritating. She sounds like a caricature of a dame from the 40‚Äôs. Her voice is fine if I‚Äôm not trying to fall asleep, but it is terrible at 3 in the morning. There‚Äôs no option to filter out specific narrators and she seems to be the primary voice for sleep. 

I know that sounds, including voices, land differently for everyone, so you may find her voice soothing, or at least not mind it. I am hoping that new narrators and other options are added under sleep meditations.
title: Canceled subscription because of Tamara Levitt‚Äôs voice

review:
I haven‚Äôt had this app very long. I have been trying to justify the purchase. I finally decided that my sanity was worth it. 
There‚Äôs no app out there to compare to this one, in how much research, thought, time and love that was put into the creation. The creators are constantly adding to it with more and more features and I am learning to meditate at age 63!
 I am finding that my life has become calmer (no pun intended), and definitely more focused on the wonderful things this life has to offer. I very much look forward to using this app each day‚Ä¶.sometimes several times a day, to center my well-being and be taken away to a place that I can only imagine. If you‚Äôre debating on whether or not to spend a little money on yourself to improve your life, go ahead! You‚Äôre worth it! Believe me, the people in your life will want to know where to send their thank you notes!
title: Breath Taking

review: Buyers of this app will not be displeased at the wealth of available stories, meditations, soundscapes, etc. The app truly pays for itself in one year. My Quip with the developers is about the structure of the app itself. The ease of use is 1000% more accesible from the locked version. The ability to navigate between soundscapes, sleep stories, meditations is more easily searched and thoroughly categorized. Obviously it is locked and I can‚Äôt listen to those items, but I can find them in an instant. Not sure if this is purposeful to get people to buy your app. I‚Äôd like to think that‚Äôs not true but in my experience the app is more difficult to navigate after purchase. Please try to make the experience more seamless for customers who decide to invest in their wellness and in your app. I believe the developers can make this a smoother transition from free app to purchased content. Thank you for your time and for existing. üïâÔ∏è
title: Love Calm but won‚Äôt renew for another year.

review: I tried this app with very little expectation about whether meditation was going to do anything for me. In fact, I was just curious when I downloaded it to begin with. What I‚Äôve received has been so much more than I could have imagined. Learning to meditate with the resources inside was easy and tremendously beneficial to me. I had been looking for new ways to experience what it means to be present and mindful for more than 18 months when tried meditation. A year after using it, and now I cannot imagine a world where at some point during my day I don‚Äôt just stop in all the busyness and just ‚Ä¶ be. Through meditation I‚Äôm still learning that to be fully human, you must be fully present. And no matter what I‚Äôm going through, good or bad, I‚Äôm my best when I am just present in the moment. Thank you for the gift of meditation. Thank you for helping me be the my best self.
title: One year later!

review: I highly recommend downloading the app "Calm." Right now, I get to wake up after a long week and take a bath while listening to a woman with a Scottish accent softly speak about "Scotland's Hidden Hideaways." The whole app offers deep breathing exercises, meditation tracks and "sleep stories," which I don't always just use for sleep but for relaxing. Not selling anything just really enjoy this app. I often listen to the rain sound while sleeping and I love the sense of love and support I get in the stories. The meditation is nice too. My only suggestions: -Have a fast forward option for sleep stories -have categories in stories like read by male/female and have time categories (some are 30 min some are 12, would like them sorted) -have stories separated that don't necessary have to be for "sleep" but just for relaxation -add some more breathing patterns Love it, thank you! ^_^
title: Download Calm Now!

review:
I‚Äôm in my 70s now , and always another problem each day. Last few years it has been health problems for either husband or me. I got a startling surprise just in the last week about my health. Thank the Good Lord I subscribed to CALM about two weeks ago. I‚Äôm not real familiar with it yet, but the past nights I have gotten some wonderful calming, refreshing sleep! Not a miracle, but much welcomed sleep. Usually when something is bothering me, I toss all night‚Ä¶. But is finding comfort and help by using calm. I‚Äôm so glad I subscribed to it! 
    I have it on my iPad‚Ä¶. I find it difficult to remember to take the iPad upstairs at night and downstairs every morning. Does anyone know of a solution that would not be too expensive? I have a kindle, is it possible to use my Calm subscription on two devices? I‚Äôm not sure the kindle would be sufficient. Any ideas would be appreciated.
title: I need Calm so Badly!

review: Iv been using this app for about a year now. Super helpful throughout pandemic!! Initially started using to help with sound at night to fall asleep. But now I love the sleep stories so much. The Exploring Ireland is played regularly in the evening and I now plan to go Ireland some day bc of the story. I use the  playlist during my yoga/stretching after a work out to calm down and relax and I‚Äôm obsessed!!  So highly recommend bc of the content! 5/5 stars! I gave it a 3 though over all bc it‚Äôs a very slow app. I‚Äôll have full service every and other app works great on my phone but the loading time with Calm App is so slow  compared to other apps on my phone..sometime I‚Äôll just end up turning it off bc it never loads no matter the WiFi or LTE I‚Äôm on... now idk if it‚Äôs my service or the app sometimes.  I‚Äôd give it 5 stars if the app was fast in loading time.
title: Love love content but slow slow service

review:
I‚Äôve been using calm since the start of my meditation journey around 4 years ago. It is an incredible tool to have in my back pocket. As a supplement to day-to-day life, it brings grounding, peace, and it helps me tap into my own sense of security. 

Since my first interaction with the app, there has been so much refinement. The content is more organized, adaptable, and influential. It is inclusive to a large scope of ages, and there are so many unique voices that this platform holds. I appreciate the racial and cultural inclusivity that it brings into the hands of its users as well. It‚Äôs really refreshing to work with a platform where I feel seen, and to know that others are being acknowledged in the same way.

Besides the daily practices, the music and soundscapes are my favorite aspects of the app. I look forward to participating on this platform as its evolution continues. Grateful for Calm :)
title: Add it to your toolbox

review: I‚Äôve never spent much money on an ap before, and I love this one so much I just forked over the money to get this one for life. I‚Äôm looking at it as an investment in my health. I love this one because it‚Äôs got everything I need to help me manage my anxiety and sleep better. I‚Äôm also a psychotherapist and use it often with my clients (just yesterday in fact). The music, meditations, education on meditation and sleep are all of excellent quality. I just open the ap and my body knows to calm down. I also love that it‚Äôs on my phone so it‚Äôs always accessible to me when I need it. The only thing I‚Äôd like calm folks is some kind of directory or search function. I‚Äôll send an email to you with more details...another thing I like is that there customer service folks are responsive and helpful. If you‚Äôre struggling with anxiety, worry, racing thoughts, sleep problems, this ap will help you!
title: LOVE This Ap

review:
I really liked this app at first. Eventually, I got bored of it. It‚Äôs cumbersome to find something I want versus what it thinks I want. I like Sleep Stories but more and more of them are sleep stories for children. Seriously, people only use this because they don‚Äôt want to bond with their children by reading them bedtime stories? The stories should be to help get adults to sleep. 

Just after I wasted $70 on another yearly subscription, the app suddenly will not keep playing a soundscape when I lock my phone. How is this useful? I am not going to leave my phone unlocked all night when I am trying to sleep. I love the Rain on Leaves soundscape but the app refuses me to use it to get to sleep now.

The app used to go back to the Sounscape after a sleep story. Now it‚Äôs silence. If your using the app to cover other noise, it‚Äôs now incapable of doing so. I just canceled (although I am out for over 11 months of the subscription) and deleted the app again. This is the third time I‚Äôve tried to give the app a chance.
title: No Longer Keeps Playing When I Lock My Phone

review:
Edit: reducing to 3 stars until this stops randomly playing scenes in the background. I reached out to support and have not seen a reply. Has been over a month.

Calm has become a huge part of my life. I‚Äôm on my 2nd year of my subscription and I am not looking back. I have grown substantially personally since starting this journey, and every day I deepen my understanding of my mind and how I view and interact with the world. I find Calm to be a blessing and it is regularly in my list of gratitudes. I think this is my most frequently recommended app, as it is the ultimate mental knife sharpener. You can better almost any aspect of your life with a daily sit. This may be the longest app review I‚Äôve ever written, and that‚Äôs because it‚Äôs warranted. I wish I could give this app 10 stars as it is a life changer and I am eternally grateful for the course adjustments it has helped me make in my life.
title: My daily routine

review: I don‚Äôt know what I‚Äôd do without this app. I‚Äôm a life long somewhat insomniac that cannot fall asleep unless I have something that ‚Äúoccupies‚Äù my brain, so I can turn off all the junk I worry about. These stories are highly entertaining, and very interesting, yet calming at the same time. They‚Äôre also educational! I‚Äôve learned many things from around the world that I didn‚Äôt know before. Most nights I‚Äôm out after 2-5 minutes, but some take longer. If I wake up during the night, I simply start a new story and I‚Äôm asleep again. I have my favorite narrators too. I find that male voices with accents other than American (with the exception of Erik Brah and Alan Sklar) really lull me to sleep. I need a deep voice lol. Females with British, Asian, Indian accents are great for me too. There‚Äôs also calming nature sounds and spa music. I‚Äôve been using the Calm app for 2 years now and it never disappoints! Now I don‚Äôt have to reach for the Xanax anymore!
title: Calm to the rescue!

review:
I have been a paid subscriber for years, and, until this year, I would have said that this app is perfect for insomnia: 

Celebrity voices coupled with the technique of measured cadence and gradually diminishing volume are features that make this sleep aide unique and more effective than any of the many others that I‚Äôve tried.

I only wish there were a timer on the nature noise that comes in when the sleep story is finished,  as it is the ABSENCE of noise that eventually wakes me up in the morning, like the opposite of an alarm. I use silence as my alarm on another app and it works splendidly, and is not nerve wracking, like an alarm would be.

However, after years of satisfaction, an noticeable issue has come to my attention: More and more of the sleep stories are of a religious nature. At first the sleep stories were fantastic: funny stories, fairie tales, travelogues, poetry, even some to BORE you to sleep, like someone reading the rules of cricket! LOL 

But, for some reason, writings are containing more and more religious content and I‚Äôm starting to feel like I‚Äôm in a class on Religions of the World, when I‚Äôm trying to go to sleep. This falls into the category of ‚Äúpersuasive rhetoric ‚Äú and my brain is busy analyzing my own opinion s on the theology or philosophy that is presented, keeping me from resting.
