Could we please just have stories that our brains will not be analyzing for truth?
title: Top of the line, but...

review:
The ads I‚Äôve seen for this app are heavily centered around assisting people going to sleep, so it‚Äôs odd that 10 minutes of searching lead to only finding 3 sleep stories on the free version. I don‚Äôt care to go through every album to count how many are available, but it‚Äôs pathetic that it requires extensive searching to find one. 
I even re-downloaded the when I was coming to write a review the first time because there were reviews shaming other reviews for ‚Äúnot looking hard enough‚Äù for the unlocked content. I‚Äôm now convinced that those reviews were forged by the developers, or they were looking for something other than a sleep app. 
When you start the app and go to the home page, it presents a variety of different tracks - and every one of the was locked but a motivational talk by LeBron James. At this point, I‚Äôm just typing to be typing; this app is a joke, I have no intentions of paying $70 a YEAR (not by months?) for an app that won‚Äôt let me preview what I‚Äôm getting. 
^Yeah, I could do the 1 week trial, but if I don‚Äôt cancel in time then I‚Äôm out $70 üëéüëéüëéüëé
title: Fueled by greed, 99.9% behind a paywall

review: The first time I tried calm was the first time I tried to learn meditation in general.  I practiced this skill while trying to stay sober last time.  I more or less missed the point.  Prior to my last sober date (still going strong) I revisited the practice as well as the app.  This time instead of trying to force meditation on myself and getting angry when my surroundings through me out of focus I let the teachings of Jeff and this app sink in more and approach the practice with a more easy going approach.  The skill of meditation takes alot of practice to make it a part of you, but it is well worth the time and effort put in.  My short term memory isn‚Äôt so hot and Im loaded with triggers, but Calm guides me in my practice and is priceless when my anxious takes over.  This is well worth it and may become one of the best things you have ever done for yourself, please try.
title: It takes practice

review: I fall asleep within 10 minutes every time I play a sleep story! I have been using the Calm app for several years now and absolutely love it. It used to be really hard for me to fall asleep because my mind would constantly be thinking (unless I was extremely exhausted), and have the calm app to thank. There are so many sleep stories to choose from by several different narrators so you can find your favorites. They update with new stories regularly, which is awesome. They also have a calm kids section which helps our little ones to fall asleep before the story is over! We also enjoy the daily meditations. I can‚Äôt say enough good things and always recommend this app to everyone. It‚Äôs so relaxing. Thank you!! Keep being amazing!! Definitely worth the money too, especially the lifetime rate with the 60% discount!!
title: Absolutely love and recommend!

review:
This app came to me at a crucial time when I was cooped up at home after an injury. Not only did it help me cope with the challenges that came with recuperation and help me sleep, it also brought me back to a practice that was once a big part of my life: meditation! And so to say that I am grateful for this app would be an understatement. 

In addition to the daily calm and daily wisdom, I have found that I can only resonate to a few favorite voices in the sleep stories that I find more soothing versus others that can sometimes sound a little too peppy in intonation, though I understand it‚Äôs just a matter of preference and my own temperament, so it‚Äôs all fair game. To each his own! 

All that said, I have a few suggestions:
1) how about a Tibetan chant option for meditation? 
2) some wisdom series recording pace tends to be a little fast‚Äîcan you not alter the recording, please? It‚Äôs nice to listen to the voices in their natural cadence, but slowed down a bit, maybe? 
3) can you add more Cillian Murphy and Jerome Flynn recordings, please? (I love that you added Eva Green!) 
4) the Jay Shetty pieces are too short! I know they‚Äôre meant to be quickies but I really wish they were longer‚Äîat least with the same duration as the daily calm, which I also wish would be more like 15 or even 20 minutes. 

Thank you!!!
title: Love it, and some suggestions too!

review: I have been a Calm subscriber for perhaps a year and a half now. I love using the sleep stories, especially to help me back to sleep after a middle of the night waking. I have two main sources of frustration & it all relates to the kids‚Äô stories. It seems like 75% of what is being released at this point is geared toward kids. I can see how it would be a great resource for parents, but for those users that don‚Äôt use sleep stories for their children it‚Äôs a lot of useless content. I also find it annoying that there is no apparent way to filter out kids stories, whether browsing thought the ‚Äúall sleep stories‚Äù page or in the recommended stories areas. I also occasionally find it difficult to differentiate which stories are geared towards kids unless I listen to part of the story. I love using calm, but it‚Äôs getting more difficult to justify the continued expense when it‚Äôs no longer catering to my demographic. Perhaps a separate calm kids app would be helpful.
title: Love it, but‚Ä¶

review: I have the paid version, and particularly like the sleep stories. They work so well, I usually fall asleep before the story ends. Problem is, I might wake up again a few hours later and want to pick up the story where I left off. But instead, I see the ‚ÄúStill Awake?‚Äù pop-up window suggesting other stories I might try, or maybe a meditation, and a pop-up asking if I‚Äôd like to rate that session, keep track of streaks and stats, etc. No, I‚Äôd really just like to find the sleep story I was listening to, but it has vanished from my screen. Now I‚Äôve got to sit up in bed, grab my reading glasses, X out of the intrusive pop-ups, and scroll through to re-find the sleep story that was snatched away from me....leaving me not at all calm, but instead, annoyed and anxious, and now unable to fall back to sleep. Can you please provide a way to turn off these very unhelpful ‚Äúhelpful suggestions‚Äù and gamification features? For me, they are defeating the entire purpose of this app, to CALMLY fall asleep.
title: Fewer Intrusive Pop-Ups, Please

review: This is the best meditation app I‚Äôve tried. I use it 1‚Äì2 times a day. Great mix of content and teachers for different moods, goals, and time commitments. While the sleep meditations work for me, I find the sleep stories with celebrity narration too distracting and gimmicky to fall asleep to, but I know others users for whom this is their favorite feature. Calm offers a series of sequential programs for mindfulness skill-building: ‚Äú7 Days of ______,‚Äù where the next day‚Äôs content unlocks with the completion of the previous day‚Äôs. As a paying user, I wish there were a way to override this. I once exited a minute early, when the wrap-up was nearly over, because I had to leave, and the app made me redo that day to access the next meditation. Similarly, I just updated versions and lost three days‚Äô progress in a program. I think the only way to catch up is to let them play out with the volume off, which is a waste of time and energy.
title: Helps with sleep & stress [attn devs]

review: I‚Äôve been using this app on and off for a few days now, but each time I use it, I‚Äôve always had a positive experience with it. I‚Äôve only utilized the features that weren‚Äôt locked behind a paywall, but so far, I will say that this experience has been beneficial to ease my mind of stress and anxiety. It‚Äôs often stated that meditation helps reduce anxiety, and I can definitely agree with that statement. When you have racing thoughts and/or negative thoughts in general, a moment to relax, slow things down, and focus on yourself may be just what you need. One thing that I want to mention, but couldn‚Äôt fit it anywhere else, is that when I opened the app, there was calming music in the background that would fade when you closed out of it. I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll pay for a subscription, but what I‚Äôve experienced so far is worth it for relaxation and decompressing after a long day.
title: Good, even without a subscription!

review:
First a confession - I have no use for meditation. 
But it only took 10‚Äô of exploring this app and I LOVE it!   I found the sleep stories and the soundscapes. Oh wow!!!!! So relaxing - totally unwound my day in about 5‚Äô. 
    There are so many different approaches to calm in this app with music and learnings and stories and soundscapes and motivational talks and‚Ä¶.something for everyone! 
   I do have a developer request: would you consider adding a schedule into the music/soundscapes?  I‚Äôd love to set the timer to turn it off in an hour and then have it automatically come back on between 2 and 4 am for example. Until then, I‚Äôll just keep the app hit the timer again when I wake up too many hours before the alarm. 
   Thanks for a creative and varied approach to Calm ‚Äî all in one great app to fit the mood of the moment ‚Äî sweet sighs & deep breaths üíïüòäüíï
title: Immediately fell in love with this app!!

review: Love this app so much. It is so great that they have a meditation for such specific topics like emotions, stress, anxiety, etc. I‚Äôve also learned some good wisdom through the content for specific situations like grief etc. that got me unstuck a few times. Reached a point once using this app where I felt complete peace for a few days, which is unheard of from me, who has a lot of inner noise. Just one small critique though, the new Main Menu‚Äôs UX is quite anxiety inducing, it‚Äôs too much info at once. I find the layout a little ironic since one of the use cases are to get a quick meditation for anxiety. You get greeted with so much info on the first page alone, that I stopped using the main menu and just search or stumble around. The previous layout was so much clearer and better organized. I get that there is more content, but maybe there is a cleaner and more intuitive way. Please consider.
title: Great content (home page overwhelming)

review: I have always had trouble with anxiety and sometimes that affects my sleep. I normally listen to nature podcasts, or music before I go to bed. Calm is all of that and more, not to mention MUCH better quality. There is a good selection of white noise, nature sounds, music, piano, guitar, and songs, that are all great for falling asleep, or just for calming down. You can even have them play for as long as you want. There are meditations and breathing exercises that are worth listening to. There are also sleep stories that are good for kids that struggle falling asleep. This app is for all kinds of people, I think anyone would be able to find something on this app that helps them in one way or another. They even have sounds for babies and pets! It is so, so, easy to navigate and it has truly helped me have a peaceful nights sleep.
title: Good app, I highly suggest!

review:
I love the scenery the ambience and the feel of the audio selections, especially through a speaker; because my phone speaker quality is a little lacking. The music is perfect to fall asleep to as well. I was meditating today using my favorite option, the timed meditation and afterwards had accidentally set a second as well, when it went off again I had an idea! What if you added a feature which allowed a loop? So that you could have an additional warning bell for those who meditate for hours at a time. I would personally really appreciate this option because I sometimes need an external reminder to come back to my body, 
(But it would be sad if this comes out as a feature only for Premium users because your monthly price is a little steep for me and I would really only use this feature)
title: Great App, Suggestions?

review: As we all know, stress is a major contributing factor to many health related ailments. I love this app because it provides me with invaluable tools for managing and lowering my stress levels.  The Breathing exercises contained within were game changers for me.  Of course I‚Äôve known about breathing exercises before, but this was different.  Immediately while doing my first breathing exercise, my sustained breaths felt like I was chanting a mantra as they drew in and out of my body slowly; steadily; rhythmically.  Set to a chorus of Himalayan sounding bowls, one can still hear the gentle yet haunting tune long after the session is over. In fact, I can, in a moment of solitude, draw upon the soundtrack within my mind and have a breathing session anytime and anywhere I desire.  All thanks to Calm.  If you don‚Äôt already have the app, get it!  Your mind, body and soul will thank you for it.
title: Life Saver 4 Sure!!

review:
I formerly rated this app as a 5, and the app itself is great. I have been a subscriber for YEARS and up until now I‚Äôve been ok with the price increases because I use this app more than any other, HOWEVER now that they‚Äôve taken away family share, I will reconsider. I am not CALM about being charged more for less. Apparently leadership at Calm has lost sight of their original core values and succumbed to the ilk of Silicon Valley greed.  I will begin my review of other options and likely not renew. 

Sadly, here was my last review‚Ä¶

I‚Äôve been a Calm customer for several years and I love it! My Calm app is with me throughout the day. I start my day with the Daily Meditation (and days that I don‚Äôt, I find I‚Äôm not as positive and prepared to face challenges), I listen to the music options while I work, and often end my day with a Sleep Story. As an entrepreneur, working to get a start up business off the ground, its important for me to find ways to keep myself grounded, and some days, my Calm app is the only thing helping me do that.
title: Changing my review‚Ä¶

review: ‚ÄúA resource to help people‚Äù that‚Äôs what I thought CALM was. And so, reluctant to seek emotional help because it‚Äôs such a personal issue, I turned to this app. And because I don‚Äôt have the means to purchase the app I have no access to their help. There is such a refreshing trend of prioritizing mental health in this age. But that‚Äôs half of the battle to actually helping people. I‚Äôm sure this app has good intentions but there will be no change in the epidemic of mental health issues so long as help is unattainable for ALL people who need it, not just those that can pay. If I had the means, I‚Äôd pay for a therapist. But those who lack the means to meet with someone are also left behind in such an accessible app that has such capability to make a difference. So my review: I feel very hungry for the help that this app offers and I feel truly left behind. I am sorry for the many others who I‚Äôm sure have come here searching for help, as I did, only to find help (once more) unattainable. Do we care about actually helping people? Or do we care only about hooking people?
title: Are we helping people or hooking people?

review:
I debated getting the subscription, but I am glad I did.  As a retiree, there is little that I am anxious about, but I am having trouble losing weight. I had hoped there would be more in this app to help me with that. There are 5 minute movement sessions that get me active in the morning, but I wish there were more to address the psychological aspects via meditation.

That said, I am finding more and more to appreciate in this app. I have an active brain that won‚Äôt often settle down when it should. The sleep stories are excellent for bedtime, with gentle voices, well-chosen words, and a length that are perfect to lull one into dreamland.

I believe this is an excellent app for emotional recovery from this pandemic and world events. So many people seem to have had problems adjusting to the isolation and sudden life-style changes. The frustration and anger might be eased with daily meditations as included here.
title: One thing (and star) lacking

review: App Review (Calm App)- Braxton A. So, for the past week I have been using the clam app to reduce my anxiety. I liked the fact every time I went into the app that they asked how I was doing. Within this app they have many mediation options to calm anxiety. The first day there is a 3-minute mediation, the second day it is 5 minutes, the third day it is 10 minutes, and the time increases by 5 every day until on the seventh day the time is 30 minutes. This app is a good app to treat generalized anxiety disorder. Generalized anxiety disorder is an excessive form of anxiety and can be followed by uncountable physical symptoms like muscle tension, restlessness being easily fatigued, difficulty concentrating, etc. This app is a great way to reduce anxiety because the mediation that occurs throughout the seven days helped me feel more relaxed and I did not have as much tension as I normally do.
title: App Review Braxton.A

developerResponse: {'id': 21407217, 'body': 'So sorry for the trouble you\'ve experienced! Please try leaving the app open on the loading screen, as this should allow the app to fully load. Upon subsequent app launches, the app should then load normally without any delay on the "take a deep breath" screen. If you are experiencing issues on an older version of the iOS app, please update to the latest version, then follow the steps above if you experience any loading issues.', 'modified': '2021-03-02T20:32:20Z'}
review: I‚Äôve never written a review in my life, probably because I‚Äôve never been so disappointed about a product that I love so much (should be loved). It‚Äôs been a week plus since the latest update came out, that‚Äôs ample time to fix or go back one update to where a higher volume of your customers had access. Yes, in the past there was the occasional issue (once a month, if that), but nothing like this where the screen is stuck on ‚Äútake a deep breath.‚Äù I like so many have been a subscriber for several years and have used Calm religiously every night (it allowed to get off of sleep-aid medication), but now I am having to find other means to fall asleep. If you don‚Äôt hurry up and fix the app, you may be losing another longtime customer who has praised you and promoted you several times over!!
title: Disappointed

review:
I get premium content through Kaiser insurance (which has been the best part of their mental health services, but that‚Äôs a different review....). 

I am so incredibly grateful for it because I‚Äôve been using it for the past two months and it took me out a depressive episode. 

Jeff Warren‚Äôs content keeps me around. It‚Äôs because of his 30 day course that I‚Äôve finally established a meditation practice after years of sincere attempts. His approach is very human and relatable; I find sessions with his recordings much more fruitful since he sandwiches the nuggets of clarity between quiet moments. I‚Äôm able to ease into the session, instead of being urged into quietness then being lectured by Tamara..maybe that works for other people but it‚Äôs inaccessible to me. 

I also use the children‚Äôs meditations with my five year old daughter and the sleep stories when she‚Äôs having a hard time sleeping. I‚Äôm glad to share this experience and skill with her. I was fortunate to have an elementary school teacher show me how powerful meditation and journaling was at an early age, but didn‚Äôt have a way to reintroduce it into my adult life AND share it with my daughter till now. 

I used Insight Timer for awhile but was overwhelmed by the features and endless options. I like that this is more curated and it‚Äôs lucky Jeff Warren‚Äôs content is so appealing to me.
title: thank you Kaiser

review: I have been using this app to fall asleep when I need a reliable source of comforting white noise for a few years now. It‚Äôs not something that I use all the time but it‚Äôs something I come back to on those occasions when I can‚Äôt sleep. Recently, when I needed my song that helps me fall asleep every once in a while, I went into the app to find it LOCKED for the first time EVER. When I clicked on it to try and play the song, (water falling by Kip Mazuy in ‚Äúnature melodies‚Äù) a pop up comes up talking about a 7 day free trial and then a monthly payment after that. Unacceptable. You can‚Äôt just take something that has been free for years and then all of a sudden make it into a paid service. I know it‚Äôs a small issue but I am livid about this. I literally cannot believe this. You have taken my only reliable song that puts me to sleep when melatonin won‚Äôt do the trick. I don‚Äôt know what I‚Äôm supposed to do now when I can‚Äôt sleep and need to. You people behind the app probably don‚Äôt care though. Obviously all you care about is your GD money.
title: Are you kidding me???

review: Who knew an app could be a life changer for me. I practice my daily calm in the mornings before anything else. The act of meditation has had a profound effect on me so much so that people have asked what I‚Äôve changed. I am less reactive, more thoughtful, and kinder to myself. I appreciate the new additions to the app in the daily section, I love the sleep stories, sound scapes and guided the meditations are wonderful. One thing I would love to see brought to the platform are more options for advancing my meditation practice- something like a little less guidance and longer than 10-12 minutes. Something else that would be amazing is if the app would interface with Alexa so I didn‚Äôt have to have my phone next to me all night. Even with my requests, I give it five stars. Thank you for guiding me towards awareness and inner peace.
title: Life Changing

review: I received a year‚Äôs subscription to Calm nearly 2 years ago, & am still enjoying the app. It became an oasis of serenity in a tumultuous world. There is a good selection of meditations, sleep stories, music, & more. The sleep stories work wonders! If I had one complaint, it would be that the selection of different people leading the meditations has declined. While I very much enjoy Tamara, I did appreciate the number of choices you offered in the past. One last note, it‚Äôs difficult to judge an app by comments of those who only use the free offerings of a paid app. Of course your choices will be limited. In order to pay to produce all the content & bring in more voices, they have to charge a fee. All the other good meditation apps do it as well. It‚Äôs just a fact that not everything on the internet can be free.
title: Excellent Mental Health App

review:
I have horrible sleep problems. I worked nights for a while and have always been a ‚Äúnight owl.‚Äù However, I have just moved in with my 94 yo grandfather and he feels put out if I‚Äôm up late and sleep in.( I am medically retired). 
I‚Äôve seen your ads and decided to try the app. When I pulled it up, there was NO PRICE ADVERTISED AT THE POINT OF DOWNLOAD. However there was a NOTATION that said ‚ÄúIn app purchases.‚Äù Which is extremely misleading!! 
And when you‚Äôre taken to the sign up page, it gives you a date to cancel prior to being charged, however doesn‚Äôt specify HOW to cancel at the point of sale. This would also be helpful so the customer can record that info in order to make a cancellation easier, if that‚Äôs what they choose to do.  
I would love to try the app but I don‚Äôt want to be in a position where I have to search for a way to cancel before being charged. Also, it states that I can cancel at any time. Does that mean that I will receive a prorated refund for the time that I don‚Äôt use??
title: Disappointed that the price was not clearly stated at time of download..

review:
Has some lovely calming images and sounds, and the unlocked bedtime story to which I listened had a a soothing voice. There many unlocked sessions I would like to hear and wish the owners would at least give a sample of the voice and then allow me to purchase the episode to own it, rather than requiring  a pricey (for me) yearly  subscription, for which the product is forever gone when it runs out. I know subscriptions are becoming the way of the world, but still I resist!  I do believe people should be paid for their work; I‚Äôd just like to be able to actually purchase a product; I would rate five stars if they would allow this. 

‚ÄúCalm‚Äù has a nice daily feature (one of the few push notifications I allow on my phone) which reminds me to stay in the moment, breathe, etc.   The app has some generous free offerings and I thank thank the developers for sharing these!
title: Wish I could buy some episodes

review: The Calm app is revolutionary. It combines a range of real human voices and storytelling techniques with cutting edge sonic therapy using music and incredibly immersive ambient soundscapes that truly shine when you pair them with good noise canceling headphones by Bose or similar brands. I was diagnosed with Level 1 bipolar disorder as an adult and needed very expensive medical care that fortunately was largely covered by my wonderful health care provider, Kaiser Permanente- who also provided me access to the Calm app. Since listening regularly to morning meditations by Tamara Levitt and her colleagues, along with outdoor exercise, a ketogenic diet, and limited medication, my mental clarity not only has returned to ‚Äúnormal‚Äù but actually has become optimized to a state I never experienced before. It‚Äôs like that great Bradley Cooper movie, Limitless. Except it‚Äôs better because this is real.
title: Sonic therapy for improved mental health focus and wellness

developerResponse: {'id': 32911018, 'body': 'Hi there, sounds like you are having trouble accessing the content. Please reach out to support at support@calm.com and we‚Äôd be happy to guide you to it.', 'modified': '2022-11-01T14:30:18Z'}
review:
I have had this subscription for 2 years.  We use it daily.  My kids love the sleep stories and the soundscapes for white noise.  I use the soundscapes every day too. 
But beware!  My credit card # was stolen and when it tried to auto renew, it couldn‚Äôt.  I had to go and do it with the new card number.  I have the charge that has cleared my card and I can access on my phone, but content is locked on both iPads.  You can‚Äôt call, you can only email.  Got a generic and unhelpful response but I followed instructions.  Content still locked.  Emailed again, generic response about how to renew.  Not helpful.  Deleted app and reinstalled, logged out and back in.  Content still locked.  I emailed again and asked for someone to call.  Got a message that they don‚Äôt have call support - only email. I dismally had to dispute the charge on my card when I couldn‚Äôt get any help after days of trying. 
Come on Calm.  Your app is too good for you to have such low rate, crappy support.
title: Terrible support

review: My wife and I have listened to CALM for well over 2 years. Cannot express how easy it is to fall asleep listening to this app. When she first started the app at night my thought was ‚ÄúYeah right‚Äù I‚Äôm going to listen to silly music and drift into dream land. After the first week I was sold. There are many Calm stories we have started off in listening in bed and sometimes takes several tries to stay awake to hear the end of it. Our recent story is with Keith Morrison that took 4 times to get to the end. The storyline is about Goldie Locks and how portage goes missing and a bed is slept in - this is a story where I wanted to laugh many times during his reading yet I didn‚Äôt want to wake up my wife. This is one of my favorite stories to date. He applies his investigation methods to the story as he does on Dateline - this is great!
title: A calmer sleep

review: I don‚Äôt usual leave reviews on apps but this one I couldn‚Äôt help. I need something to distract my mind and help me fall asleep or else I‚Äôm thinking about the day and things going on. Looking through the App Store I noticed this app had been downloaded in the past and I did not remember why it was deleted from my phone. Downloaded again and I remember why I deleted it‚Ä¶for a ‚Äúfree‚Äù app there is nothing free in the app itself. If you want to play anything you have to buy a subscription of 70$ a year. I don‚Äôt think it should even be labeled free in the App Store if you can‚Äôt even use it in the slightest. I was given the impression that even if there are in app purchases they at least have a lot of unlocked things to play, and then you pay more if it really benefits you and you‚Äôre interested in all the other things. That is usually how apps labeled free work. I would like to have a peaceful night sleep but I need to find something else. I don‚Äôt think I should have to pay so much just so I can sleep a little better.
title: Horrible and Misleading App

review: Amazing app. I use sleep stories every single night and my toddler uses the kids sleep stories at nap time. It‚Äôs so relaxing! I am actually excited to jump into bed at night because I get to listen to a story! I also use the ten minute daily calm meditations all the time! There is so much value in this one app- sleep stories, daily journaling, meditation, breathing exercises, and more! My one suggestion is to add more emotions to the daily check-ins. Most of the time I‚Äôm feeling an emotion and it‚Äôs not one of the choices. So I just have to pick one and make it work. For example, there‚Äôs no ‚Äúfrustrated,‚Äù ‚Äúguilty,‚Äù ‚Äúoverwhelmed,‚Äù ‚Äúsurprised,‚Äù ‚Äúshocked,‚Äù or ‚Äúcurious,‚Äù etc. I wish there were more emotion choices to better describe how I‚Äôm feeling. Otherwise, everything else is perfect! I love this app and I tell everyone I can about it. I would gladly pay $100/year for this app.
title: Amazing but one suggestion

review: I suffer from PTSD and nights are the worst, especially if it‚Äôs been a rough day.  My mind brings up trauma, worries and my anxiety gets my heart racing.  I used to end up putting on a podcast which helps but I stay awake to listen to the information.  I love this app bc there‚Äôs many options and genres of things to listen too, they all have calming voices and is interesting enough to keep my mind occupied but not keep me awake.  Then when I wake from a nightmare, I immediately push the start over button and I am usually able to get back to sleep before the anxiety wakes me up.  I like to listen to the master classes over and over again.  I change the actual topic every month or so but I find comfort in routine.  And I LOVE to learn!  Plus I can download my favs so I can still use it when I have no internet.
title: Life changing

review:
It seems that the creators of calm made every effort to complicate the use of the app to a point that they succeeded to increase my level of stress. They do not understand that an app should be simple, intuitive and uncomplicated . Everything seems counter- intuitive . Where do you stop the sound within the app . Til now I could not find how to stop the sound unless I quit the app .  
The app does not recognize that I paid for my subscription and keep on trying to sell me the product. It does not know  that  I am good to go and can use it . No , no no no , how can they figure out a way to torture you so they  will not let you get away that easy. You have to use a number of steps supposedly giving you choices , but they miss the point of simplifying its operation and   for me they succeeded to create a new level of stress I did not had before using the app. 
So for now, this app is a a good source of frustration and agitation . I hope the developers read these reviews and do something about it.
title: The opposite of what a stress reduction app should be

review: Best investment in my health I‚Äôve ever made. I am growing with Calm as it continues to evolve expanding its offerings for short guided meditations from morning . Jeff‚Äôs daily trip and Jays wisdom. After years I am using this in my life and starting to live my life from a conscious rather than default to the fears. Ego etc. and I can truly now say thanks to Calm I have a practice and feel calm more of the time. So impressed im going to try the yoga. Best of all through Dr Lopez‚Äôs practices to relate differently with migraines I am having significant improvement. This for me is a solution. To live differently. I can‚Äôt say enough of how I appreciate the calm team. I came here for help with sleep through the fabulous sleep stories. And can happily say as much as I love the train rides. I am loving my own journey even more now. Be well many blessings of peace and love
title: Life changing

review:
I am enjoying this app so much. It really helps me focus on the breath and not on things which cause anxiety and stress. I also love the sleep stories. Works so well that I have never heard the end of a story. I had rated it 4.5 because I was struggling with the cost and whether or not to pay for the full version. Since then I have decided that the benefits were worth the cost and paying the one time fee helped me not dwell on the cost every month. I have recommended it to many friends. 
   (I wrote this review a while ago and it still holds true. The only addition I would make is that to newcomers it may be a bit tricky to navigate the site and find exactly what you‚Äôre looking for, but they continue to make improvements and the improvements have been helpful.)
title: Recently upped to lifetime

review: This app has changed my life for the better. I knew nothing about mindfulness or meditation before this app. I mainly got the app for the sleep stories because I have issues sleeping at night and listening to audiobooks was helping. Only the type of audiobook would influence my sleep, so if it was scary or intense I‚Äôd have nightmares. I slept peacefully with the calm sleep stories. I had the app 2 years before I started using the meditation aspect of it. I can‚Äôt believe it took me so long! Jeff Warren is AMAZING!!! He guides you through meditation in a welcoming and relaxing way. I can‚Äôt imagine my life without him or meditation anymore. It‚Äôs made my life so much less stressful. The wisdom and guidance in the Daily Jay sessions is such a positive way to start the day. I know it‚Äôs pricy but get the app. Your mental health is worth it!!
title: Changed my life

review:
Most apps allow you to enroll in a series of related guided meditations without the friction to resume the series and pick up where you left off.  This app adds so much friction to my daily use. When I have 15 minutes to meditate, I don‚Äôt want to navigate through numerous menus to find the mediation series I was using. In the calm app‚Äîand the web interface too for that matter‚ÄîI have navigate past new meditations and a lot of other noise before I can find the meditation series I want to use, or the favorites I‚Äôve already selected.

There should be an option on the Home Screen that will allow me to immediately pick up where I left off in a meditation series. Instead of an option to share calm with others on my Home Screen, I should see a thumbnail to navigate to my favorites. There too much friction in using this app, and I really dislike the interface.  The content is great, the format is terrible. Please improve the app.
title: Entire App Feels Like an Advertisement

review: I got this app to help me fall asleep, and all it does is frustrate me. I really wish I hadn‚Äôt paid for a full year‚Ä¶ I don‚Äôt want to listen to 45 minutes of a sleep story when I‚Äôm going to sleep. I only need 15. After that, the story wakes me up. I don‚Äôt understand why this app has made sleep timers so difficult. You can set a timer to make the app go to sleep after a certain amount of time just playing the background sound, but it will still play the whole story. The only way to actually get a sleep timer is to play a story from a playlist, but I haven‚Äôt had that work consistently. Also, why can‚Äôt the app keep track of where I left off in a story or playlist? If you navigate away, it has no idea where you were. Which is extremely annoying for the playlists because if you want to use the timer, you have to restart them, otherwise they are treated as a single story with no sleep timer. I really thought this app would be better designed for sleep‚Ä¶ very disappointing.
title: Frustrating‚Ä¶

review: Okay, I have a lot of trouble sleeping due to anxiety and stress. This helps, BUT out of everything I have looked at, there‚Äôs only four free things to listen to for sleep. I have favorited all of the free things and in total there‚Äôs four. I cannot afford the subscription either, so my counselor recommended headspace also so I also have that. But that‚Äôs not the point. There‚Äôs so many things that cost money, and I get it, you guys should have some things that need to be paid for but I don‚Äôt understand why there‚Äôs literally only four things that‚Äôs free and why subscriptions cost so much. Please cut it down a bit or something, many people have the same issues as me and can‚Äôt listen to a lot of things either because there‚Äôs so much things that need subscriptions and they might not have that kind of money. I have read other reviews and I see that other people agree with me.
title: Fix this

review:
I‚Äôve been a lifetime member for nearly three years. The daily‚Äôs, courses, breathing, and sleep stories are top notch. The app was indelible to developing a wellness routine for me, and got me into meditation. However, for sometime myself and other users have asked for a way to queue tracks, or create playlist- a relatively simple feature, yet am told by support they‚Äôre doing other things. As a result I have been using Hoomband for sleep tracks for the better half of a year, with this I can be guaranteed there will be something playing to help me drift back to sleep- and it would be too disruptive to get on the Calm app and pick something else. 

Other suggestions like new background scenes, or breathing exercises understandably take time. 

All in all the app is still 5 stars.
title: Great but listen to feedback

review: I love the Calm app!  I recommend getting the premium content.  Calm is a tool for dealing with the challenges of life.  There is more awareness on anxiety, depression, and negative feelings.  I am hopeful for the future because this will improve people‚Äôs lives.  I gifted the app to my friends and family who also enjoy it - beautiful, inspirational meditations, music, masterclasses, teachings, body exercises, sleep stories and music and so much more!  I wish my family and I had Calm for difficult times in our lives.  I am comforted knowing we have Calm now for difficult times in the future.  I am excited to see the upcoming new content which is frequently updated and improved.  Thank you to everyone at Calm - you all inspire and help me!  You changed and improved life for my family, friends, and me!  And for many other people in the world!
title: üíï

review: I believe this app is more or less saving my life. I have suffered from depression multiple times over the last nine years and I was unsure what was causing it. I believe I was overworking my brain and not giving it enough rest or stillness. The comment is allowing me to practice meditation in a way that I am never tried before. And I am not a newbie to meditation with my Indian culture and Hindu upbringing in America, I have learned a lot about pranayama. But this calm app offered something different, which has been amazing at allowing my mind to rest. My depression experiences has likely cost me over $500,000 in opportunity cost. I am excited for the opportunity to remain mentally stable for years to come so that I do not jump into an elevated state that could lead to a depression.
title: Calm app is currently saving my life

review:
Every day I am grateful for each person that makes Calm app possible. Calm helps me stay on the path of mindfulness, compassion, and growth. I have been using it for a solid year now and consider it to be one of my best investments of time, and money. 
I use Daily guided meditations to start my day, to get inspired and motivated, and to take a pause after work, and bedtime stories with my kids in the evening. 
I have been looking for quite sometime for the Teacher to guide me on my personal journey of growth. I found that and more in Tamara, Jeff, Jay and Mel! Thank you, my friends!
With each meditation practice I become better at using awareness to help me regain balance when strong emotions threaten to take over me. It improved the quality of my life and helps me be a better person. Thank you, Calm!!!!
title: Life changing

review: I used this app for a while a few years ago.  It wasn't super useful to me, even then a lot was behind a paywall, but I like the guided breathing exercise. I stopped using it and deleted the app at some point. When I downloaded it again recently, a lot had changed. The front page is now almost entirely paid content and the breathing exercise I used to use has been moved and was pretty hard to find. Also, you used to be able to adjust the breath pattern more, but now you have to have a subscription for anything other than 4 seconds inhale, 6 seconds exhale. There is very little content in this app that isn‚Äôt behind a $70/year subscription and they don‚Äôt even let you read descriptions or listen to previews of a lot of things, like the sleep stories, so you know what you‚Äôd be paying for. Used to be good for the breathing exercises, but now that they‚Äôre harder to access (not what I wanna deal with when I‚Äôm stressed), it‚Äôs completely useless to me.
title: Wasn‚Äôt great to begin with, much worse now

review: I‚Äôm a teenager and I have really enjoyed using Calm. I like to listen to the meditation music, it just puts my heart at peace :). I exercise a lot and I love listening to the calming music as I stretch or do yoga. I really appreciate this app and all the helpful resources they have available! I‚Äôd like to better my self care, so I started one of the self-care series. One of my friends has some bad anxiety and I‚Äôve recommended this app to her. They have very short sessions which is very helpful if you ever feel out of it or something. You can just take a short break and open this app and feel at peace with yourself and everything around you :). As for as I know the music, stories, meditations, etc. are all available for download so that you can listen offline. I hope you enjoy Calm as much as I do! üíñüòÑ
title: Calm üíñ

review:
We used headspace to sleep for years and it‚Äôs great but we‚Äôve really been enjoying calms sleep stories collection. We recently started turning off Wi-Fi & putting our phones on airplane modes at night and love that we can download the sleep stories to listen to without internet. 

However, at first the app would sometimes crash a couple times after about 30 seconds of listening on offline mode but would start working flawlessly after a couple starts. Sometimes it wouldn‚Äôt crash at all. Just recently it started crashing every night non-stop. This happens on both mine and my wife‚Äôs phone. Fresh installs, fresh reboot of phone, doesn‚Äôt make a difference. 

Please fix this so we can go to bed without having to restart a bunch in offline mode! No issue in regular mode.
title: Great app, but please fix offline downloads!

review: I had been feeling really stressed with school and one of my mom‚Äôs friend recommended this app. It was like magic. There is a monthly subscription fee, but you don‚Äôt have to subscribe to have the app. I haven‚Äôt subscribed and I still use the app. I personally love listening to the scenes in the background and if you go to the ‚Äúscenes‚Äù tab in the app, you can make it so the scene‚Äôs sound plays even if you aren‚Äôt in the app. The sounds are just so calming. You can also do a feelings check in which I try to do every morning. It has a bunch of emojis to choose from to relate to how you are feeling and you can write more about it. Once you do this, you can also see your history to see how you were feeling another day. I really enjoy this app and I highly recommend it.
title: Amazing

review:
I recently got a free trial for a year through work, which includes paid content. I‚Äôve read the reviews from people with free trials, and I doubt I‚Äôd buy it, seeing just what they‚Äôre seeing. Here‚Äôs what I like about it so far: The ‚ÄúHow to Meditate‚Äù series by Jeff Warren, the  ‚ÄúRadical Self Care‚Äù series by Lama Rod Owens, a few of the Sleep Stories,‚Ä¶

Here‚Äôs where I‚Äôd suggest improvements: I just had to look up the names and titles of these, which I‚Äôd bookmarked as favorites so I could find them. The organization could use some improvement. I‚Äôd suggest sorting things by what you want to DO (e.g., movement, meditation [by type]), etc. 

Also, I recently lost a loved one. When I searched for ‚Äúgrief‚Äù, ‚Äúgrieving‚Äù, ‚Äúloss‚Äù, etc,. It returned exactly two meditations, both by the same person. I think there‚Äôs a real need for more in-depth topics, based on the other reviews I‚Äôve read.  And if you can‚Äôt make this app free, I‚Äôd suggest creating a ‚Äúfree-will donation‚Äù feature for those with means to help people who can‚Äôt afford this app but who also really need something like this. I‚Äôd be willing to contribute a few bucks to help a struggling student or senior, or anyone. 

Just some thoughts off the top of my head. Thanks.
title: Has potential‚Ä¶Includes suggestions

review: So I‚Äôm a teen and I use this app before school. It helps clear my mind with the meditation. When I was younger (around 11) I would listen to the sleep stories for kids and it‚Äôd help me fall asleep peacefully. Now I listen to the music, there are some remixes from popular artists such as Shawn Mendes, Camila Cabello, Sam Smith, Sabrina Carpenter and more. I can also do daily check ins and I‚Äôve noticed my mood improve, I‚Äôm also more aware of my surroundings and my friends have noticed as well. I highly recommend this app. The only downside is having to pay for unlimited access, the content may be amazing it‚Äôs just expensive however it is worth it. I think getting this app should help you find your center and help you be more thoughtful about how you‚Äôre feeling, and how it‚Äôs impacting you.
title: Amazing app

review:
This app is just unbelievable. I am a mom of two, ages 16 & 6, and I am also a special ed teacher, and I use this app both at home snd with my students!! Both of my kids have sensory issues as well as OCD, ADHD, and severe anxiety. My daughter‚Äôs needs are more severe than my sons are, and over this past year, there were some nights where this app was the only thing that got my daughter to sleep. She particularly loves the Disney lullabies and the Matthew 
mcconaughey sleep story... can you blame her?! ü§£üôÉüòâ haha JK...  but seriously, they are so relaxing ... I even enjoy the sleep stories!!

I was fortunate enough to receive a subscription for free when Calm was doing the give away for teachers years ago; however, even if I hadn‚Äôt gotten it for free, I would pay for it in a heartbeat!! One of the best apps we own, even if we don‚Äôt always use it!!
title: Amazing!!

review: Love the app. However, this app is so slow when I need it the most to relax the other day. My Verizon internet and home Wi-Fi is the highest data I have and yet it‚Äôs so slow to load, it was waiting and waiting to load the sounds of the forest and I was so the opposite of calm. Maybe to many folks are on the servers at the same time? I‚Äôve read so many reviews about folks complaining that there is a fee to pay for an app service, my suggestion is to do research on what‚Äôs involved in app and software development. The amount of money Involved creating an app Is expensive, the developer has to pay huge fees every month in addition to the employees they hire to create quality content and research as well. Life is not free! Free apps are not that great, this is a great app but just too many folks on there server is causing lag on my end.
title: SLOW!

review:
I have tried a few meditation and sleeping apps, and this is by far my favorite. There are many ways to meditate with this app, with different voices and messages, and I love that. 
There are also many sleep stories that I enjoy and listen to over and over and sometimes I can repeat every word, but that‚Äôs ok; I still seem to fall asleep before the end of the story. Even if I don‚Äôt, I know, there will be another one right behind it to help me fall into slumber.
Another great feature of this app are the soundscapes. My favorite is the crashing waves, and the gently falling rain. 
For any mood you are in, you can find a sound, story, or meditation to help you relax and destress. I highly recommend this app and thinking it‚Äôs worth every penny and I hope you agree.
title: I love this app!

review:
I love the calm app. I use it primarily for white noise to get my baby to sleep (works like a charm!), and periodically for myself for the same reason. I do wish it had a fade out ability, however, in conjunction with the sleep timers. It would be so nice to have it slowly drop in volume down to nothing. This is my biggest wish - it would make falling asleep to the tracks and STAYING asleep so much easier. 

The app also has issues sometimes where it‚Äôll take a few tries to get it to actually play again, or it‚Äôll freeze on one of the sceneries and rotate, but needs to be quit/relaunched to actually function correctly beyond that. Minor bugs, no biggie. 

The various meditative sounds are wonderful, and I‚Äôve used them on really rough days. I genuinely appreciate having an app that slows my brain down.
title: Great save for two things...

review:
I signed up for Calm in late October 2020 during a particularly difficult bout with anxiety. The Breathing Exercises were what drew me initially, because yoga had taught me the importance of regulating my system through the breath. The exercises helped a lot. I quickly found that the Sleep Stories were another instant salve for me in times of need.

At this point I have done countless meditations and a few masterclasses. I have logged over a thousand hours of mindfulness. My daughter loves her nightly Sleep Stories just as much as I do. We daydream about who we‚Äôd like to hear narrate a story, or if we wrote a really relaxing story, would Anna Acton want to record it? :) I just renewed for another year because I couldn‚Äôt be more pleased with my experiences with Calm.
title: Came for Breathing Exercises, Stayed for Everything

review: I really appreciate all the daily meditations. Each one is unique to the narrator/author and has its own wisdom and insight. I resonate with Jeff Warren the deepest as he reminds me that it‚Äôs not only okay to be me‚Ä¶.it‚Äôs actually pretty friggin‚Äô awesome. Jay has great stories that really help highlight the point he is making. I‚Äôm a big fan of metaphor type learning and often use them in my private practice; so I dig that style. Tamara has a soothing demeanor that always puts me at ease and helps remind me that staying in the moment is always the right place to be. I‚Äôve been listening to the sleep stories for a couple of years and only recently started practicing meditation. Wow, have I been missing out! Thank you for doing what you do. You‚Äôre changing the world one  one listener at a time.
title: The Daily‚Äôs

review: The app is great and calming, and it‚Äôs a nice way to track thoughts and sleep patterns. But the one thing I don‚Äôt like is that you need to pay money to do 95% of the stuff. Some of the only things you can do are the quotes and the ‚Äú7 days of happiness.‚Äù But the reason I gave it 4 stars is the check-ins. It‚Äôs a nice way to track your thoughts, sleep patterns and to center yourself. I find it calming to do right before bed because I can get out my thought for a peaceful sleep. It can also track your sleep quality and you can tell them what variables made your sleep good or bad. This is extremely helpful because then you know what to do and what not to do. I am using the free version and getting along fine so far, but it is frustrating how little you can actually do without paying like 70 dollars a year.
title: Great app but

review: I want to rate this app higher, because I use it daily and find it useful, but Tamara Levitt‚Äôs syrupy delivery makes me feel like I‚Äôm a kindergartner, and I have trouble getting through some of her meditations due to the way she speaks. I‚Äôm often so distracted by my annoyance with her that the meditation is worthless. I understand the irony that I‚Äôm supposed to be learning equanimity via meditation to deal with feelings like this, but I guess I‚Äôm just not that advanced yet. She ends every meditation with ‚Äúwiggle your fingers and toes‚Äù as if we‚Äôve been taking a break on our nap mats and it‚Äôs time to get up for our juice boxes. I like the content of her sessions, I just don‚Äôt like her delivery. On the other hand, Jeff Warren is great. I wish he had more sessions on here. I paid the annual fee for the app, which is why I‚Äôm still using it, but I doubt I‚Äôll renew unless they change things up a bit.
title: Needs more narrators

review: I started using the calm app when I was struggling and things were falling apart. Now I start my day off by meditating with the calm app. I listen to Tamar‚Äôs daily calm and it helps me to focus on what I want to concentrate for self improvement. Calm has helped me to make self care a priority which has improved my relationships with my family and friend. I live more in the moment that helps me to respond with kindness and compassion instead of react with anger and hurt. I now enjoy my own company and am learning to treat myself like I would treat my friends. Calm app has gently encouraged me to reflect on myself and the positive changes just followed. I look forward each morning to start my day listening to Tamara and then now also squeeze in Daily Jay and session with Jeff.
title: First Thing First

review: This app helps me break away from many things that are just thoughts going throughout my head. When my mind is filled with nothingness besides my own feeling of my body and sensations, I‚Äôm not only able to make the best judgement and decisions for myself, but for everyone around me. Mediation is tricky, sometimes you think you‚Äôre too busy for it, or that you‚Äôll be, okay, since you had a great, successful day, but those days add up to bigger picture of peacefulness. Able to focus on you and not the superficial things around you, since all you really can control is how you react to certain things. The first month ive ever tried this, it truly brought peace to my mind so much, tears of joy and calmness dripped onto my jaw!  Thank you Calm and Tamara Levitt!!!!
title: Fluidity

review: Every morning, minus just a few days, for more than a year, I begin my day with a guided meditation from CALM, usually with Jeff Warren.  I have spent so much time with him, I feel like I know him.  The experience has truly been transformative.  I began meditating on the advice of a counselor after experiencing a panic attack on an airplane. I have never had mental health issues and at 58 yoa, it came as a shock.  Not only has the meditation practice helped relieve my General Panic Disorder; but it has made me a much better person; and these are the words of my wife of 35 years and my adult children.  This has lead me down a path where I am now taking mindfulness classes in order to hopefully bring these tools to friends and colleagues.  Thank you Jeff and everyone at CALM!
title: Life Changing Experience

review:
I love Calm, and I love how you‚Äôre continually adding great stuff! But the more you add, the harder it becomes to find what I‚Äôm looking for. Will you please consider added ‚ÄúFavorites‚Äù to the MAIN menu, rather than having to dig for it. What‚Äôs the point of favoriting things if you can never find them?
For example, on the iPad app there is a side menu. Just add it there, so it only takes me ONE click to find what I want. On the iPhone app, place a little ‚Äúfavorites‚Äù box right there under the Daily Calm, alongside the other main menu boxes. 
Please consider this. Your app is becoming way to unwieldy to manage and a favorites option would save us so many clicks. I realize you want people to ‚Äúdiscover‚Äù new stuff, and that‚Äôs fine sometimes. But most of the time, I just want to go directly to my stuff. Thanks.
title: Link to favorites

review: I could never recommend this enough. I have adhd and anxiety. Falling asleep some nights seems impossible with all of my racing thoughts and restlessness, and I have used medicinal sleep aids, meditation, reading by nightlight, and every other solution available before I found calm. The sleep stories give me just enough stimulus that I can tune out my thoughts and lull myself to sleep. I would never have dreamed of a solution with such simple effectiveness as the calm app.  I have been using this app for 3 years, and have always listened to the same story, Blue Gold by Phoebe Smith. I can quote the first half word for word, but to this day I have never heard how the story ends. So rarely do I have to resort to medicine anymore. Thank you creators!!
title: I‚Äôve never heard the end of my story once!

review: Calm is an absolutely amazing app! I just got it and I can already tell that‚Äôs going to help me immensely with my anxiety! All of my feelings get welled up at night and a meditation is extremely helpful to help release all of that stress that I‚Äôm feeling for the upcoming day! However I would like to note, that without premium Calm, you‚Äôre not really going to get anything out of the app at all. Now there is nothing wrong with this ! But I just wanted to let everyone know! Please buy the premium Calm!!! There are so many stories, meditations, and stretching sessions available! I highly recommend this app! And I‚Äôve just started! I can‚Äôt wait to see what else it has in store! I will write another review if anything changes!
title: AMAZING! But only if‚Ä¶       P.S. PLEASE BUY PREMIUM CALM! ü§©ITS AMAZING üíÜüèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüíÜüèæüíÜüèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

review: I have been using Calm for just over a year and my goodness what a wonderful thing meditation is using Calm. I am a 57 year old male with undiagnosed ADD, I have been dealing with Depression, Anxiety, thoughts of Suicide and just overall mental health issues for ALL of my life. I started Calm and I was skeptical and played around with it for the first few months and didn‚Äôt think it would really help. Well I am here to tell you that the meditation instructors at Calm for the best. Yes, I tried other meditation methods and apps. But, Calm is in my opinion the best. So do yourself a favor and give it time don‚Äôt give up and focus on your Self-Care using Calm and you will reap the benefits of using Calm. I am in such a better place now. I am not sure where I would be without Calm. Thank You !!
title: Give it TIME!

review: I started using the calm app in November 2022. It works very well depending on the reader you choose. I was never able to sleep because of my clustered thoughts that only come up every night. Calm helps me focus on the story and the reader‚Äôs voice. I wish I was able to get the calm app earlier and focus on a good nights rest. The reader‚Äôs voices are wonderful and calm, and the story is just as perfect. I would never be picky on a certain story. Instead, I would pick a random story and feel comfortable. In the morning, I love doing the breathing and meditation sessions. It prepares me right for the day, and helps me focus on work and being able to interact with other people and friends. Thank you calm for this wonderful experience you gave me! ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
title: This is AMAZING ü§©ü§©ü§©

review: It was down to 3 stars at this time last year. Content had taken a nosedive. I was bored and losing value. Understandably, times were and are tough. You stepped it up in the past six months but Jeff Warren has been a game changer. Real, accessible, fun, calm, differentiated and tangible learnings. Scripted, but unscripted in delivery. Not in the perfect lulu gear. Great job‚Äîsomeone who sounds like you, with vulnerabilities AND higher teachings. Now please decrease the random music and enrich the areas of the app that reinforce why we came. 5 stars for the daily trip, but please simplify. The most critical categories under the meditation tab are really thin and stale. Thanks for all you do and for also providing even a few nights where our children can dream in color‚Ä¶
title: Don‚Äôt ever take away Jeff Warren

review: I arrived in my senior years worn out and discouraged. My life was changing fast and I didn‚Äôt quite know what to do. My head began to spin as it always did at times like these. Then I read somewhere that mindfulness, and staying in the moment where essential for health and adjustment. I googled ‚Äúmindfulness‚Äù and the first thing that came up was this app, ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù.After a few meditations I knew that I had to you invest in my own health and from the very start I begin relaxing, learning how to stay in a moment, learning how to calm myself down, and learning how to participate in my own life at this age. So I thank ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù so much for this opportunity. I am a senior and my life has changed, slowly and thoroughly, in many details, because of this app called ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù .
title: Calm is a life changer

review: I‚Äôve struggled with falling asleep for most of my life, where it sometimes takes hours. I do have bouts of not being able to sleep at all. I‚Äôm not sure how this will do during those more intense times, BUT the sleep stories have knocked me out twice now and that is a MIRACLE. I love the celebrity stories and how well they tell them. I‚Äôve always been one to hyper focus on my thoughts or get lost in my day dreams or an annoying sounds so I never thought a sleep story would work, but I realized when I started to fall asleep during a lecture (while I was in my bed) that if I try to focus on something kinda boring I might be able to pass out üòÇ helps my mind not hyper focus! I‚Äôm still in the 7 day free trial so it doesn‚Äôt hurt to try!!
title: Sleep stories!!

review: I‚Äôm not happy with the new look of the home page. You‚Äôve tried to cram too much content on that page so that it now looks busy and cluttered, which is exactly the opposite of the name and theory behind calm. It‚Äôs also harder to find past episodes of the Daily Calm. Before the change, if I missed a session w Tamara or Jeff, I could simply scroll down to where their recent episodes‚Ä¶ the ones I hadn‚Äôt listened to yet‚Ä¶ were grouped. Now I have to leave the homepage to search for them. I get that you‚Äôre trying to offer new options to clients, but putting too many options on the home page makes it harder to find the stuff I come here for‚Ä¶ maybe rethink the design of the app? More choices are not necessarily better‚Ä¶
title: New Homepage

review: I have no regret with downloading this app. This app is so helpful when I am doing work or school and I just need a break from it all. I love all the scenes and sounds you can choose from! My favorite one is the fireplace! My recommendations would be to unlock more of the stories and sleep sounds and maybe add more mood check inns? I am not saying this to be critical at all because I love this app! Just a recommendation! My mom was actually the one who told me to download this app! She uses it all the time! Thank you so much for creating this app it helps me so much! I just started listening to the sleep stories on meditating because I have a lot going on in the pandemic and it helps so much! The creators did a great job in putting their best into this app because this app is the best! ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
title: I love this app!

review:
Calm app is awesome for when it is thundering outside because I can put sounds on. Calm covers every need I have especially considering I get frustrated easily. My counselor showed me this app, and I loved it. The only thing is that whenever you log in, sometimes it just glitches you right back out of the app. About every year there is also this time, and for about a week calm just freezes and kicks me out of the app. You also have to pay to use calm for a year. If you don‚Äôt pay, it will only give you like 1 soundscape, 1 song, 1 book ETC. So I wish calm could not have the membership part, and I wish calm will one day fix all the glitches that come out. Thanks for reading! 
(I still love this app though!!!)
title: Great but...

review: I‚Äôve had a few meditation apps before. I like this one a lot. My insurance company gave me a free year of the premium. I have been able to pull myself out of triggering moments. I‚Äôve done group meditation in person before and some chanting as well. Personally, I am unable to sit, so I lie down. I also cannot visualize images in my mind. There are plenty of options in this app for simple mindfulness meditations which focus on breathing. My journey thus far has brought up suppressed emotions and tears as well as reset my emotions to a more joyous state even after ten minutes. The variety of teachers makes it a novel experience, so I haven‚Äôt gotten bored yet. I like the simplicity of 10 minute sessions. Makes it easy to stick to a practice.
title: This is great.

review: I've been using the Calm app daily for nearly a year & it has been life-changing. I feel more centered, thought-full, relaxed & well, calm! Each day brings a new topic for meditation with the same very soothing voice--thank you, Tamira. There are multiple choices of sounds & visualizations if you choose to use one. There are many guided meditations with a wide variety of topics. And just when I thought this app was perfection, I find the introduction of Sleep Stories.  I have told several people about this app & they are also finding it beneficial. One parent uses the app with their anxious child. I am gifting this app to two friends for Christmas. My warmest thanks to the folks at Calm for what I consider to be the Best App Ever!
title: An Integral Part of My Day

review: Today in my gratitude journal I noted I‚Äôm grateful for Tamara, a woman I‚Äôve never met and likely never will meet. When I graduated college 26 years ago I meditated for a while and it helped, but alas, I got out of the habit of making time for myself and 25 years went by before I‚Äôd find this app. It‚Äôs wonderful. Tamara is such an excellent guide with her comforting assurances that it‚Äôs okay to be restless or experience whatever emotions are distracting you, and gently bringing you back to the breath. I could go on, but I‚Äôll just finish by saying that Tamara and the other guides are superb and I am starting to love starting my day with Tamara‚Äôs daily calm. Like any other habit it takes time. Please invest that time in yourself because you‚Äôre worth it and you will benefit.
title: Tamara and Calm are Awesome

review: Unfortunately, I had a 50% off 12 month promo and also had asked for a giftcard for Christmas for the year that would be enough to cover the discounted price, which I received. Well Calm does not honor their giftcards the way most businesses do and would not let me redeem my giftcard to pay for the promo (credit card only). It was a waste of money and I lost out on 6 months of this expensive app because they would not honor their own giftcard as a form of payment. Customer service was no help and would not offer to assist me in correcting the matter. Of course giftcards are also non refundable, so it was just a waste. I‚Äôm not even sure how this is legal‚Ä¶ I doubt it is. Once I reached out, I am just in disbelief that they still would not help me or extend my membership by the remaining time at least. This is all so unfortunate since the app itself is nice. The company does not seem to value their customers.
title: Does not honor their gift cards. Poor customer service

review:
I signed up for CALM quite awhile ago.  There are many times I have not been able to go to sleep... my mind is racing with various lists of tasks, projects, paperwork and everyday life responsibilities that have to be tended to.  CALM is my drug free alternative. It is nights like tonight that it gives me the most for my money.  I have my next chemo treatment tomorrow.  There are times when I am okay and can sleep, but recently it hasn‚Äôt been that easy.   So I turn to the app and I am usually out in 15 minutes.  I have yet to make it thru a story.  

I was recently able to use the kids stories on two of my young god children.  I was babysitting one night and they just could not lay down.  I played one of the stories for them... they were not even a year old yet.  I timed it.  SEVEN MINUTES and they were down and out.   SEVEN MINUTES... what a blessing.

I simply love the app.  If you question the benefits of paying for premium membership just keep in mind the monthly fee wouldn‚Äôt even pay for  a month‚Äôs medication so I am just fine paying for
extra content each month.  Especially since I KNOW it works.

Thank  you,
Christina Obenshain
title: Never Hear the Ending

review:
This app is great, and has a wide variety of music, stories and soundscapes for sleeping. I just wish there were a few things. 1. I wish there was a way to load multiple stories at once, like a playlist so they could just start one after the other. 2. I would love it if when you pulled up a story or at the end of a story they had maybe like 3 other story suggestions that were similar to what you had just picked. (Like if I pick ‚Äúdreams‚Äù read by Harry Styles, they would have 3 additional story suggestions that were similar). 
3. I love the stories with music in the background, I would enjoy having this option on more stories. 

Other then that, this is a great app with so many options.
title: App suggestions

review: I have been using Calm for almost a year now to help focus my energy somewhere else when I have late night panic attacks. Distraction techniques and most breathing techniques I learn from therapists or psychology classes I am currently taking do not work for me personally. My mind is too swarmed by my fear that I can‚Äôt focus on anything but that fear. Although calm does use breathing techniques, I believe it is not the ‚Äútraditional‚Äù techniques taught in classes. These breathing techniques have you focus on certain parts of your body instead of your breathing itself. When I focus on my breathing, I actually start worrying if I am breathing enough and it doesn‚Äôt help, but calming my breathing through focusing on relaxing every part of my body helps me a lot!
title: I love the Calm App!

review: I‚Äôve had the CALM app for a while now and it‚Äôs been literally sleep-saving! I have terrible anxiety at night I‚Äôll wake up and can‚Äôt get back to sleep because of all my random thoughts however I recently started letting the CALM sleep stories/music/etc. play all night versus the first 30 mins I‚Äôm in bed and I‚Äôm now sleeping through the night even after getting up to use the bathroom I easily fall back to sleep. Lastnight it wasn‚Äôt on (my fault) however once I turned on the thunderstorms I was out within minutes. Love all the features available but nothing more then it‚Äôs ability to help me sleep. Even my husband like to hear it as he‚Äôs falling asleep, and of course my kiddos love the kids sleep stories! Thank you CALM!
title: Love it

review: gratitude I express not until my  for this well developed app but also my appreciation for the spirit of the creators since that spirit is reflected in their work. Although there is no need for apps to meditate or relaxing, it is very impressive how much easier it is with the help of the sounds you created, the EXCELLENT narrator and meditation guide. Also, the other features such as music, story telling, etc. bring more joy and diversity to the tools of relaxing and being in spirit. This app makes a great impact because it guides you gently through the new experience of meditation if you are a beginner and if you are more experienced, it adds to the joy of relaxing and meditation with their creative, well thought of, and diverse mental ambience creator.
title: Positively Impact Living

review:
Like many things, I find that getting started is commonly the biggest barrier, and meditation has not been different. Finding the time, space, or even method to meditate used to deter me from doing it, and I wasn‚Äôt even sure if I was doing it correctly- which discouraged me from continuing the process. 

Calm has helped me enter a headspace which is relaxing, and the guided meditations give me just enough of an outline to lead me into a meditative state in seconds. The app also acknowledges when you get a daily consecutive streak, which I find very encouraging!

I would still consider myself a novice at meditation, but with the help of this app, it no longer feels like an impossible, scary thing. Thanks, Calm!
title: Calm helped me break the barrier to begin meditating

review: I reached for this app when I was going through a period of feeling really run down and drained. Some other life events were happening and I needed some extra help to get through. The short and long meditations, daily meditations, and sleep stories made a huge difference. Luckily life has come back around, but even though I'm not in a slump I'm still enjoying the daily meditations that I do first thing in the morning and a sleep story at night. Sometimes if I have a break in the day I'll do a guided nap or a quick meditation- especially on a hard day. I love this app and use it almost every day. I highly recommend it to my friends and coworkers, especially if stressed or having trouble sleeping.
title: Essential daily app

review: Calm, has changed my life for the better. This mindfulness practice has helped me deal with anxiety! It has helped me internally, locate how I feel! How to handle emotions, how to accept uncertainty! Self acceptance! Life‚Äôs changes, It has taught me to live in the moment! To really be fully present in the moment! That‚Äôs all we got is our breath and the moment ! Really breathe, listen to my body! Release my need to control and go with the flow! I could go on and on! I love all my teachers! I truly appreciate what they‚Äôve done in my life! Self discovery at its finest! This calm app is one of the best investments I‚Äôve ever made for myself! Tamara, Jeff, Jay! I am grateful for y‚Äôall! Thank you so much! Y‚Äôall are really out here making huge impacts on ppls life‚Äôs!‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Invest in yourself! It‚Äôs worth it!

review: I was feeling awful and stressed out all the time pulling myself everywhere trying to make everyone happy helping everyone and doing everything from work, friends, my mother, family and not saying no because they made me feel selfish if I didn‚Äôt. They constantly made me feel like the bad guy. Even doing this made me feel bad and guilty because I took this moment for myself. Now I feel much better then when I first started. This is such a good app to use I‚Äôm thankful for coming across it. The mind is so important and you can‚Äôt be truly happy unless you let go and breathe. I realize that now. I don‚Äôt let them stress me out anymore I‚Äôm going to start doing for me and be a little selfish and put me first
title: Really helped

review: There should be a third category free, charge, and brief experience. Since it is probably is not your fault I gave 5 stars as the 3 free minutes I found before I deleted the app had great content. If there is more free time it took me too long to find it before feeling I was being taken because I had to give my private information before being given access to the 3 minutes I found. SUGGESTION: 1. clearly label the free stuff. 2. Give the free stuff away without having to jump thru a bunch of hoops. 3. Don‚Äôt give any free stuff away in this situation so the customer knows what they are truly getting. Most customers like me a used to a generous amount of free content such that they can make an informed decision Thanks
title: Bait and Switch

review: Would be 5 stars besides the fact that you can‚Äôt ask Siri to play the daily calm.   For example if you can‚Äôt sleep they are asking to open your phone (waking you up more!) to then open the app, select a sleep story, open the air play menu, then finally select a HomePod from the menu.  What‚Äôs even the point?  If I even glance at my fantasy league or some thing because I opened my phone for calm because I can‚Äôt ask my HomePod to just play calm.  The Siri shortcut is no better you have to continue on your iPhone, same thing look at your phone.  The money you pay this should‚Äôve been taken care of by now.  Apple has given the developer the tools with Sirikit media.  This is not unreasonable and for a app claiming to be about mindfulness you‚Äôd figure less screen time would be a top goal.  If this isn‚Äôt resolved by the end of my subscription year I won‚Äôt be renewing.  Content great, falls on app development
title: No real HomePod integration

review: I‚Äôve tried to incorporate meditation into my life so many times over the years, yet only since starting with the Calm app have I succeeded. The app has so much variety ‚Äî from 1-minute to much longer guided meditations, varying approaches and diverse teachers or meditation leaders. There‚Äôs always something helpful there. I‚Äôve gone from just the Daily Jay (Jay Shetty) mindfulness lessons to now turning to the Calm app 3 times most days - a mindful start with the Daily Jay, a midday break with one of the work-related meditations or one of the nap programs, and an evening mindfulness check-in. Everyone around me sees the difference. Most importantly, I see the difference. I‚Äôm coming up on 365 consecutive days of this, and I‚Äôm not going to stop.
title: Literally life changing

review:
I decided to purchase it primarily for sleep stories. And after my free trial has expired I realised that I am stuck with primarily stories recorded by people that have no business recording sleep stories. At least there should be different voices categories. I realised that I am deeply annoyed by high pitch whispering and the ‚Äú S‚Äù sounds pronounced unnecessarily loud making me jump in bed each few seconds. Calm app makers! Please hire more people with sweet and velvety voices that are ACTUALLY soothing or adjust audio recording to smooth those sounds out. ( or put it as an option for listeners)There is a reason every classical singer out there is trained to smooth their Ts and Ss so the songs are actually enjoyable.
So far the only truly soothing story I found was read by Matthew Mcconaughey. That‚Äôs a lot of money to pay for very little use I am getting.
title: Not well thought-out

review: I‚Äôve found help in the supportive, empowering and healing places in Calm. The practitioners are the real deal, and there is variety for individual preferences. The Poetry Pharmacy, Jeff‚Äôs How to Meditate series, the Master Class on Sleep, sleep stories and sleep meditations were favorites early on. It‚Äôs wonderful to have such a rich healing environment always close at hand.
