These days I meditate solo with the open-ended timer set to a tropical beach wave for background sounds, with bells set for every five minutes‚Äîone set of choices among many options. I also use the 4-7-8 breath pacemaker (one of several) for falling sleep. I‚Äôm grateful Kaiser pays for my subscription but think this is an app worth paying for. A world of calm is a haven in a crazy time.
title: A Healing Environment

review: The Calm app is changed my life. Previously I had stressed and anxiety built up to which I wasn‚Äôt aware of. Ultimately it would burst out and cause big melt downs for me. I actively knew I needed some help to which I tried counseling but it just didn‚Äôt do it for me. It wasn‚Äôt what I was looking for. I then prayed. I felt the Holy Spirit share two things to help me with my emotions. 1). Start Journaling. I use an app called Penzu. Then of course 2). The Calm app. I‚Äôve NEVER would‚Äôve done either. Unfortunately, in my previous mindset it was ‚Äúsoft‚Äù but that was a lie. This has improved my emotions which has made me better in my relationships and at work. I‚Äôm Super thankful for the calm app. Second year using it and I‚Äôm ready to take it up a notch.
title: Life changing

review: This app has been such a revelation in my well-being and everyday life. So much so that I purchased the lifetime subscription back in late 2019 after paying for the one year subscription. It is worth every penny. There is something for everyone of any age, from meditations to sleep stories to relaxing stretches and exercises. My kids use it as well, for there is an entire collection geared toward kids of all ages. I especially find the app to be of incredible use on days where I‚Äôm suffering from a tension headache, since there are meditations and exercises that never fail to ease the pain and tension. Having a healthy mindset can truly make such an impact on anyone who invests the time and energy into doing so.
title: My lifesaver app

review: I love this app Calm Premium and I‚Äôve had it on my phone for probably a year all of a sudden I go to open the app and it‚Äôs gone. I‚Äôm finding myself having to download it every single night to use it now. Royal pain. If they can fix that and it be at five star I have spent countless hours trying to fix this issue myself. Developer has been absolutely no help whatsoever. It seems as though they have no customer service. Either you fix it yourself or you‚Äôre screwed. and I paid for the premium! Which makes me really angry because I love the app itself is fabulous. are use it every night to go to sleep. Or I did. Some nights I‚Äôm just too tired to look it up in the App Store.
title: Love the app, but‚Ä¶

review:
I'm one of these users who bought a lifetime subscription after taking a meditation course that was very promising. Sadly, it was not indicative of the rest of the Calm experience. Issues that require attention:
‚Äì The app is highly un-intuitive: It's hard to find favorite pieces
‚Äì The offline experience is abysmal. I use the app primarily in planes and discover that hardly anything works offline. I'm sure there are ways to download soundscapes but I can't find how and whenever I find a way to play a soundscape offline, it switches off automatically after 10 minutes. Restarting it ‚Ä¶ requires restarting the app. That's a lot of restarts over a 6-hour flight.
Maybe they will fix these issues but after a couple of years of waiting, I'm not holding my breath. If I knew today what I know, I wouldn't have bought the subscription.
title: High promise, but not there yet

review: hello! as you can tell, i have given the app 5 stars. i have done this because this app is awesome and i fall asleep very quickly to the sleep stories every night, and i also use this app for many other things. such as just calming my mind, and meditation. HOWEVER, this app does require payment for a better experience, (70$ per year,) to do many other things then you can do without the premium. even though it costs money, as i said before i have been sleeping much more peacefully. if you have a lot of trouble falling to sleep or are dealing with anxiety, i would definitely recommend Calm for you. thank you, and maybe Calm is the right app for you!
title: please read before downloading! ‚ò∫Ô∏è

review: This app is so genius! So calming and I‚Äôm absolutely hooked! There are so many different aspects of the app. You have to scroll around and look through it ‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs amazing! My goodness the sleep story blew me away (blew me straight to sleep). Her voice was as smooth as silk. It was something about snow and mountains lol‚Ä¶ not sure- I fell asleep! I‚Äôm a mindful, calm and self-aware individual. This is the best app for me. From the second it opens up, you‚Äôre engaged by the sounds and aesthetics. So many things to choose from! Wow! I‚Äôm so excited. I spend hundreds of dollars a month on my well-being and now, this app is a 100% must. Try it, it is 100% worth it. By the way‚Ä¶ I saw something in there for kids as well! Nooooo way!!!
title: I Really Really Love this

review:
I wish users can have a choices of narrator voice . The voice of the lead person Tamarra, is too cheerful and has too much emotion in her voice. It is like she is telling a cheerful and colorful story. Many people may prefer such a bubbly character, but for someone who feels anxious, that‚Äôs bad news for a guided meditation. It is not that I don‚Äôt like her voice, it is that the energy and emotion in her voice makes me more anxious. I bought one year subscription and tried to get used to it. But it didn‚Äôt work. As a result, I don‚Äôt use the Apps much at all. 

I would prefer a more traditional, calm and almost emotionless voice. Some of the work offers a choice and I always choose the alternative male voice. But given that her voice accounts for 90% of the guided medications, I will not renew my subscription.
title: Nice collection. But

review:
Content is great, I‚Äôve been using the app for some years now and have a paid subscription, overall I would say it‚Äôs worth it. I use the sleep soundscapes the most, and play them on my HomePod. They helps covering the noise my neighbors do at any time of the night. The Commercial Airliner, and the White Sound Ocean Surf soundscapes are the best IMO for this kind of ‚Äúsound machine‚Äù feel.
However, there are two notable issues I find pretty frustrating:
1. The soundscape tracks are seemingly loops that repeat every X minutes (maybe 20, or 30minutes?). When the track ends, there‚Äôs a gap of a couple seconds before it‚Äôs starts again, which is enough to create this unpleasant ‚Äúwake up‚Äù experience.
2. The playback experience in the app is buggy. It does not really say when it‚Äôs buffering (if at all?) but it does not always starts right away after selecting a soundscape, even though the playback UI shows as playing. Sometimes, playback does not even start until a couple seconds after backgrounding the app. That‚Äôs odd and not user friendly.

If that wasn‚Äôt for these two issues, I would give it 5 stars without hesitation.

Please Calm devs, help me being calmer by fixing these annoyances!
title: Would be 5 stars without some pesky bugs

review: I actually like the app very much, but find that I do not use it.  I got an email notice for an automatic renewal, but I decided to cancel.  About a week ago, I opened the email and went to the renew area.  At the bottom was a  cancel option.  I clicked it and it said I couldn‚Äôt connect.  So, I reopened it and all the options to buy were present, except the cancel option.  Weird.  So, to test the connection I tapped the monthly renewal option and, sure enough, it opened right away and was willing to take my money.  I did not click to pay, but closed out.  Then I send a note to apple about my problem - with no response still.  I then went to my app account and, again, there is no option to cancel this app, only to renew.  That is why I gave a one star on the review.  I guess my next step is to remove my credit card from the App Store, so I don‚Äôt get an automatic renew charge.  How stupid is that?!
title: Trying to cancel auto renewal

review:
This app is beyond great. Meditation is such a gift to everyone who allows time for it. I have been an user of Calm for 4 years now and love the accessibility of it. It‚Äôs great for quick sessions when life catches up. I‚Äôve deepened my practice by taking what I learn here and carrying with me. 

I find the nature scapes/sounds to be extremely relaxing, and I love how I can toggle between whatever I am feeling like listening to depending on my mood or the environment. 

All good things, but I would love to see Calm incorporate more options into the mood check-in at the end of the sessions. There are so many different types of emotions that don‚Äôt make it to the choices that are made available.
title: Excellent but recommend more options

review: The app opens up asking the user what they need. They give the options of anxiety relief, meditation, help with getting to sleep, etc. They have sections that allow the user to explore different sessions. These sessions consist of real people coaching one through their use of breathing techniques. They have music, kids, check-in, ‚Äúfor work‚Äù, and a wisdom section. They all work amazingly. It has been studied that people with anxiety can experience mindfulness in order to cope with or eliminate their anxiety. Being mindful of one's experience "in the moment" (also known as meditation) and doing so without passing judgment clarifies one's values, enables acceptance of uncomfortable ideas and feelings, and the use of values to alter behavior.
title: Help with anxiety

review: A year ago, I was still suffering as an insomniac and my anxiety and stress were burning a hole in my chest. I have been on medication for years. I tried Calm on a whim, but gave it my total committement. It worked!! I don't have to use it as often, but I love it so I do. I'm the mother of two special needs boys, my parents need me and have moved in, my brother and his wife are jobless so they are here, too! So my symptoms have been through the roof! I especially use the Daily Trip and Sleep Stories and have been able (with doctor's guidelines) to get off all related medicine. Learning how to meditate and embracing sleep stories have been a cure for me and I will always be a subscriber. Thank you so much!
title: Calm has been a miracle for me!

review: This app is really nice, I especially like the soundscapes. However, there only seems to be a handful of soundscapes that don‚Äôt have a ton of white noise in the background. Please include more soundscapes that are pure environmental sounds, not sounds on top of a thick layer of white noise. The Campfire soundscape does a great job of that, why can‚Äôt more of the soundscapes be like that? The white noise makes it sound artificial and makes it anxiety inducing, not relaxing and transportive. Sorry to be a critic on this point, I would just really like more non-white noise soundscapes, right now there‚Äôs not many options. Otherwise I appreciate what you guys are doing here and say you earned five stars for my review.
title: One Request (Otherwise great app)

review: Calm has been in the news lately‚Äîgood news, for doing good things‚Äîso when my subscription expired earlier this week, I was only too happy to renew it. I‚Äôve been using the app for a little over a year now, off and on (trying to be more on than off but sometimes keeping good habits is hard), and I find it very useful. It‚Äôs well organized, easy to navigate, lots of variety, and helpful reminders to make it a habit (assuming you respond to the reminders, lol). I also like that I can log in through my browser and play some of the music playlists on my computer while working. All in all, an excellent experience with this.
title: Excellent app, and excellent company to support

review: I‚Äôve been on a streak since the pandemic hit. 1 meditation a day-sometimes I only have time for a 3 minute, and others I choose longer. I love the variety of classes to meet my emotional needs for each moment of my day. As a family, we complete a kid meditation and sleep story each night as part of our nightly routine. I have even started to incorporate some meditations from this app in my classes with my students! This app has completely changed my life! I also do gratitude tracking, mood tracking, and sleep tracking, and have seen way better sleep prioritizing, and reflection! I can‚Äôt recommend this app enough! (And I love that they partner with my health insurance company!) ‚ù§Ô∏è
title: 1,000+ days

review: There seems to be something for everyone. I find something new almost every time I begin my night time rituals. Which is kinda my problem; I don‚Äôt have a set ritual, that allows my mind to shut off. As soon as my head hits the pillows, it starts analyzing my day, and reminding me of all the things I should have done during the day, instead of the things i did do. It‚Äôs frustrating, but I‚Äôm getting a handle on it, sort of. Sometimes it works and sometimes it doesn‚Äôt. But this app helps. Even if I can‚Äôt find sleep, I can find calm, find relaxing, find release of the troublesome thoughts or putting them where I can find them the next day and deal with them properly.
title: Sleep

review: I was recommended this app by my pain management care team. I was having a very hard time getting back into my practice after 8 years recovering from CRPS. Initially meditation was heightening pain level for me. This was a hard thing to navigate for me as I have over 40 years experience with meditation practices.  This app has helped me easy back into a fruitful practice at the pace I needed. After the first three months I was well into recovery for my condition and pain/ anxiety levels are significantly reduced. I really like all the options in the app and have shared this with family and friends. This app is appropriate for all levels from ‚Äú what is meditation‚Äù to ‚Äú life long practice‚Äù. Well done!
title: Well done!

review: This is going to sound extreme, but this app has changed my life. Not only have I been able to fall asleep without any stress, I actually feel lighter every day.  There are so many fun extras in this app as well! You can track how your feeling each day. You can write short gratitude lists, and even go for a deep thinking question.  I‚Äôve had insomnia all my life.  I put on a sleep story and I‚Äôm out without worry or stress.  I tell everyone I know to get the app and subscribe!  My mother and I often joke about how long we can make it through a story.  Run don‚Äôt walk. Get this app and subscribe.   I would give this 100 stars if I could.  Bravo calm and thank you.
title: Everything promised and so much more.

review:
I‚Äôve been using Calm‚Äîsometimes for meditation but primarily for sleep‚Äîfor about 4 years now. The sleep stories are incredible and I listen to one almost every night. Highly, highly recommended. 

Not only has Calm helped me personally, but I‚Äôve also incorporated a lot of the skills into my job. I work as a public librarian and I have incorporated breathing exercises and mindfulness activities into my story times and elementary school class visits. Plus I‚Äôve done more in depth mindfulness story times for families‚Äîand I wouldn‚Äôt have had the confidence to jump in if I hadn‚Äôt become a regular meditator through this app. I truly rely on Calm to help me maintain my health and general well-being.
title: Absolutely recommended!

review: Since it‚Äôs launch, my son and I use Calm religiously. We love it; however, I am becoming frustrated because every time I open the app at the end of the evening I am bombarded with choices for my child since he was the last user. He constantly on favorites pieces that I have favorite because he thinks he is on his account, and I lose my favorites category to choose from because sessions come and go. Please add the capability for family accounts, or for my son to access his profile so I can access my profile, this would help immensely reduce the frustration of having to filter through content that is not related to either of us when trying to choose a sleep story a soundscape or music at bedtime.
title: Please Add User Profiles within the App

review: Ok don‚Äôt get me wrong I love this app in all but what really bothers me is that almost all everything in this app is locked because you have unlock calm and it costs money the reason why I don‚Äôt unlock calm is because my parents don‚Äôt know I go through stress,anxiety,depression so I don‚Äôt ask for the money for calm,It really bothers me that I can only listen to a few stories in calm I really think that you shouldn‚Äôt lock almost all of the stories,lullabies,songs,mediations you know all that stuff I really don‚Äôt wanna ask my parents for the money I know there is a 7 day free trial but the 7days will end soon and I don‚Äôt wanna pay for it, this is really helpful for stress anxiety and depression but a lot of the things in this app cost money but other than that this app is amazing and really helpful to the people who pay for it.
title: This is just annoying and bothering

review: I‚Äôve had this app for a few years now, and while I go through phases in my usage, it never fails me. Traveling and can‚Äôt fall asleep? Lost your job and need some help centering yourself? Babysitting and need something to keep the kids entertained or calm for sleep? Can‚Äôt sleep? Anxious? This app has completely changed my self care routine, and practicing gratitude has honestly, literally, kept me alive. I can‚Äôt afford therapy, but this app truly does help, and has everything you need to work on yourself. I love the sleep stories, and I rely on the nature sounds to calm my mind almost every night. I will have this app on my phone, forever. Best year subscription I‚Äôve ever purchased.
title: EVERYONE needs this!

review:
I first read about Calm in NYT several years ago. I tried it and never stopped! I‚Äôm an ob-gyn physician and by definition sometimes my job requires me to be up all night‚Äî hence I really need to sleep on all the non-work nights. Calm cuts through my stress, anxiety, irregular sleep schedule and brings me to deep sleep. I usually fall asleep within 3-5 minutes. I rarely awaken. If I do I start another story with equal success. I use the ‚Äòscenes‚Äô background sounds as I wind down for sleep and they play again after the story. 

I sometimes use the nap stories as well. They are short and time my naps so that I don‚Äôt sleep too long. 

I highly recommend this app for anyone struggling with sleep.
title: Works every time

review:
The Calm App is beyond helpful. I‚Äôve tried many apps to help with my anxiety disorder, stress, self-esteem difficulties, and multiple other areas I have trouble improving alone in my life. Calm App is THE APP FOR ALL OF MY IMPROVEMENT AREAS! I love the short, simple podcasts, because I‚Äôm able to listen along on my drive to work, and/or during a stressful, anxious, or negative situation. I‚Äôm able to listen to these podcasts and after 10-12 minutes, I feel the most peaceful so I‚Äôm able to return to my previous environment with a positive, peaceful, and helpful attitude and mindset.
If you don‚Äôt have this app, DOWNLOAD THIS APP NOW! It is an investment that is worth much, much more!
title: SO helpful, very short and simple, with actual results!

review: I‚Äôve been using Calm for sometime now - several years and I love the thoughtfulness that goes into the selections and I love the depth of what‚Äôs available to me. It‚Äôs allowed me to form great habits like starting my morning with a meditation or calming music rather than checking my email and diving right into the day - it just sets the tone for my entire day. Then I‚Äôll tap into Calm in the afternoon just to take a break and the selections and options are amazing. And then after the long day is over I‚Äôll unwind with their music selection for my whole family to enjoy a dinner or after dinner just sitting on the balcony relaxing. I have a lifetime membership to Calm, and I just love it!
title: Calm just makes life better

review:
I did the trial for one of the sleep stories ‚Ä¶ and discovered something I thought was cool was something I needed.
It‚Äôs not easy to get to a list of all the sleep stories - but once I did - OMG they are amazing. The app wants to suggest content, rather than let you see all the content of a particular type.  I eventually found most of them by filtering on fiction or non-fiction.
My five stars are for content.  The good news is there‚Äôs a lot of content.  The bad news is that content is ‚Äúorganized‚Äù in inconsistent ways.  It made me crazy to see a screen of six or eight suggestions and realize once you picked one - you couldn‚Äôt get back to those initial stories.
title: Surprisingly worth the money

review: I have bad insomnia and other issues so I decided to try this app. I LOVE IT. I am a premium member, I wanted to experience the WHOLE app (I haven‚Äôt used all the features yet LOL)I LOVE the music to sleep and the stories to sleep‚Ä¶ I listen to the kids stories because my mind doesn‚Äôt shut down and the kids stories seem to put me to sleep. I am bad at breathing exercises to relax it‚Äôs NEVER worked on me. They have exercises for kids! To me this app is so worth the money! It‚Äôs help got me thru the pandemic stress‚Ä¶ I put on my favorite music and books and I‚Äôm less stressed, and sleep better! Spend the money it‚Äôs worth! It‚Äôs updated frequently so new things are added all the time! You get  a lot from it!
title: My favorite App

review: I like the Calm app and I pay for the premium subscription, but I find myself returning to the same two or three soundscapes or instrumental songs. I love birdsong but there‚Äôs literally only one soundscape with birds to choose from. The other soundscapes are nice but almost every one has blurry white noise in the background. Sometimes my head just wants peaceful sound without all that extra stuff happening in the back. I get that white noise helps people to sleep but it does the opposite for me; I get a headache with so much sound. Please add some soundscapes with just the intentional foreground sounds and skip the blur. Also more instrumentals please.
title: Need more soundscapes without the background white noise

review: This app has changed my life in so many ways. I now wake up earlier and happier.  I am a better mother Bc I have more patience and a better understanding of my boy. I have a better relationship with my bf Bc I am more tolerant, calmer, and level headed. Tamaras voice is so calming and her messages are so inspirational that I find myself wanting to listen to her all the time. It has improved the amount I drink and WHY I drink and I have nearly quit smoking. I have begun to work out and WANT to work now. I‚Äôm so much more down to earth and chill. I am so happy I found this app. I told a friend about it.... I saw him a year later and he said it changed his life as well!!!!  I cannot recommend this enough. I love it
title: Life changing

review:
In a busy, chaotic, and extremely stressful world, this app has made it easy for me to find my center while I‚Äôm on the go and in the trenches.

It‚Äôs easy to let your personal well-being fall to the wayside when you‚Äôre trying to be an elite performer at work, mom of the year, supportive wife, and dedicated friend. 

This app has gifted me with the ability to take a moment to myself within the convenience of a busy schedule. If I don‚Äôt have time to meditate, at least I‚Äôll have time to take in a daily Jay or motivational story to clear my head. Calm meets me where I AM ‚Ä¶ and allows me the ability to keep reminding myself that it‚Äôs all going to be OK and I‚Äôve got this.
title: Completely changed my life!

review: This is the first review I‚Äôve ever written on Apple. Never thought of it to be worth my time. This app, however, transcended my previous notIon of time and peace in the mind. After a stressful day at work, I have struggled coming home to my wife and baby girl with a positive attitude. When I‚Äôm in my car on the way home, I tune into Calm. Whether it be a relaxing piano melody, sounds of the rain forest, or listening to Lebron on how to train your mind to master emotions. I‚Äôve also got into meditation and yoga for the end of my days because of this. My new found self-awareness and positivity has become evident to my family and has been profoundly beneficial. Thank you to the devs of this app, you have done a truly fantastic job. Namaste ‚úåÔ∏è
title: Finding control

review:
So much useful content in many of the modules. But will I find it again? The navigation is not only incomplete, counter-intuitive and not comprehensive, but the content that is visible is in a state of constant and extreme flux. Everything is constantly changing, shifting and changing position. Modules are often suggested in batches: choose one, then you‚Äôre done, because there‚Äôs no ‚Äúback‚Äù button. No way to return to where you were to check out the rest. Modules are suggested based on experience, the path I‚Äôve taken through the app, but there‚Äôs no way to replicate that experience to bring those same modules back. They‚Äôre gone. Maybe I‚Äôll see them again. Maybe I won‚Äôt. No way to know.

Should I treat my experience in this app as an allegory of life? A metaphor for the unpredictability of existence? A simile of the not-knowing beginner‚Äôs mind? An exercise in spontaneity, an acceptance of the not-desired, or of gratitude for the what-is?  ‚ÄúLife is like a box of chocolates - you never know what you‚Äôre going to get.‚Äù 

Sorry. I get that every day. I don‚Äôt need an app for that. 

This frustration with the interface is not what I want from an app intended to foster ‚Äúcalm.‚Äù
title: So much good, but will I find it again? Who knows?

review:
I left my daily practice while I undergone cataract surgery. I wanted to concentrate on the healing and adjustment to this miraculous event. During the recovery I was overwhelmed by the dramatic difference between my recovering eyesight first in my right eye and then my left eye. Colors became clear then the vision in both eyes cleared. Yesterday I went in for my four month evaluation. Both eyes were back to 20/20! 

My eyes were back! And as I said to the surgeon when I left his office ‚ÄúThank you! Thank you! Thank you! I can see all the way to the other side of the Galaxy!‚Äù All of the other patients laughed as I left the office üòé

I should have kept up with the practice. These miracles should be savored.
title: Coming Back.

review: I was able to get a one year Premium subscription for super cheap with a special deal. After using it for a few days, the meditations are fine. What I find super frustrating is there is NO way to easily filter and search for meditations. For example, in another FREE app, I can filter by time, male vs female voice, key word (e.g. binaural), with or without music, even preview the voice. With Calm, there is no way to do that. You can only pick a category, like sleep or mediation. I prefer sleep meditations with music, but I have to literally play at least 30 seconds of each and every one or ff to see if it has it. I‚Äôve already canceled my subscription to ensure it won‚Äôt renew next year because not at all worth full price at $70 when other apps for way less or free have better navigation and functionality.
title: Frustrating to find what you need

review:
It‚Äôs the #1 app for anyone who uses it infrequently or who is a first-time user. I‚Äôve experimented with a couple meditation apps but have found this one to be the best in many ways. I was introduced to mindfulness and meditation through this app and it was very insightful in the beginning. I‚Äôm a yearly subscriber and am currently on a 370+ day streak (great gamification feature btw)

Frankly, the more I use it the more dull it gets. I haven‚Äôt seen much change since I first used it a few years ago. Even looking through the update history it‚Äôs a copy-paste about the app rather than what the update entails. It does feel like not much has changed. 

I‚Äôd be great to see some bugs fixed, meditation searches more intuitive, a better save library - maybe letting users have their own playlists for different types of meditations, and, in my opinion, adding more variety of meditations and series rather than getting big names as narrators. 

As a genuinely big fan of the app I‚Äôd just love to see some changes to make this app the hub for meditation. Keeping it exciting, challenging, and effective even for people who do it daily
title: Great but complacent

review:
Firstly, this is a great app. It was recommended to me by a health and wellness coach as a tool for strengthening my resiliency. It has definitely helped. After having used this app for over a year now, and through such life changes as losing a parent to cancer, moving houses twice and weathering temporary separation from my partner due to his work projects, well let‚Äôs just say I‚Äôm glad  to have this app in my toolkit.

Amongst other things, I‚Äôve been using the Kids Sleep Stories to help my kiddo sleep at night. The drawback to doing that is that Calm will track this as part of my usage, so it‚Äôs making my Stats and Streaks inaccurate.

I wish there was a way to track my kiddo‚Äôs usage separately without paying for another account. Perhaps a Kids Only Dashboard?

Other than that, I‚Äôm in love with the quality of content and all the different ways this app supports my mental health. I turned on push notifications for ‚ÄòResets‚Äô and love the messages I get from that. The Breathing exercises are well designed, not too busy and with sufficient visual and audio cues. I‚Äôm enjoying the different Masterclasses and Daily content as well.
title: Separate Kid Dashboard Please

review:
There‚Äôs a variety of things I wasn‚Äôt expecting from this app, and I am continually using more aspects of it. I do wish it wasn‚Äôt so expensive to use so I‚Äôm thinking of getting the lifetime subscription option. I really don‚Äôt have extra money but it helps me sleep and helps me to take breaks. The features on it are always a joy to explore. I LOVE the sleep songs that are deconstructed from popular songs. And of course soundscapes and sleep stories, and there‚Äôs more as well. 
        One of my favorite apps ever, honestly. This is one of those apps that makes having a smart phone such a great thing. Please don‚Äôt ever go away Calm App!!!
title: I look forward to using this app every day!

review:
Most of what‚Äôs offered here isn‚Äôt traditional meditation. The focus is definitely on a lot of talking and guidance. The paid plan gives you access to a large number of sessions. But most of these are by one individual. The lack of variety is surprising, especially give the cost. Starting in Jan 2021, the offerings improved, but mostly more of the same. 

To make matters worse, the app supposedly tracks your sessions. Results are inconsistent, with some sessions not logged. There was briefly a display of a weekly goal, in addition to ‚Äústreaks.‚Äù Now I‚Äôm on a new phone and that is gone? Why? A few months ago, sessions weren‚Äôt being logged if the app wasn‚Äôt open when the session ended. <sigh> Again, surprising shortcomings for the price and how long Calm had been around.

I got subscription through Amex, which is nice, but I won‚Äôt be renewing. That‚Äôs for sure.
title: Paid offerings limited; poor logging of sessions

review:
I might delete soon if I can‚Äôt figure out a way around listening to Tamara. This app is amazing in concept. Really great UI and I LOVE the sleep stories and the soothing voices of some of the actors that have made appearances on the app. But the way Tamara speaks GRINDS my gears and is so not soothing. Her phony upbeat cadence actually gives me anxiety and reminds me of a dog food commercial where they‚Äôre playing that whistling upbeat commercial tune. I know, I know... My review is very un-zen. But it‚Äôs because I just excitedly opened this app to get some much needed calming, and heard her very unmeditative voice. I should clarify that I‚Äôm not criticizing her actual voice ‚Äî but rather the method of narration and cadence, which is overall too bright and energetic and phony. Frustrated and wanting to love this app more. 

Recommendation: Let us select the narrator for guided meditations!
title: Tamara Levitt‚Äôs narration ruins my meditations

review: Hi I‚Äôm Ellie and I have a very hard time getting a good amount of sleep that‚Äôs why I use kids stories on calm. Every time I can‚Äôt go to sleep I listen to a story and fall asleep almost immediately. I also sometimes use the breath or the daily move. I use the breath because it helps me relax and calm down. I use that daily move cus it helps my move stretch and it makes me feel tired. My favorite part about calm is the kids stories. My favorite story is raggedy an stories. I like that story because it reminds me of just being calm you know. Anyway this is why I use calm and I think if you have any trouble with breathing falling to sleep exercise and much more. Calm has it. üòä
title: Hood books

review: When I first discovered Calm, I was a little shocked by the price of the premium subscription(thankfully my mom took care of that). The different soundscapes and music has really helped me out when I‚Äôm on a trip somewhere and need some background noise for wherever I‚Äôm staying. The different Sleep Stories are also quite entertaining and I fall asleep in minutes. My personal favorite Sleep Stories are: ‚ÄúThe Glacier Express‚Äù, ‚ÄúSouth Africa‚Äôs Blue Train‚Äù, ‚ÄúHistory of The Transformers‚Äù( big science fiction fan btw), ‚ÄúAn Australian Adventure‚Äù (RIP Steve), and ‚ÄúSacred New Zealand‚Äù (quite fond of LEGO‚Äôs Bionicle franchise). BTW Tamara Levitt, if you‚Äôre reading this, I just want you to know that I really love your app!
title: Worth every dollar (and then some)

review:
I‚Äôve had an iPhone since 2009. This is my first App Store review. I have severe mental illness and the calm app can literally help me stop from having a panic attack. The Panic S.O.S. Series is such an amazing tool. 
I can get overwhelmed quickly but my thoughts return to normal after these sessions. 
I love that I can save my favorites. I particularly love the soundscapes. I‚Äôm listening to Water, Giver of Life. It is just so soothing and when listening to it with my headphones I feel like I‚Äôm on vacation while doing work at the kitchen table. 
It‚Äôs a transformative app and I can‚Äôt recommend it enough. 
Thank you Tamra Levitt for you sharing your gift of guiding me through my meditations. ‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Don‚Äôt let the subscription stop you

review:
This app is great if you‚Äôre new to mediation, but it used to be better. For some reason, not all of the mediation series will keep track of where you‚Äôre at in the series, only the ones authored by Tamera (not saying anything against her but this is such a pointless drop in app design). 

The streak calendar will only keep track of completed meditations, but at the same time, you can‚Äôt click on a day to see which meditations you completed. On top of that, if calm doesn‚Äôt record a meditation you complete and you enter it manually it will break your ‚Äústreak.‚Äù 

ALL of the meditations have the same flow format (ie, starts with a message, meditate for two minutes, ends with message), which gets corny and old. It‚Äôs time to put some actual GUIDED meditations back on the app where the narrators are just there to guide NOT to LEAD or talk at you
title: They need in-app feedback

review: I downloaded calm on the recommendation of a friend about sleeping. I started with the 30 day introduction to meditation and found it very helpful as a start to meditation. I tried a few daily calms but I found Tamara‚Äôs voice a bit grading at first. Sorry tamara! However I began considering that that was simply a resistance I was having in my mind to embarking on a practice and was then easily able to overcome that thought and I now find Tamara delightful. Many days I find very useful guidance and advice in the daily meditations that I am able to bring my life with my family and particularly in a challenging work environment where I am the leader of many diverse personalities.
title: Incredibly Influential and Worthwhile

review: It took me a year to really get into this app, but it is so versatile and packed with so much resources. I love it! I love the little refresh messages sent to me daily, I really enjoy all the various meditations and talks that they have by so many different people, but sometimes I just want to listen to music that matches my mood of low stress, and they even have a Hawaiian slack key guitar playlist! It has everything that I need for when I‚Äôm in the mood for a specific resource. Comprehensive, and well worth the premium version! I‚Äôm lucky, my healthcare provider pays for it, but now that I know how helpful. and resource rich it is, I totally would pay for the premium version!
title: Comprehensive App

review: What I love: I use this app almost every night for the sleep stories, which are excellent and highly effective. Thank you SO much for providing such high quality scripts and voice talent. I also appreciate the variety of topics - and diversity of voices. My issue: Most of the stories are around 30 minutes, which is long enough to put me to sleep. But then I often awaken when they end and have to manually restart or start a different one, which means more interrupted sleep. My request: Please please please add either a playlist option or continuous play feature and/or more anthologies. Thank you üôèüíó
title: Sleep stories - options for longer play please!

review: This app has been wonderful. It has helped me fall asleep (and back to sleep) so easily. I‚Äôve always wanted to meditate but I have a difficult time sitting still for long so the short, guided meditations are perfect. I‚Äôm happy to pay for it - the cost is much less than a therapy session and gives me a daily dose of mental fitness. My only suggestion would be to have a couple more voices, especially for the sleep meditations. I enjoy one person for the daily meditations, but the rise and fall of her voice doesn‚Äôt work well for me to fall asleep too and she is on many of them so I find myself doing the same few. Not a big deal really, but just a thought.
title: I LOVE this app!

review: In many ways, Calm has been an incredible source of guidance for me throughout my life. It has introduced me to amazing practices from around the world and helped me to navigate along my journey. Over my time using this program, I‚Äôve been able to develop a mindset that has opened me up to the beauty of wellness and because Calm‚Äôs content is always expanding, there‚Äôs always something that I can look forward to. It‚Äôs brilliantly designed and formatted cohesively with many features that can be tailored to any liking. I can say with sincerity that Calm is one of the best experiences of its kind, and I recommend it to anyone wanting to take the time to practice self care.
title: A Wonderful Guide

review: My friend introduced me to the Calm app, I had heard about it already and saw ads recommending it but never had the opportunity or need to use it until now.  I am 23 weeks pregnant and all the worries I usually have under control, have come to the surface with this new pregnancy hormones and random pregnancy dreams. The calm app has features to soothe me to sleep, focusing on my peace instead of the unwanted racing thoughts.  I also learned new breathing techniques that actually work fast.  I have not even begin to explore this app to the fullest but just with a couple of options I‚Äôm handling this temporary anxiety in a hopeful way.  Thank you to the creators and innovators from Calm.
title: Excellent tool

review: I‚Äôve used this app every single night for years - it is THE BEST for falling asleep. I‚Äôm always amazed at the sheer volume of content available across all categories. It‚Äôs also super easy to use. None of these confusing subscription levels of access. Calm seriously has content for so many situations - beautiful music to work to, meditations for any occasion/length, background soundscapes/white noise, and of course the amazing library of sleep stories for both us and the kids. I even use the app  as a white noise machine for the baby when we travel. Seriously the best money I spend each year - beyond great value for the very reasonable subscription fee.
title: A Nightly Staple

review:
I‚Äôm going to split this reveiw into 2 parts:
The good:
This app is prettey good at getting you into meditation, better sleep, and can help you calm down in moments of overwhelm and panic.
The bad:
However, this app has its flaws. The first flaw is that too much stuff is premium! I know, i know, people still have to make money. But 76% of stuff is premium! 50% of stuff should be premium in my opinion, but, just know, this is my opinion. I don‚Äôt know what works for people of the app. The second flaw is that, sometimes, when you try to play a FREE masterclass, ( free as in no lock icon wich basically means free), it MAKES you try premium! This is a common marketing ploy that i hate! Finally, the third flaw: this app is WAY too much for a premium! I hope you change some things, Calm.
title: 3 stars for 3 complaints

review: Love the app, but really love the immersive sounds scapes because they help me focus during work. My favorite soundscape by far is The Office because I used to enjoy playing that in the background while I worked, but would get distracted sometimes by the plot. Now I can immerse myself into the environment of The Office with the soundscape and not get distracted. However, I have found that the same content repeats a lot while I work. It would be awesome to expand this. I will be a faithful subscriber if there are routine updates to the office background noise. I just need 7-8 hours to listen to on repeat, but would happily take more than that. Please!!! Thank you
title: More Office soundscape please

review:
I don‚Äôt even know how to fully capture in this review everything this app has done for me. I‚Äôm so grateful to have this in my life because it has helped me contain everything that comes with my anxiety. The physical sensations, the constant worrying, and all of the stress seem to always die down a bit whenever I use this app. From the soundscapes, anxiety release meditations, Tamara‚Äôs voice, and all the Daily Calms, it all adds up to making my life just better. So thank you to all of the people who were a part of making this app a reality, and for making it a safe space for me to release the negative and bring in the positive. THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU!

-Christian
title: Thank you

review: I really truly find myself when reading and listening, I have not yet but I will write down these quotes and take them with me. Right now I just breath just like lebron said (just breath and let you mind and body find the knowing (calm). Although I do believe I am different from who I was years ago (And I‚Äôm 21 now) I deal with depression. I do believe writing down the quotes and sayings by these people talking will heal my wounded mind. I couldn‚Äôt think of much more to say because I am in my break at work right now, but I love u Calm (your app touches me in levels) and thank you for letting me write this review and thank you to my cousin for putting me on to know about Calm app.
title: Cousins job

review: Calm is pretty good. The only thing that is bad is the fact that you have to pay for it. You can only get like, 2 meditations if you don‚Äôt pay $70. Other than that, very soothing and effective. I have fallen asleep  several times during one of these üòÇ. Would definitely do the women‚Äôs voice, because it is more calming and trancelike. Be careful with the sleep stories, because you will find yourself wanting to hear the end of the story, and it keeping you from sleeping. Would recommend to a friend tho, because it helps you manage your anger, relax, and learn to go with the flow. ALSO IF YOU READ THIS DOWNLOAD ROBLOX, SUCH A GOOD APP, IM ADDICTED, AND IF YOUR LOOKING FOR A NEW APP WOULD RECOMMEND.
title: Pretty good, but 1 thing

review: When I first got calm I could turn on a specific sound or sleep music and it‚Äôd play the same thing on loop every night until I woke up. With current update, it gives the option for how long you can set the specific sound to play, but it doesn‚Äôt do it. For instance I will set the sleep timer for 9 hours (just in case) on the Milky Way sleep music and when I wake up, which is always well before that time or in the middle of the night , it‚Äôs not playing the Milky Way sleep sound. I‚Äôve grown accustomed to falling asleep to this sound and when I get up numerous times throughout my the night it has helped me fall back asleep quickly. So for it to not even be playing an hour to 2 hours after I‚Äôve initially turned it on is frustrating considering the amount I pay for the app.
title: Sounds you listen too

review: Meditation isn‚Äôt something I was super familiar with before I bought this app, but a therapist, in conjunction with some books I read, suggested that I try it. Now, I won‚Äôt go a day without meditating in the morning. It‚Äôs how I start my day, and it‚Äôs an integral part of my well-being. The journaling aspect is invaluable, and I have recommended this app to countless friends and family members. The only thing I would suggest to the developers is to allow the music portion (new music by Keith Urban is üëèüôåüëåüèΩ) to be played outside the app, so that when I‚Äôm checking e-mail, making dinner or using another app, the music still plays in the background.
title: Best Gift I‚Äôve Ever Given Myself

review: This is a worthwhile app, however it has limited fiction stories for adults. Some of the children‚Äôs fables have been interesting and some not. Adult stories like The Time Machine, Gulliver‚Äôs Travels, Gift of the Magi were wonderful. There were interesting, but I was not so engrossed in the story that I could not drift off to sleep. Most of the nonfiction stories do not engage my mind enough and thus my mind starts to wander. One app category is fiction stories but the majority of stories listed in this section are nonfiction. Seems like it would not be hard to keep the categories straight.  I Had not planned to renew because I found another app with more adult stories but I missed the deadline and was already charged. I will keep one more year and hope for more adult fiction.
title: Limited stories for adults

review:
I had to open up to it because I was anxious at first in general. You may know how that goes.. but wow. I‚Äôve been benefiting so much. From the stories and meditations to the reflections and check ins. I could say a lot. But most importantly, I feel a: more relaxed and clear, and b: pleasantly surprised to know more about myself and feel growth. 
and the only reason I would be surprised at all is because I try to have an open mind when it comes to apps. This app is great. I would suggest the free trial and definitely experience it the full way through to see how you like it. I opened up to exploring more after a couple days. And I felt inspired to leave this review. Best.
title: I‚Äôm impressed. Very effective for me.

review: Okay the title is definitely misleading because I just wanted you to look at this review. It is like a normal good review because I love calm and it helps me fall asleep fast. You should definitely get this because it helps a ton. I have one request. I want to be able to listen to multiple different stories but when I look up certain stories they are either different  than they should be or they aren‚Äôt in calm. It is annoying because even though calm is very relaxing it is not great. For example I was listening to a great story that was nice in the beginning but then the narrator started to tell the story in FRENCH!!!!!!!!! Most of all though  calm is good so you should get it.
title: Calm is the worst thing in the world!!!

review:
The app is an excellent tool to add to your toolkit or coping skills so to speak. Incorporated into my daily routine it is a very effective quick way to check in to manage my stress and any other emotion I experience. As a licensed clinician working in the mental health field I have a duty to take care of myself above all things. Calm helps me relieve the stress of the work day and reminds me that I can only help others if I am at my best. Being centered and ready to take on the day with happiness, enthusiasm, and passion is the foundation of my existence. Adding Calm to my tool box, bag of tricks, or coping skills no matter what language you use this is a valuable addition to your self-care routine.
Susan Bergen
title: Calm App

review:
Beyond the artistry of Calm‚Äôs daily meditations is its thoughtful content.  From body movement to nightly calming stories there is something for whatever you need in any particular day. 

I recently attempted the kids meditation with my 11 year old son. He has ADHD and it was a hard sell. Within 3 minutes and Tamara‚Äôs calming voice he was calmed and invested. Tamara mentioned having anxiety over something you might have said and being unsure. My son said, mom! That exactly how I feel!  We finished the meditation and he was calm and ready to talk about his social anxiety. What a great momma and son bonding time! 

Love this thoughtful app. I am so blessed to have it as a tool in my life‚Äôs toolkit.
title: My daily Calm practice

review: I have been using this app to help me sleep and relax. I have severe G.A.D. and this really helps. I would recommend the rain sounds if you want to relax or study, I find them great to help you focus. The app is very easy to work with and use. The prices may be expensive for sounds, but it is helpful. There are many unique features that I adore about this; the check-ins are my favorite of them. You can write about your day and other topics and the app ‚Äòstores‚Äô them if that is the right word, and look at them later. In conclusion, I really support and recommend this app to anyone who is thinking about getting it!
title: Amazing and definitely recommend.

review: I struggle at night to just lay there and go to sleep. I don‚Äôt want to think. So I distract myself with a game or social media only to get sucked in and end up staying up WAY later than I had wanted. Calm has really helped me with this. Instead, I‚Äôll click on the app and try one of the many options to help me sleep. Sometimes a sleep story does the trick, other times it doesn‚Äôt so I try something else. One night the sound of rain is soothing to me, and the next night it bugs me so I try a meditation instead. I love the variety available because of my ever changing moods. But it has been very helpful and I recommend it to everyone.
title: So helpful

review: It‚Äôs a nice app I can tell because I‚Äôve had a subscription for a white but wasn‚Äôt able to pay for it anymore. I‚Äôd like to take time to say it‚Äôs good enough except you have to pay for everything. Some things such as special things like music is free stories free etc. but maybe stuff like getting up so and so and so. Could cost money. Of course this is just an example of something you may have other ideas but this one really hits my mind when I see this app on tiktok, insta, Tv ads, Etc etc. in all. Pay for some don‚Äôt pay for others. I hope you find this message helpful even though I know you‚Äôd most likely not change anything. If you think about it even one thing such as story‚Äôs or music get back to me :) have a very nice day.
userName: i'm hungry so much I could die
title: Paying.

review: I downloaded the app on a recommendation from a friend. Overall it seems ok except for the nag screens about enabling notifications and the default background noise that takes a help search to find out how to turn off. I looked for an app like this because my life is already wound too tight, and these two aspects alone just about made me delete the app before I even listened to a second of content. I shouldn‚Äôt be feeling more stressed by an app that‚Äôs supposed to help me be calm. My suggestions‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt make notifications a focal point at initial startup, and give the user a clearly identified choice to turn on background noise or have a silent scene. Not everyone is thrilled by constant noise, especially high pitched crickets.
title: Would be a lot better without the anti-calm defaults

review: I don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôm the only one having this issue. My phone or iPad tends to freeze while using the app. I can‚Äôt force shut off my phone or iPad. I can‚Äôt exit the screen I can‚Äôt do anything. This becomes extremely stressful I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs just lagging or if my devices are frozen. I‚Äôve tried to see if maybe it‚Äôs because there is a live background with sound for this app, I thought maybe that‚Äôs the reason for the glitch. I tried to see if I can turn it off but there‚Äôs no option to turn it off. I love the app and the stories I just don‚Äôt like that it causes my device to freeze to where I can‚Äôt close the app.
title: Freezes

review: Calm has some of the greatest sleep stories with a huge range of topics and narrators‚Äô voices. Almost all the stories are 20-30 minutes. There is still no queue feature so if you wake up in the night, you have to go in and choose another story (very poor arrangement in this with Calm‚Äôs Still Awake? Page that blocks access to stories) and hope that looking for another story doesn‚Äôt wake you up more. Some poor design elements, like a virtually hidden Search by Narrator feature, which was hidden more during the last update. Still, it‚Äôs one of the better sleep apps. For the ANNUAL subscription price, though, I‚Äôd expect it to be perfect. 3.5 out of 5 stars.
title: Great sleep stories but no queue feature

review:
So I use the Thunderstorm sound to sleep.  I love sleeping with it.  I would like this app more if either the subscription were cheaper, we can pick and choose which sections (Meditations, Music, Sleep Stories, etc) to subscribe to at a cheaper rate, or even buying specific pieces outright ala Apple Music.  I would like to buy the ‚ÄúThunderstorm‚Äù soundscape and that‚Äôs it.  Maybe letting us sample certain soundscapes for a day or something would be nice because I‚Äôm not buying a year and I‚Äôm not doing a free trial for a week where I‚Äôll forget to cancel it.

For $70, even $42, this is a huge expenditure I don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôll even like or not, and I‚Äôm sure others feel this way too.
title: Pretty expensive for stuff that‚Äôs not really wanted.

review:
First, I want to start out that this app has a lot of great content. It‚Äôs well worth the money to get a mental break and spend time with myself. It‚Äôs been an absolute joy getting to know my inner self and dialogue. 
That being said, there are a few things that i would love to see. 
I find the navigation to be a bit clunky. When I click on ‚Äúbedtime stories‚Äù it will only show a handful. The recent list doesn‚Äôt have an option to delete. If I heard something that, quite frankly, I find annoying, I can‚Äôt remove from recent. 
More meditation voices and more beginner fully guided meditations would be helpful. Sometimes they‚Äôre a little too advanced for me.
title: A few options I would like to see

review: I like that you can journal, and the meditations are soothing. Some do make me anxious but there‚Äôs a huge selection of you subscribe. I like all the check ins because I get somewhat of a journaling opportunity. What I think could be improved are the check ins. Why can I only do a mood check in prior to meditating? Why can‚Äôt I just add one through the day? Why can‚Äôt I create my own tags? I have to choose from limited options. I‚Äôd easily add 5 of my own tags in any given check in. Especially the sleep check in. Why don‚Äôt I have an opportunity to add text in the sleep check in as I do in literally every other check in. These check ins have kind of been doubling as my journaling for the day but I wish those sections were more customizable.
title: It‚Äôs decent.

review: I have been using your app specifically for bedtime stories for years now. I remember when you had a very limited amount of stories to choose from. I really love your app but I am hard of hearing. There are several bedtime stories that I can‚Äôt listen to because the volume is too low or too soft. I turn the volume all the way up on my phone, still cannot hear it.  I listen to the bedtime stories every night. It is the only app that I actually pay for, that‚Äôs how much I enjoy it. I especially like the stories with music in the background. They are my favorites.I am very grateful you created this app.
title: Sound Level

review:
I love this app and use it every night! My favorite narrators are Chik√© Okonkwo and Erik Braa. The ‚Äúwalkthrough‚Äù sleep stories about various places around the world are my favorite, along with Bob Ross‚Äô Joy of Painting.

One thing I would love to see added is an option to create playlists. Some of the stories are on the shorter side, so it would be great to stack up a custom variety of my favorite narrators / stories + soundscapes - and allow them to play on for as long as I need.

I was definitely skeptical of using Calm at first but this app has completely improved my ability to fall asleep and now I can‚Äôt sleep without it!
title: Calm is essential / want to see playlists!

review: I started using this app when a migraine tracker app I was using recommended meditation as a migraine relief method. So glad I did! On days when I have brutal migraine pain, listening to the daily calm or the pain specific lessons helps me to reduce the pain from excruciating to a bearable level. Also once I began exploring the resources available on this app beyond simply pain relief, I have found the series on focus/procrastination to be incredibly helpful professionally, and also greatly enjoy the calming music library! Great app that keeps getting better. This is the only app I have on my phone that I pay for, and it‚Äôs worth every dollar.
title: My go-to for migraine relief

review: I‚Äôve been using Calm for over a year now and it helped me tremendously during the pandemic. I love that the daily meditations are short and inspiring, soothing voices of the narrators/teachers. I‚Äôve started listening to the night time books but always fall asleep (which means they work!). I also like the feature to set your own meditation time with nature sounds, sometimes I do need a longer session. Although I am not a 100% regular meditator, it‚Äôs always easy to come back to it. Music for work works great as well, it doesn‚Äôt seem overpowering or distracting but adds some dynamic to my work-from-home life. Thank you, Calm! ‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Excellent app!

review: I have tried to use this app and it kept shutting down only a second after I open it.  I deleted it for a while and then reinstalled it a month or so later and it worked fine until the meditation music let randomly playing in the background without prompting or even the app being open. The only way I could stop it was to turn off the phone. I eventually deleted the app as it kept going off during my zoom calls. Seriously please figure out what is going on so I can start using it again. I have another meditation app I can use in the meantime.
title: Random music playing from Calm app???

review:
I recently lost my brother and I have always struggled with being in a crowd but this app taught me the best way of coping with it if one way doesn‚Äôt seem to work right for you then go check out another one!! They have sooo many different ways for all kinds of different people!
It helps me sleep better and it has always helped me be happier and healthier! I very much recommend to people who are struggling with anxiety depression ADHD health sleep autism anything that you‚Äôre mentally struggling with I think it would even be helpful for those who aren‚Äôt struggling with mental health I feel so much happier and healthier ever since I started
title: Thank you!!

review: I‚Äôve been using this app for over two years and absolutely love it..use it to put my grandson down for a nap too.. he loves the Velveteen Rabbit.  My favs are Jerome Flynn and Stephen Frye and just to many to list them all.  Even got my three aunts hooked...the giggles that came from them as soon as Matthew McConaughey says ‚Äúhello there‚Äù was hilarious..they are all between the ages of 65-70.. my husband and I use it almost every night and I really don‚Äôt think we‚Äôve ever made it though one to the end.  The music is also very relaxing and my dogs (two English bulldogs) also love relaxing to the stories and music..definitely worth the money I paid for the app
title: Love it!

review: I absolutely love the content on this ap.  The only thing I think could be better is an option for making playlists or stacking of tracks.  One of my favorite features on the app is the sleep stories.  This issue is that I regularly wake up because the sleep story is over and have to fumble with my phone to turn on the next one, or go to a soundscape.  An option somewhere to string together content would solve this problem for me.  The best would be in there was also a fade in fade out option on the tracks so the beginnings and endings aren‚Äôt so abrupt.  Can you tell I struggle with sleep?! üòÇ Thanks for a great app, I do use it everyday ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Love the app, wish I could stack tracks

review: I wanted to try something new to help je sleep better, I am happy with what I use already but there is always room for improvement or try hew things. I saw an ad for this app online and it looked promising but he price they want (70 bucks per year) for it I would lose sleep. They can keep their app. If you are looking for a good app where you can do a one time track purchase and use it as much as you want, which good 3d audio recording, try Naturescape.  I've used them for about 7-9 years and it is the best so far. Specially considering the money I've saved. The developer of this app should go to a purchase based app, not  dumb subscription. Most people never use all the tracks available anyway. Most people once they find ine they like they stick to it. They know it, they just want to milk every penny they can out from people.
title: Pricing is a joke.

review: If you wait about 24-36 hrs and don‚Äôt use Apple to sign up for the app, it will email you a 40% discount. 40$ or $2.40 a month for 1 yr. I‚Äôll be honest that‚Äôs not so bad and I‚Äôll probably buy it with the store credits accumulated from delivery refunds from ****.  I‚Äôm still not convinced though cause if you want to cancel it sounds like you‚Äôre not given a portion of the refund back which just sounds like a $ grab and if you‚Äôre going to develop an app about mindfulness you should be more mindful of your customers. I will read up on it‚Äôs refund policy, if it‚Äôs only offering annual subscriptions and no refunds after cancellation that at least offer 50% back within first 6 months then I will not be purchasing.
title: Pricey, offered 40% off, still on the fence

review:
I used to use this daily- see my original review below. Now I get stressed out every time I open because it's so busy and rife with options. There are so many choices it's overwhelming. And, the ones I used to like, I can't even find. I finally deleted it. Going to search for a simpler app that actually brings me calm. 

This  was my original review: I've been using the app for a couple of years and eventually upgraded to the paid version. I like being able to pick how I want to feel. You can choose the background scene/audio (the fireplace and misty stream are my favorites). You can also pick the focus of the meditations (eg. energy, gratitude), and the length (2, 5, 10+ minutes). I was fairly new to meditation and this app made it really easy for me to do it regularly and enjoy it. I'm happy to say it's now a consistent practice in my life!
title: Simple and effective

review: I have been using this app every day/night for years and I love it! I just have a few small recommendations for improvement on the app: 1: Once a story has been completed, it stops the app/nothing plays/all finished‚Ä¶ Can you please set up a way for users to select a story to play and then a soundscape to play immediately after that story is over without having to wake up and do it a few hours later? 2: Or can you set up a way for the story to be set on repeat so we can listen to it throughout the night and continue to sleep? Thanks!
title: Love this app! (But request a few small improvements)

review: The sleep stories, meditations, etc with great narrators are just that - great! They‚Äôre really effective and I love the variety of offerings within each category. How. Ev. Er. I don‚Äôt know if she created the app and therefore voices many of the pieces, but Tamara Levitt‚Äôs voice makes my skin crawl. (I really mean no offense if you‚Äôre reading this Tamara! I‚Äôm sure you‚Äôre a wonderful kind human and I appreciate you!) It feels sickly sweet and overly gentle, the vocal fry and flirty lilt make it impossible for me to focus on the meditation. Like at all. It feels very self-conscious and fake. Like a Dove chocolate commercial. That‚Äôs obviously not the intention, it‚Äôs just way too much of a performance of a meditation guide for me. Other than that-love the app!
title: I‚Äôd give it 5 stars, but‚Ä¶

review: I‚Äôve reported the app to the FTC, about to start a case with the BBB and suspect, in my opinion, that it is also a scam. I loved the app so much that I purchased gift cards for my family members. The gift cards were unredeemable. I have spent months trying to get a refund and just keep getting the runaround. I since switched meditation apps and now I‚Äôm alleging that they are trying to back me into a corner by only offering to credit their accounts when we no longer wish to be customers. I‚Äôve also read reports on the Better Business bureau (BBB) site and other reviews and complaints, it seems I am not the only one having issues with refunds based on what I‚Äôve seen others allege online. Do your research. There is a possibility you never get your money refunded when you have every right to receive a refund in my opinion.
title: Possible Scam (in my opinion)

review: I cannot recommend this more! My favorite sleep story is ocean moon. I also listen to the sounds of acoustic guitar - desert something I can't remember. My kids and I listen to the children sleep stories, captain dream beard is their favorite and puts them right to sleep. I also listen to some of the ten minute clips, there's so many to choose from it's an incredible collection of ways to start the day. I often wake up in the middle of the night and the calm app is my go to EVERY time! The best app I have ever purchased. Thank you calm team!! More sleep stories narrated by Laura Dern - she has the most relaxing story telling voice!
title: A very useful tool!

review: I started with Calm for the sleep stories and soundscapes. Eventually, our family started also using it for regulating the kiddos‚Äô big feelings. Then we got into the routine of them picking sleep stories every night. It‚Äôs AMAZING how frequently new sleep stories for kids AND grown ups are released. I have also done the morning meditations and love it. Seriously this app is worth EVERY PENNY with the range of tools (and voices!! lots of amazing celebrities!). If you were on the fence about paying for the app, just go for it! There will be lots for you to explore - most important, yourself.
title: Better sleep, calmer kids, highly recommended for parents AND kids

review:
I‚Äôd be way LESS calm if I coughed up $70 I can‚Äôt afford to part with for a subscription to an app which purports to help me BE calm. 

It is deliberately misleading that you don‚Äôt straight up post the cost in the App Store. It is heavily implied that although there is the option of purchasing a premium version, there is still a free version. Which you *technically* DO‚Ä¶however, there is literally next to nothing in the free version and you know it. At the very least, you could have a tab or search option for the free/basic content, but you don‚Äôt even do that. Nor do you offer an option to pay monthly, but instead insist we fork over a chunk of cash yearly. It‚Äôs a lot easier for me - and I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôm not alone - to pay, say, $8-10/month than to shell it all out at once (even though, yes I know, the yearly cost would be cheaper overall). Not only that, but even if I could easily spare $70 for a year, some of us are hesitant to plunk down so much cash for a commitment to an app for that long. 

And what‚Äôs possibly most glaring is you don‚Äôt even respond to concerns like this. You only grace those with a response from whom you get a hearty pat-on-the-back, rave review. In other words, y‚Äôall really could not care less. Pfft.

It‚Äôs a shame.
title: Ironically‚Ä¶

review:
I really enjoy the simplicity and various aspects of the app when it ranges from beginner meditation, daily meditation, sound scapes or even music. The easy access on my phone makes it a little easier to make meditation a habit. 

Honestly I gave it 4 stars because I wish there were more options for the self check ins. I‚Äôm not just tired I‚Äôm exhausted. I‚Äôm not angry I‚Äôm aggravated, annoyed or frustrated. I‚Äôm not unsure but I can be melancholy. It‚Äôd be nice to have more accurate progress checks, self check ins or reflections. Especially since I signed up for the premium. Also I wish there was more spiritual guided meditations, reaching a higher self or working on strengthening your intuition. It‚Äôs nice to work with those from time to time.
title: Perfect for beginners

review: As a clinical psychologist of nearly 30 years, I have certainly known the concept of ‚ÄúMindfulness‚Äù and its value. This app has provided a fantastic way for me to learn and put into daily use this practice of mindfulness and I cannot imagine that it would not be very good for anyone. Jeff has a good handle on walking the beginner through the learning process (The Beginners Guide is a very good place to start) and really, research shows that just a few minutes a day can make a substantial difference in your life. This, I highly recommend this app and daily Mindfulness practice (just ask my patients‚Ä¶they can tell youüòÇ)
title: Excellent practice for Peace

review:
I NEVER write reviews but making an exception because Calm has helped me move through some pretty significant blockage in my life. Having a practice we can stick to is crucial; this app hits me where I need it, in the most gentle way I could hope. Words can hardly describe my gratitude. 

Tamara‚Äôs daily morning meditations have helped me reset many times. It‚Äôs truly profound as I‚Äôve tried many different forms and practices; nothing ever clicked long-term. 

I felt stuck, but not anymore. When I go back to feeling stuck, Calm answers in a way that feels special, helps me feel seen even when alone. Undoubtedly, lots of love and thought went into developing this app. One can feel the intention in the quality of content; no fluff here. Kudos to all who participated; you‚Äôre changing lives ‚ù§Ô∏è

One last note: my daughter LOVES the nighttime stories; we meditate together before bed. I mean, come on - pretty awesome, right?!  

Buy the app and Godspeed on you journey.

- Signed, 

Internet Stranger
title: Looking for some peace in your life? Try this app.

review: I am new to mindfulness and meditation. My motivation is to increase my overall well being, both physically and psychologically. From my very first Daily Calm with Tamara Levitt, to Masterclasses on gratitude and radical self compassion, I look forward to what‚Äôs in store each day. I am learning to be present‚Ä¶ and how to make meditation an enjoyable priority. I love the way the app is organized and the content. I paid the yearly subscriber fee on faith... not knowing what to expect. Wow - I am so glad I did. It is an incredible value and I will be using the app for as long as it‚Äôs available. Thank you, Calm!!! I wish I had started using this app years ago!
title: Great for Beginners

review: This app looks like it has lots of great content, however I didn‚Äôt get to fully explore it before deleting. My main issue isn‚Äôt what‚Äôs in the app but rather the app‚Äôs behavior on my phone. I would keep going back to switch off cellular data, background refresh, and other such things for it and would return shortly after to find the app had switched itself back on. This happened again and again even after updating, restarting, anything I could think of that might cause a glitch. It wasn‚Äôt every app that would do this. There were just this and two other apps that I‚Äôve also now deleted that would turn themselves back on. I don‚Äôt know if this is a glitch or if it‚Äôs a really creepy intentional feature but I wasn‚Äôt cool with that.
title: Glitch? Or creepiness?

review: Calm has meditations, but it also has music, soundscapes, sleep stories, stories of wisdom, and more. I haven‚Äôt even begun to scratch the surface of what it offers, but I can usually find something that I need. I‚Äôm a school counselor and when I have a student come into my office in a panic, I will sometimes play the SOS guided breathing. When I get on a flight, I will play the guided breathing for flying anxiety. In the morning I listen to the morning coffee playlist (while I drink my coffee) to keep myself from diving headfirst into work emails. As an adult with ADHD, it has kept me centered. I could not recommend this app enough.
title: So much more than you think

review: Ok so this app is amazing I mean it actually works!!!! My anxiety level is really high sometime or frequently more likely and I get really anxious. But this app has basically removed all of that from my Mind! And this is my first day using it and it‚Äôs already helping? That sound to good to be true right? But no personally This app has helped a lot. It‚Äôs relaxing and supper stress relieving. And I have BAD anxiety I get anxiety from just waking up in the morning! I love this app and I‚Äôve been using to for LESS then a day! Basically only 15 minutes. Anyway the is an amazing app I suggest getting this app!!!
title: Please read!! If you are unsure of getting this app!!

review: Through the years I‚Äôve tried every sleep aid on the market, from over the counter pills to prescription. They all eventually lose their effectiveness with stronger and stronger doses needed, till they don‚Äôt work at all. The worst part is the grogginess the next day. CALM has been a God send. I use it every night. The stories are well crafted and eliminate thoughts racing around in my head. I get a good nights sleep and if I do wake up in the middle of the night, I just play another story. Taking a pill at that time always insured tiredness the next day whereas a CALM story just put me back to sleep. I truly love this app.
title: Better than a sleeping pill

review:
I‚Äôm really enjoying this app. It was recommended by a trusted friend who never steers me wrong. It‚Äôs a great investment, especially during these difficult times. We need to take better care of ourselves and each other and it truly begins with some personal mindful meditation or calm moments, other than just plain bravery in the midst of so much chaos. 

My favorite thing on this app is also the most simplest - the breathing exercise. Just in and out, with two simple relaxing chords and a simple expanding circle visual. But there‚Äôs so much more, and many meditations to choose from. I also enjoy the music without lyrics, and I‚Äôd like to see more of those. 

I think the only thing I take issue with is that my choices of meditations with voices are cut in half because I prefer femme/female higher voices than deeper male voices because of certain personal triggers. Other than that, this app is very helpful and there are still a lot of choices. 

Overall my suggestion would be to add more nature sounds that evoke change, like birds and wind, and lyric-free music. Thanks.
title: Great place to begin meditating

review: I use Calm a lot and I enjoy it it is great for my things I can use it for gratitude by doing the gratitude checkin or I can listen to a sleep story when I need to sleep and I can also do meditations when I‚Äôm stressed out or upset and it helped me an all scenarios I think this is a great app for everybody even though some people might think that why would I need this well you never know if you will have trouble sleeping or being any of the scenarios so I definitely recommend it makes life a lot easier andBetter please download if you have trouble relaxing or sleeping or anything like that
title: Great for relaxation meditationAnd more

review: Really enjoying the free trial. After a few days I decided I will be paying for the subscription when the 30 day trial is over. Anyone complaining about the price doesn't value peace of mind and sleep, a subscription of sleeping pills or anxiety medication would cost more than $15/month. I would like to know how often they add new stories. Sometimes I wake up in the middle of the night and start another sleep story and 9/10 times I'm sleeping before it ends. Really enjoying this app, so glad I've found it. Nothing in life is free and this app provides a wonderful variety of mind calming processes. Worth it.
title: Awesome

review: When you first sign in, it makes it seem like you NEED to get the premium, but YOU DONT HAVE TO BUY IT!! Just click the small semi-hidden X in the corner. Sadly, I‚Äôd you don‚Äôt get the premium, there aren‚Äôt many courses that you can do. So if the developers are reading this, PLEASE ADD MORE NON-PREMIUM COURSES!! I am starting an advanced class next week and it is already stressing me out, so I really hope this works. So far it seems like an ok app, and so far there aren‚Äôt any adds, which is a common complaint with other apps. I would give this app  3 1/2, but I can‚Äôt do halves, so I‚Äôll round up to 4 stars because there aren‚Äôt many courses that I can do. :(  So please add more courses! Thank you,
title: WARNING! READ BEFORE YOU GET

review: It may not seem like it at first , but this app does not have a wide range of different meditations. The library is shockingly small considering the price. They focus on celebrity gimmicks over quality and variety. I wish the sleep stories/meditations had options for audio overlay so you could adjust the sounds you‚Äôre hearing. E.g. I wish I could listen to binaural beats or crickets while a sleep story is playing, but instead it‚Äôs just silence. Or, I‚Äôll be listening to a sleep meditations and there are birds in the background, which makes me think of morning and isn‚Äôt what I want as I‚Äôm going to bed. Overall this app is such a disappointing experience, don‚Äôt waste your money. Only gave it two stars because there are a couple sleep stories I enjoy.
title: Extremely limited content

review:
Maybe I‚Äôm in the minority here, but I have completely stopped using this app because every time I did, my blood pressure would rise.
