The features are not well-organized, such as the settings (which really can‚Äôt be adjusted all that much, and you can‚Äôt adjust very many of them anyway). God forbid you accidentally push the wrong icon (which don‚Äôt have intuitive designs, by the way), and you start hearing talking and/or video that you can‚Äôt back out of right away without force-closing the app. Gee, how calming.

Also, there‚Äôs an almost worship-like over-reliance on celebrity voices. I don‚Äôt care what one of these overpaid idiots has to say ‚Äî unless their fame is a product of their being good at what this app promotes.

Lastly, I cannot stand that when I open this app, the first thing I see is a command: ‚ÄúTake a deep breath.‚Äù *You* take a deep breath. Stop telling me what to do with my breath ‚Äî that is something I control, and it‚Äôs no concern of yours. 

This app is annoying, overly insistent, aggravating, pretentious, and convoluted. It boggles my mind that it‚Äôs highly praised, and I absolutely regret getting such a long subscription ‚Äî probably because I was going through a tough time in my life and I thought this app could help. It didn‚Äôt.
title: Makes me less calm

review: So I just got this app because I have trouble falling asleep sometimes, and I got this in hopes to help with that. However when I got on the app I couldn‚Äôt really find anything that was free witch is kinda disappointing seeing as there are so many grate reviews, I understand why everything costs but it would be nice to at least have a few songs that are free so I know what I would be paying for or if I didn‚Äôt have money to spend on the app. In short  I did see some ads covering this app and it did seem like a really good app I just wish there were at least 1 or 2 free songs for the people who couldn‚Äôt afford to spend the money or who just wanted to see how things were before spending money.
title: Everything costs

review: I love this app so much I spent the money to upgrade to premium. For me, money well spent. There is an exercise called Panic SOS that walks you through the breathing count when my anxiety is at a 10. I also really like the Sleep Stories, it‚Äôs like having a bedtime story read to you, as an adult but the topics are usually distracting and helpful to help ease you into sleep. I often don‚Äôt hear the end. It may sound silly, but when you can‚Äôt shut your brain off because you‚Äôre fraught with worry, etc‚Ä¶ this is a helpful tool to distract and eventually, drift off into sleep. So many other great features!
title: Anxious & can‚Äôt sleep

review: When I first saw the app I was thinking ‚ÄúWell maybe this will help me sleep‚Äù so I downloaded and gave it a chance. But upon my request, I began to notice that almost everything costs money. And I understand that the company needs to make money and pay for the readings and everything but don‚Äôt you think it‚Äôs a little high? I personally wish that there were more free or cheaper options than a very select few. Meditation should be for everyone not just people who pay it. And to let everyone know, the free ones are at the complete bottom of the page. Not easy to find. If you made it to the end, thank you and keep meditating!
title: Love it but‚Ä¶

review: There is barely anything that s free. Mindfulness should be something that you can just do, and for me having to pay is stressful, and that is not what this app is for. The purpose of this app is to reduce stress and I thought it would help me but as soon as it started to charge me my stress levels went sky rocketing. And I‚Äôm someone who can pay for it, poverty is skyrocketing in America and people can‚Äôt afford 70$ a month. And having to pay for mindfulness is just cruel. It does the opposite of what this app wants it causes stress not takes it away. Other than that after you pay for everything all the stories put me to sleep and reduces stress so everything thing but having to pay is great!! I don‚Äôt mean to be a hater I am just looking out for people in poverty or can‚Äôt afford 70$ a year.
title: Locked

review: I have loved calm, because there are many different relaxing music tracks, soundscapes, and sleep stories that can help you fall asleep. (it helped my insomniac family a lot) You also learn how to meditate well which has helped me because I compete in Men‚Äôs gymnastics and have anxiety. This app is so cool because there are so many more things that I haven‚Äôt mentioned yet! The app is also an easy to access surefire answer to everything I‚Äôve said so far and more. I hope the app keeps up the hard work and stays awesome! If anyone is looking at this review, BUY IT!!! It‚Äôs going to change your life! üòÄ
title: How calm has helped me

review: Been using the app for over a year now.  Let me just say, it helps my 5 year old with naps and bedtime.  Our favorite sleep stories are Luna‚Äôs Lullaby, Ella‚Äôs Treasure by Tamara Levitt.  It works like a charm every time.  My only gripe is that, for some odd reason, the developers have not  bothered to updated the Apple TV version.  Unlike the iPhone and iPad version, there is no search option and a very limited amount of content available.  Honestly, it‚Äôs kind of annoying having to airplay sleep stories from my iPhone and iPad.  It‚Äôs for this very reason why I‚Äôm giving a four start rating.
title: Four Stars, please update Apple TV version!!

review:
I started using Calm as a Respiratory Therapist when COVID hit.
I didn‚Äôt know how to deal with what I was experiencing at work, fearing for my life or bringing it home to my family, and the politics that said it wasn‚Äôt happening.
I took Calm to the restroom at work because a break isn‚Äôt always possible when needed and listen for two or three minutes and learn to follow my breath, hear the waves on a shore, or rain falling and take my body sensations that were responding to my negative thoughts to a better place.
At home I started going to sleep with Calm.
Thank you to ALL who are behind the scenes and in front at Calm.
title: Making meditation easy

review: I installed this app with very little hope that anything would actually help with my anxiety, insomnia and depression but figured what the heck. The first night I used it, I tried one of the the sleep remixes and was very skeptical that it would actually help. About 3 minutes in, I was knocked out. Next day, I was very interested in what else this app has to offer!! Just after a few days of playing around with it and trying the different tools, I found myself in a much calmer state of mind and a more peaceful being. I am absolutely amazed at all the different categories and helpful content there is!!
title: AMAZED!

review: My husband loves to use the calm app for its daily calm videos and I love to listen to the sound scapes for sleep. Both of these things help us relax after a long exhausting day. There is one thing I wish this app had though and that is poetry. I‚Äôd love to hear a celebrity or anyone really read poetry. It‚Äôs calming to listen to the rhythm of the words while also focusing on the message or story being told. They do have something called the poetry pharmacy which I listen too when stressed but the poems aren‚Äôt very long so it isn‚Äôt something I can listen to when trying to relax before bed.
title: My husband and I both love this app

review:
Thank you for posting your experiences on Calm.

Just listened to Rising Above and that is a very important lesson.

Regardless of what time, chapter, segment or wherever you are in life there will always be those that say you should, could, do this.

Or you got people that don‚Äôt know you saying things about you, analyzing your life, criticizing even though there no Phil Jackson, Kevin Durant or even Anthony Davis has more right to critique than myself here for instance.

I‚Äôm writing thank you because you did not have to do that, you could have done anything else (additional endorsement contract, new clothing line, marketing campaigns, or whatever).

You are an inspiration and personally I do not watch basketball, but understanding you, MJ, The Black Mamba (may he RIP), Tim Grover and Phil Jackson.

I sincerely appreciate you posting part II and I look forward to hearing the rest of it.

Also thank you to Calm for posting that, keep doing whatever you are doing bringing amazing people to share their stories.

Eric A.
title: To King James, Thank You

review:
Normally I can‚Äôt sleep on an airplane, but one day the airline had a calm sleep story, about a train, I‚Äôm the seat-back entertainment. I listened to it and fell right to sleep. 
Now, I keep my tablet loaded with sleep stories and music here ever I travel, and I listen to  the meditations when I need a calm moment. 

I think what is missing is a way to create a playlist of the various media. I would like to start with a meditation, followed by a sleep story, and then a few hours of music without having to ‚Äúwake up‚Äù and interact with the app. That‚Äôs the only thing that keeps me from using it every night.
title: Very helpful on an airplane

review: From someone who is a broke teenager with mental illness ( anxiety depression) it‚Äôs hard to find accessible ways to help calm down. I was thinking this app would be helpful. It seemed to be until I saw how much I‚Äôd have to pay for it. It‚Äôs ridiculous that actually beneficial mental health resources like this are out of reach unless you have money for it. This just added more stress to find another app to use that would be even slightly cheaper and would help me as much. Especially when you‚Äôre in a crisis or going through high depression or anxiety, you need something to easily access. It‚Äôs not helpful at all to have to rlly search for something helpful and little to no cost when you‚Äôre stressed. It just causes more stress. Please consider trying to make your app more accessible for people who rlly can‚Äôt afford it.
title: Not as financially accessible

review:
I bought the premium subscription. While I enjoy what it offers, I‚Äôm not sure it‚Äôs worth the money. I use it primarily for falling asleep. I like the sleep stories but they aren‚Äôt long enough. It‚Äôs counterintuitive to have a sleep story that‚Äôs so short you have to open the app again to continue playing stories. I would like something that‚Äôs long enough to still be playing even if I wake up an hour or more later or at least it appears on the Lock Screen to repeat. For people with true asleep disorders, the app currently defeats the purpose. 
Also, ads slow soothing visuals but these are not actually on the app. Not sure why they‚Äôre on the ad if not available on the app.
title: Worth the money?

review: My 15 year old son & I used the free features to meditate & calm down for years. He loves this app. My husband uses it to help him fall asleep. My 3 year old will utilize the kid meditations & sleep stories. She loves that the stories have characters she knows. I utilize this app everyday to meditate. I loved this app so much I bought a subscription a couple of years ago. I have regularly used the app, since, and have recently purchased the lifetime subscription. I appreciate it for it's wide selection of free options and the apps ability to utilize multiple senses to support mindfulness practice. It is worth it! ü•∞
title: Very well made & liked

review: I‚Äôm entering my third year subscribing to the Calm App. I‚Äôm such a huge advocate for the value it provides because it literally changed my life. I was going down a slippery slope of anxiety and depression because I was suffering from a debilitating illness that was slowly killing me.  This app provided me with the instructional tools and daily techniques to take back control of my life, through mindful awareness and intentional action. I was able to manage my illness more effectively which gave me the courage to keep fighting and ultimately find the cure. I look forward to hearing the voices of Tamara and Jeff each day to guide me through my meditations. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Amazing!

review: This app has helped me so much. I‚Äôm an anxiety ridden sleeper, but since I‚Äôve been using the Calm app my ability to fall back asleep in the middle of the night has improved greatly. I‚Äôm also seeing some of the patterns and paths my anxiety takes and am better able to catch them earlier and disarm them. Thank you for the stories of trains. I feel like I know more places now for having ridden the Calm trains over and over. And thank you for Jeff Warren‚Äôs meditation help. He‚Äôs the reasonable, funny, and clear voice I need in my head to calm my anxiety and connect me to the things I know but forgot to remember.‚ô•Ô∏è
title: Breath of fresh air

review:
I have been using Calm for 2 years now. My 5 year old listens to a sleep story before bed, I usually use a soundscape, and my most beneficial meditations have all been guided by Calm. Keep up the great work!!

My wish list:  I wish it would ask you monthly what your goals are, so it could curate what it shows you based on that instead of just what you have used in the past. Sometimes the search is hard because I don‚Äôt know exactly what I am looking for, I just know what I am feeling now - if you search your current feeling something useful usually comes up. Other than that, Calm has been very helpful.
title: Wonderful, Organization needs work

review: Y‚Äôall did an amazing job with this app, there‚Äôs so many things to do and personalized options for you to release stress and anxiety. This app is perfect for me because I‚Äôve struggled with depression and severe anxiety in the past. My favorite feature of this app is the daily check ins where you can type about how your feeling using a select few emojis with a word describing how you‚Äôre feeling, but I feel like there could be a few more options that include a wider range of emotions and emojis, or even a custom emoji you can use with a custom word to perfectly describe how you‚Äôre feeling. Other than that, this app is top notch. Thanks guys
title: Amazing, but one change maybe

review:
A number of years ago I reached out to Calm and they said that, while their teacher program was in the works, they would set me up with a free account because they appreciated my work with my students. I feel disappointed that when teachers need support the most (for their students and themselves) Calm no longer fully supports us. Many teacher are highly stressed and leaving the field of education. On a educator‚Äôs budget, even the discounted subscription is too high. This would be the perfect time to offer educators a subscription, but instead it is just lip service. Educators, go to Headspace! They care about your well-being!

In general, I think that $70 is too high of a price for mental well-being. Not everyone has that much money to pay for an app service for a year.
title: Does not care about the users themselves

review: It has all this different stuff to help you in your daily life like sleep, meditation, and more! I really recommend it for anyone who has trouble sleeping and frustration. I was one that had trouble sleeping and the night I got it it worked fine I fell asleep really quickly. So I really say it‚Äôs amazing!! Also they have other options than just sleep stories and soundscapes. They have daily check-ins and meditation. I have never done the meditation part but have done the check-ins. The check-ins help you find the deep part of you that sometimes is hard to find. But I TOTALLY recommend Calm.
title: REALLY GOOD!!!

review: I suffered from OCD Intrusive Thoughts and I had so much Anxiety and Scared because I thought I was a Monster for having theses evil Thoughts and When I opened this app for the first time I felt So calm and relaxed and happy afterwards And I could finally live my life comfortable and Happy. Every Time I see the news and see the terrible things that are happening around the world it makes me so Sad and I start feeling so depressed but I avoid watching anymore News because It‚Äôs not beneficial for me At all. If I ever feel Scared or obnoxious or Depressed I quickly open this app and it‚Äôs all gone afterwards 10/10!!! Amazing App
title: It‚Äôs App is Beautiful

review: Calm is a great app all in all; although I see a few flaws, the benefits outweigh the negatives. I really appreciate having something to help me collect myself when I don't exactly have a place to escape. Its like your calm place on the go and even is useful at home. I think there could be some improvements though.. For example, it really bothers me when you can barely use the app without a subscription I feel like it would be better if there were more basic functions available to non-subscribers, they could add additional benefits other than base content to make the app more useful and attractive. Thank you for reading.
title: Very Handy and Efective

review: Low key so glad I got this app! Initially I got it because I had trouble sleeping and wanted to try their sleep stories. little did I know that I will find a whole new world in mindfulness meditation. I‚Äôve been meditating for 4 months now and find such joy, peace and even learning how seek gratitude. I LOOOVEEEE the Camilla Cabello collaboration; another sign this app was just something that I needed to incorporate in my self-development journey. The only thing I‚Äôm a little bummed about is the Calm Body- they only have like 8 options (lower back, morning stretch, etc). Other than that, I‚Äôm happy with this app/investment!
title: Great self-help/personal investment

review:
I used to use this app every night when I was younger, it helped me sleep and it was a blessing and mostly free. Now that I‚Äôm going into my senior year of high school and have begun having trouble falling asleep without stimuli, I decided I would revisit this app and see how it does since I want to stop using my laptop for background noise. 
Needless to say I am surprised and disappointed by the changes made. Nearly EVERYTHING is behind a paywall. I only managed to spot three free sounds, one of them being the default. Based on my past experience with this app I would say that the price of the yearly subscription is POSSIBLY worth it, but for the people who either can‚Äôt afford that kind of money for an app subscription or just straight up aren‚Äôt willing to, this is a big ‚Äúoh well‚Äù.
title: Oh well

review: Calm is a great app! It has a variety of sounds to choose from that will make it an app you will use daily. Sleep stories are my favorite way to fall asleep, they are very soothing. If stories are too captivating they also have sleep meditations, I like to use these when my mind is racing after work. Calm also provides a wide variety of background music and sounds. There are many different genres. I use their music for yoga, writing time in my classroom, and work time for myself. There is something for everyone on Calm. You will find yourself using it everyday!
title: Love the sleep stories!

review: Calm is my daily practice. I am a mother of two small children under age 5 and I have a fianc√©e of 6 years. Our home is a high volume, non stop imagination zone with 4 strong personalities always in the mix. I wake up at 4 am every morning to do my Daily Calm. Taking 10 minutes a day, when there is actual silence in my home,  to connect with myself and Source is gratifying and a constant peace I can return to throughout my busy day. I am so thankful for this app! The mindfulness check ins throughout the day, this is a carefully curated collection that is shifting the worlds vibration. Thank you for elevating me daily!
title: Vibration Shift

review: Ever since I started using Calm I have enjoyed my sleep time so much more. I also have found more ways to relax,focus,center myself. When I started using Calm. It was free. Then they added additional which cost or only came by buying their plan, but my favorites were still there & free. Not I discover to continue using this service. I have to pay. I guess I won‚Äôt be using calm much if at all. I don‚Äôt agree with this as the benefit of the service to all of us is important. I lost my job & was forced to retirement. I‚Äôm 74 yrs & live in a strict limited income. I‚Äôm sorry to lose you.
title: Allowing the body to relax

review:
Last Night I used Calm app‚Äôs ‚Äústory‚Äù feature for falling to sleep. First of all, I was easily relaxed by the voice of the reader. It was soothing without sounding ridiculously forced as are those of the many other apps I have tried. 
    I wasn‚Äôt sure I‚Äôd find a story relaxing, because in my other attempts, I have tried meditations which have sounded like hypnosis sessions, and nature sounds that awakened my alarm sensors over worrisome storms.
     For me, my first try was well worth the  apps cost. Since I found Calm useful, I may keep the app. $60 a year feels outrageous. However, it is, after all, pennies a day ....zzzz
title: Eazzzzzy

review:
This is great. We use sleep stories nearly every night, your narrators are excellent.
I‚Äôd love to use the sleep tracking more, but would you please add a way to track the amount of time NOT sleeping. 
The app lets me track sleep and wake times, and does have a button for interrupted sleep. But I was awake for 3 hours last night, (not unusual), so the amount of sleep registered was way off. If it also had why I woke and what I did while awake it would also be great. But even just a way to record nights of interrupted/uninterrupted and accurate total sleep would be great.
title: Great app. Just one thing.

review:
I am forever grateful for finding this app. It provides a simple guidance and instruction when learning to meditate and there are a number of guided sessions on various topics related to mindfulness.

Where could it improve: the Check ins.  While they are listed under your profile only two of them can be completed there while the others you have to hunt around the app to be able to complete. It would be more efficient to just go through them right from your profile.  

Besides the slight disorganization, this is a great app for your peace of mind.
title: So Good, with Room to Improve

review:
I‚Äôve been using Calm for multiple years now. It has helped me during difficult moments and has made life that much better when times are good. I love the breath work, meditations, wisdom, sleep stories, movement, and ‚Äòfor work‚Äô content. As a bilingual user I like that I can use the Spanish content as well and the quality and variety is just as good as the English content.

Before Calm I tried other apps like Headspace and Insight Timer and they just don‚Äôt compare. Calm is the #1 app for mindfulness in the world for a reason!! I highly recommend it to all my friends and family.
title: My favorite app

review: This makes it so much easier to fall asleep. Now sense I‚Äôve had it for a while I have gotten spoiled and I CANNOT sleep without it. If you have insomnia I will TOTALLY suggest that you get it. I also like to listen to the music. Another great thing about this app is there is so much variety. It would take YEARS to listen to it all. I am not as happy with the meditations but I think that is less of the app‚Äôs fault and and more that it is just not my thing. I seriously hope you consider getting this app as it has improved my life so much. I really don‚Äôt know what I would do without it. THANK YOU CALM!!!!üòÅüòÅüòäüòÄ
title: I love Calm!

review:
I can't say enough how much I love this app.  It has trained me in how to settle and focus myself, while also making a habit of it.  It is my little space of peace in very hectic days.  Not sure how Tamara knows just what I need to hear in the daily meditations, but it almost always hits me in just the right way.  I have tried other mediation and gratitude programs and apps, but this one has everything and the best teachers.  There are even parts perfected just for children and my little ones love listening and practicing with me.  

Worth every penny!!
title: Finally able to put meditation into my daily life!

review: This app used to be fantastic when Tamara started by herself. It was more focused on the nature of meditation, development and not about celebrities like now. It feels like as if this was the goal for her to reach this status instead of true meditation. Monks and Buddhists don‚Äôt need all the fuzz around it and Calm was in the beginning fantastic and not too overwhelming with too much fuzz around it. I left Calm for better alternatives true to the core and wish Tamara good luck, it is sad this app turned into a hype for her celebrity status and perhaps the desire to become one herself, instead of the person she was, humble, motivated, just herself the way I liked her most. Thank you for the great time I had on this app but time to move on.
title: Disappointed

review: This app has provided a pleasant and meaningful experience for me over the past 3 years. It has provided coaching and guided insight as I have strengthened my daily meditations and have sought to bring meaningful mindfulness into my life. I have found ‚Äúwhat works for me‚Äù out of the large variety of content, customizable background sounds/music/volume and coaches. The cost has risen to support the expansion of new content, most of which I have not found appealing, but it‚Äôs there for those who do. I would like to hear an expanded selection of looped sound tracks for deep meditation, such as singing bowls.  Thank you for a wonderful, meaningful offering.
title: Mindful journey

review: I purchased the Calm app on the recommendation of my Grandmother. She listens to different stories every night to calm her mind so she can fall asleep. I‚Äôve tried many other ways to relax so I can fall asleep at night (even medication). Nothing works as well as the stories on this app. I am finally to the point where I actually fall asleep before the 30 minute stories end. I have never, even when I was a child, been able to fall asleep that quickly, stay asleep, and wake up in the morning feeling rested. I absolutely cannot praise and recommend the Calm app enough!
title: Falling asleep

review:
I paid for the full membership, but it didn‚Äôt work.  I couldn‚Äôt access anything and clicking on ‚Äúrestore purchase,‚Äù it told me to create an account and supply them with my email address.  I hate sharing my email address.  Do you want my money or not?  

Well, I supplied them with my email address thinking I had to in order to make my PAID app work. Then the app told me to login with the Apple ID with which I bought the membership.  Umm‚Ä¶ I only have one Apple ID.  The one I am using.  No matter what I did, I couldn‚Äôt get it to give me the access I paid for.

Aaaannnnd they immediately started spamming me.  I clicked on unsubscribe immediately without reading their idiotic sales pitch that I never wanted in the first place. I hate that crap.  

But they kept spamming me anyway. Clicked on unsubscribe again.  And I still couldn‚Äôt make my paid account work. For two days and some more unwanted spam later, I finally went to Apple and asked for a refund.  I got it. Thank goodness. 

The spam was immediate and really off-putting.  I am not putting up with that.  Put them on my junk sender list and deleted the app entirely.  I hate that they have my email address now, though. Super sketchy.
title: Shady, Sketchy, and Spammy

review: I have never been one to buy into things like meditation as I just didn‚Äôt know anyone using it and therefore, didn‚Äôt think it would have much of an affect. After 32 consecutive days of meditating, I am literally shocked at the difference in clarity and focus I‚Äôm experiencing. I am getting much more accomplished every day and I‚Äôm able to relax more and feel less overwhelmed by life as I‚Äôm living it much more in the moment. I‚Äôve been searching for solutions to ‚Äúlife‚Äôs puzzle‚Äù as far back as I can remember and I think I may have finally found the answer. This is exciting!
title: Excellent Results!

developerResponse: {'id': 32907111, 'body': 'Hi there! We offer a free version of the app in addition to the free trial and paid subscription. Reach out to support@calm.com for assistance accessing the free content.', 'modified': '2022-11-01T12:15:35Z'}
review: This app has great potential, but sadly I can‚Äôt enjoy the full version for 7 days without agreeing to pay for it ahead of time.  So my rating is based off what calm allows me to use.. im not impressed, and the asking price is way to high to even consider putting a credit card up for a app that I did not fully test.. maybe the app can give 3 days free without putting up any financial commitments before asking for that kind of money. But I will be deleting it off my phone today, and move on to something I can actually test and try out without putting up a credit card number.. thanks calm, and no it doesn‚Äôt matter that I can cancelled in 7 days if I ordered it.  Im busy and I don‚Äôt have any room to remember a subscription from calm.
title: Disappointed!

review: I downloaded this on the recommendation of a coworker but never thought I would really use it. With COVID-19 taking over the world and all the stress that has come with it I have had a hard time sleeping and my brain just doesn‚Äôt stop. I started by listening to the Disney piano playlist and it help me fall asleep at night. I then just started to explore the app and all the great things it had that have helped me breath relax and shut my mind off not just at night but during the day just taking a break to recenter has be a nice way to bring some positivity and light in.
title: A little slice of peace

review: I have listened to this app since I think 2015. I have almost consistently ever since I think my current streak is like 520+ days. I find that listening to the daily calm can be highly beneficial whether I meditate to it in the morning or the evening before bed. I have found myself resulting in calmness, for lack of a better term, ultimately remaining at peace through all the annoyances throughout my generally mundane day! I hope that this analysis contributes to the download of this app. I may be a particular case (as I'm sure I am), but I feel the benefits far outweigh the negatives.
title: I have found this app to be perfect!!!!!!!

review: I was rewarded this app because I‚Äôm a k4 teacher and I like to incorporate mindfulness and meditation into out daily schedule. Initially it was a bit pricey so, I kept waiting and eventually they began their school program, which waived the membership fee for teachers!  This has been an amazing addition to our room. The meditations, soundscapes, and sleep stories are some of my students favorite part of the day. It definitely sets the tone and helps aid an open and inviting atmosphere. It‚Äôs an extra treat that after a long days work with 4 and 5 yr olds, I can use the same app to calm down and energy me time at home!
title: Most Used app on my phone!!

review: There needs to be a LIVE customer support system.... I know Tamara is busy rolling in the dough but she needs to offer an actual support system when the app has issues. The automated system is useless. The app Is pretty freakin awesome.... just been having issues with scene volume which is one of the best features that sets this app apart from other guided meditation apps. When I contact ‚Äúcustomer support‚Äù it‚Äôs an endless loop of pre written ‚Äúgeneric‚Äù answers to an otherwise very specific problem. Sometimes these answers seem to cater to older people that may not be familiar with the basic operations of a smart phone. A little pandering. Other than that it is a superb app.
title: Need an option to submit...

review: I‚Äôve dealt with general anxiety for many years, have taken courses on meditation in the past, but never stuck with it.  This app has really helped me stick to a daily meditation and the ‚Äúdaily calm‚Äù is what I tend to favor.  I never thought I would listen to sleep stories as an adult, but they are great, and help me fall asleep very quickly.  The only thing I would like to see added, but it‚Äôs certainly not a deal breaker, would be the ability for us to choose a longer length for the daily calm for days when I‚Äôm in the mood to do a 15-20 minute meditation.
title: Very helpful for my anxiety

review:
I truly enjoy this app and it has helped me be more mindful in my day to day. I tend to be an over thinker and have codependent tendencies and am using this app to help calm my mind. I have only been using it for about a month and I can already tell that my reactions to things have switched into responses with a much more clear head space. 

My one piece if feedback would be that the developers add a feature that when using the app your phone automatically goes into ‚Äúdo not disturb‚Äù mode so that texts and phone calls do not distrust your mediation practice.
title: The app I never knew I needed!

review:
Initially I really liked this app. But then I think it‚Äôs because Jeff Warren was such a great teacher. He gave us choices in terms of how we wanted to get into our meditative state. Focus could be on your breath or the refrigerator running or birds chirping.
It was your choice. Then there are other meditative leaders who only give one choice, the breath.  For me focusing on my breath doesn‚Äôt work. After a couple of deep inhales and then slow exhales, my breathing rhythm is now off. I can‚Äôt get it back and end up spending the next 10 minutes on adjusting my breathing. Give me a choice and leave my breathing alone. So unless I can find a leader who foregoes using breath as a homebase I can‚Äôt use this app. And thus do not recommend it.
title: Breath

review:
It‚Äôs been a banner year of stress and worry. I developed anxiety and panic symptoms. At 60 years I‚Äôve never tried mindfulness or meditation but with all that‚Äôs happened ‚Äîquitting a job that I loved, starting over in my own practice dealing with fears of COVID, for our country for my daughter‚Äôs future it‚Äôs no wonder anxiety and panic were the result. My daughter added the Calm app to my mobile. 
I loved 7 Days to happiness series, the panic SOS exercise, and the Grateful ( Gratitude) series.
There‚Äôs always something here for what I‚Äôm thinking and feeling.

The Loving Kindness exercise. I‚Äôve been alone for most of the pandemic. But grateful for this app.
title: I Can Breathe

review:
I have been a CALM app user off and on for a long time. I used it to meditate with a friend going through Cancer treatments and we‚Äôd sit together and do the Daily Meditations. I use it for times when I can‚Äôt sleep to listen to either the Nature Sound Scapes or Sleep Stories. I fall asleep in no time! And if I awaken in the night, I‚Äôll find another Sleep Story to get back to sleep. The music works too! I have been guilty of leaving it on all night! 

If you are a beginner meditation practitioner or just want to explore the things CALM has to offer, I would do the trial. You won‚Äôt regret it! 

Thanks CALM!
title: Love this app!

review: I love all the various ways this app helps you relax and ease anxiety. But they really need to remove the competitive aspect or at lease use fluffy language to hide it. I don‚Äôt want to feel stressed out about not meeting my goals in meditation and mindfulness. When I see options listed that are labeled as ‚Äúcourse‚Äù or ‚Äúmasterclass‚Äù I am immediately stressed about excelling in mindfulness. There must be better language to categorize your playlists. Please üôÇ. Otherwise the app is great! I use it for kids bedtime stories as well (after I read 5 books and they are asking for more).
title: Great app for family

review: Okay, I usually do not leave reviews‚Ä¶. However i felt this deserved a review. The children stories are cute‚Ä¶ however, after listening to a few of them with my 18month old and 3 year old I noticed they like to slip in ‚ÄúWoke‚Äù ideologies‚Ä¶ one story has the main character using They/Them pronouns, one story has Gay badgers‚Ä¶ each story seems to have something slipped in‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm all for the LGBTQ+ community however I believe children should not have to have gender confusion thrown their way. I won‚Äôt be letting my kids listen to these stories anymore because they should be focusing on kid stuff, not gender and other things. Im happy to go back to reading the old fairy tales to my kids myself.
title: 2 1/2 not 3 Children stories?

review:
I really do love what the Calm app does. I have no problem with that. BUT in a recent redesign of the interface, Favorites are shown too far down the screen. I use the app primarily for Sleep Stories. I know several which work like a sleeping pill for me. But I now have to search too long to get one started. 

I assume this has been done to encourage me to preview others? Thanks, but I do that periodically on my own. When I‚Äôm in the mood to taste test. But most of the time I just want to get relaxed and get to sleep, haha. 

Please move Favorites higher on the screen or allow us to drag and drop in the order we prefer.
title: Promote Favorites to top of screen

review:
I grew up with a ton of anxiety and calm helps me a lot whenever I‚Äôm anxious. The voices of the narrators are super relaxing and the scenes and soundscapes too. This app deserves all five stars or even more!
 
  I feel like with all the new daily things calm is easier to use. I listen to sleep stories every night to calm down my nerves. Calm has helped me in various ways and I‚Äôm grateful for the cool activities they have to make you forget about anxious thoughts.

  Overall, calm is an amazing app and a miracle worker. I highly recommend this app to anyone who deals with anxiety or other issues. ‚ò∫Ô∏èüå∫
title: Five stars for a reason

review: I have had the calm app for a few years. Lately the quality of the new sleep stories has been terrific. I recommend trying the app. I love the new Red Rock Country story. I find the sleep stories have regulated my sleep after years of so-so sleeping. I am working on my meditation and so far the calm app has helped although I am struggling to find a meditation program that I can use long term. As a beginner in this area what Calm offers is helpful to build a consistent practice. Overall I am pleased with the content and I hope Calm continues to provide even better content.
title: Few Years

review: When I first purchased this app I was absolutely in love. I enjoy Jeff Warren‚Äôs 30 days of How to Meditate so much that I finished the meditation in consecutive 30 days and was always looking forward to the next day to meditate with him. I was so clam and happy. But after I completed the session, everything changed. For some reason I can‚Äôt bring myself to like the voice and talking style of Tamara Levitt. I tried very hard each day to like it but failed. Unfortunately she is the main narrator of most of the courses so there is almost nothing left for me to enjoy. I would really appreciate if you can include more narrators or allow the user to choose narrators like the course 7 Days of Calm.
title: More Narrators Please

review: Hey üëã, I just wanted to let everyone in the group of creating this site is so Awesome üëè and because my Uncle hasn‚Äôt kept up on my phone bill enough to let me get to hear my best,Amazing Bedtimes stories on time I am seriously having a hard time getting comfortable and falling asleep üí§ at ease, and sleep well üò¥ enough so I‚Äôm gonna get on his case and start explaining how Awesome ü§© I find you guys with such Sweetness and Success to help me and my roommate fall asleep üò¥ peacefully when we hear from your stories!! And I grade you all the A+ team you‚Äôre the Best team ever and Good night üòòüí§üåôüò¥!!
title: My opinion and more

review:
I just could not get to sleep, I tossed and turned for 2 or more hours at a time and was at my wits end, I didn‚Äôt know what to do. I was taking medication to help me sleep and I didn‚Äôt feel that was a good idea for long time help. 
I saw an ad for Calm and I thought it couldn‚Äôt hurt to try it. 
Calm taught me how to breath and relax so I could fall asleep quicker without tossing and turning. I listen every night and look forward to new sessions and have favorite go to stories too.
I would recommend anyone who is having trouble getting to sleep give this a try, it worked wonders for me!

This app used to be amazing until barely anything was free. Personally I struggle with sleep and calm always helped me go back to sleep but that was when I was using my mom‚Äôs premium account. Now I have my own account and I‚Äôm not paying $70 to go to sleep when I could just use headspace! The only reason why I gave this app 3 stars is because of Alan Sklar if you are looking for a good app and don‚Äôt mind paying $70 this app is for you they do have people with very calming voices and it‚Äôs very relaxing. But again personally IN MY OPINION it is not worth a $70 fee. Thank you for reading if you got to this point!
By the way I will put my review back up to 5 stars if you lower the price for premium.
title: Great except for

review: Calm offers myriad avenues to access groundedness these days. I came back to check out out for a graduate class I am taking, and was surprised to see the bedtime stories and poetry added, which is lovely. As a yoga instructor and high school teacher I saw many applications of this app, plus I have a young child and could see the benefits of the stories for children. I completely understand the price for the premium subscription for the app, however at this time it is not something I am willing to add to my budget. There are some beautiful free meditations I hope to use with my high school students to help with their stress!

review:
Honestly, I am surprised at the exorbitant cost I am paying for this app considering the few times I use it a month. That being said, those few times a month it is totally worth it and definitely puts me to bed. I‚Äôm in a sales role, high stress, corporate job and this app helps me wind down and go to bed. 

Why I hate Tamara Levitt- She has to be one of the most narcissistic persons on the planet. I hate her VOICE, I hate how much she loves her own voice, she sounds scripted, I hate how breathy she is, I hate that she doesn‚Äôt leverage other people for meditations. Here‚Äôs an idea Tamara, not everyone wants to hear you! For the love of God, get over yourself and find other people/ other voices so I can get some better rest and pay $100 to get some rest.
title: Love it but Tamara Levitt has GOT TO GO

review: I‚Äôm not just saying it‚Äôs amazing because I‚Äôm being paid to say this, I am a 14-year-old boy who desperately cannot sleep or calm down. Sometimes they have meditations and sleep stories for kids adults and all ages. It‚Äôs an amazing app. I really do recommend this try it out and if you don‚Äôt like it, then you don‚Äôt have to use it, but it is one of my favorite apps to listen to stories or meditate or even if you have ADHD and need something to help you calm down while working it has everything you need, hope you read this and hope you enjoy it. All joy
title: Amazing

review:
Ca has a lot of wonderful tools for mindfulness, grounding, centering.

I, however, subscribed to the premium for help with sleep.  I grew up with my sister reading us to sleep and was thrilled there was an app with stories.  That said, there are no sleep timers embedded in the stories, so they run to the end and nothing.  Further to that, the app doesn‚Äôt play the next track/story!  So if you‚Äôre still awake, or wake up and can‚Äôt get back to sleep, you have to search through kingdom come to get back to stories and pick one you haven‚Äôt heard 6 times already (and they always suggest the same one).  I‚Äôm more awake than ever.  

Please embed sleep timers and consecutive tracks!!!
title: If You Use This App For Sleep

review:
Tamara Levitt is a great guider. she is peaceful and calm and gives you time to breathe on your own and meditate on your own and relax on your own and then towards the end she always has just a wonderful little short little lesson sharing true wisdom and peace.

Recently tried Insight Timer after doing Calm and at first I thought I loved it because it had so many options and so many courses but then I haven‚Äôt found an instructor yet that actually gives you time to just be quiet they‚Äôre talking and talking and talking and talking so I‚Äôm back to Tamara and Calm and I‚Äôm calm. :)
title: Truly wonderful

review: My husband suffered a stroke and my whole life crumbled After a short time, I was under tremendous stress And everyone abandoned with the exception of my aunt. When I was at my darkness Matthew McConaugheys voice kept me alive. The more I learned about the app the more I was able to get though yet another day. I now feel this app is just as important as water for me and my kids. Thank you from the bottom of my heart. Truly greatful for the app,Matthew and Tamara for who‚Äôs voice is always in my head telling me never to quit. I‚Äôm alive today because of your help and support.
title: Kept me alive literally

I turn it on and fall to sleep within minutes. The app is also great because it turns off if you have an alarm going, so you can still hear your alarm to wake up in the morning.  I love it!!! I recommend this app to anyone who has trouble shutting off their mind at night.

review: I was hestitant to download this and a friend kept nagging me. I don‚Äôt like audio usually, I really enjoy my silence, my job is on the phone all day. I also use the nature sounds sometimes and if I‚Äôm having a tough day working from home the nap sleep stories help me maximize my rest on lunch and are the perfect length to do so. I like that it has the option to track moods but I have a separate app for that with more thorough data.
title: Wow

review: I like calm for the mood check in, some sleep stories and the rain sounds, but mostly everything requires premium and i don‚Äôt like that because I dont have premium and its $70 for it, and i just started using this app again. title: New and skeptical‚Ä¶

review: My kiddo has always had a hard time sleeping. We‚Äôve kept a steady routine: bath book, bed. We have tried so many things. Moshi, a night light with sound machine, air purifier, singing, back rubs. I had given up. I downloaded the Calm app because I wanted to start meditating to deal with the crushing stress of being a working parent during a pandemic. I stumbled on the kids stories by accident. My kiddo was asleep within 12 minutes!! I was astonished!! I am so grateful for this app. Thank you from the bottom of my heart for giving an exhausted parent the gift of sleep!
title: Magic for Kids Bedtime Routine

review: This app has every potential to help people and their mental health. It‚Äôs obvious however that it has just been designed by another entrepreneur with the intention of getting rich. I find it shocking that the FIRST thing it tries to get you to do once you‚Äôve finished a meditation is to share a quote to social media. This is encouraging the exact kind of behaviour that meditation is trying to relieve you from. It also does so under the heading ‚Äúthink about how it feels to check in with yourself‚Äù. I find it incredibly exploitative that after meditation, you are directed to ‚Äúcheck in with yourself‚Äù by sharing a quote to social media. Clearly the app‚Äôs primary intention is to grow wealth for the owner. This should be the very last option someone sees, with mood diary, helpful links, etc coming first.
title: Exploitative

review: I have been using this app for more than five years. It has been my sanctuary when I need to meditate or when I have racing thoughts to fall sleep. The sleep stories are very diverse and super effective. I have rarely finished one because I always fall sleep:)). The meditation material is matched with advanced spiritual teachings. The narrators are very nice and share vulnerability and human nature. It is a very down to earth attitude with rich material. I truly hope that they continue their great work. I have recommended this to all my friends and keep doing that.
title: Very deep and advanced level materials

review: I saw the app has added new children sleepy time stories. I clicked to scour through what sort of story for children this app was playing. The entire story is about a fish who always felt different and met an aunt. An aunt who liked to wear pants and was different than all the other fish and the one no one wanted to talk to or about. How her parents never understood her and her friends. How meeting her Aunt Bubb allowed her mind to open into world of imagination she could take wherever she went. And only she and her friends knew about it though her parents never quite understood them. How free she felt being able to be understood by this group of friends. And how forever grateful she was for her aunt Bubb. I listened at how this story emphasized parents never really understanding her or her new friendships.
title: NOT FOR CHILDREN - GROOMING STORIES!!!

review: I‚Äôve always had trouble falling asleep, and I always need some type of noise in the background. But I could never find a great app to help me. Calm is the app for EVERYONE, it not only has sleep stories read to you by your celebrities but it also has many different meditations that can help you with anxiety, depression, stress etc. Plus their graceful and artistic melodies and soundscapes to transport you to a whole other universe. If you need help when it comes to sleeping or relaxing then GET THIS APP!!! üíöüí§üî≠
title: ‚ÄúHas changed my life, and maybe yours too if you get this app right now!‚Äù

review: People who truly have a hard time sleeping need a story to repeat. This is not an option even when paying for this app. I have to restart the story over and over when I‚Äôm having a rough night. The app is not user friendly. I have to search and search for things that might be a good story and I mostly find short half hour stories. I need longer ones and I have to search for them. I am giving it 3 starts because I have found a story I love to listen to and there is a ton to try. We all have our own taste of calming stories but once I found it I wish the app made it easier to find and allowed it to repeat.
title: Not user friendly and no repeat

review: I‚Äôve used other meditation apps in the past‚Äîbut decided to give this a try. The selection that they have for free isnt a true depiction of the app so I decided to pay for the subscription. This will be my first and last year using the app. The moderators are too chatty. You can select a 25 min meditation for deep concentration and they are talking for the bulk of the meditation. How can one concentrate if the moderator keeps breaking concentration by talking. This is probably a bit odd but if you‚Äôve used other apps you‚Äôll understand‚Äîthe voices on this app arent soothing but rather abrasive in my opinion. I think the glitz and glam of this app is the fact that they have celebs on the app like Lebron‚Äîbut you can get what you need from an app that doesn‚Äôt require a subscription or one that doesnt have a hefty price tag.
title: Too chatty

review: I like the sleep stories and use the app primarily to help fall asleep.   They do have a couple 1.5 hr ‚Äúanthology‚Äù stories, but I‚Äôd like to be able to pick 2-4 stories, put them in a cue, and play those three or four till I fall asleep.   Or put one on an infinity repeat etc‚Ä¶.  The way it is set up now, if I‚Äôm still awake at the end of a story I need to turn my phone back on, scroll through to find the next one I want to hear and start again, which really starts over the falling asleep process.  It would be great if I could select four, and have it play all those before turning off.
title: Good sleep stories, but I wish you had the option of cueing multiple stories.

review:
I first tried this app back in 2017 and I remember there being multiple different options for non premium members. Now there‚Äôs almost nothing. Not even an beginners option to see if it‚Äôs a good fit for them. I was hoping to use calm again to help with immense stress and struggles I‚Äôm facing, but alas I will have to find something different until I can afford an extra expense for this. 
 I hope some mental health providers see this: please keep in mind the socioeconomic background of those you recommend this app too. Premium is expensive and there‚Äôs not much point in having the app if you don‚Äôt have premium.
title: Don‚Äôt try this unless you have money to buy premium.

review: I‚Äôve been using this app for 4+ years now and it has become an integral part of my life. My mental health has improved since and meditating routinely became possible because of this app. I love the way it is setup for all background levels and has many other useful lifestyle improvement based aspects like better sleep, focus and movement. I would recommend this app to anyone who is looking to work on those things or even just trying to explore the fields of mindfulness and positive psychology and/or appreciate a well made app.
title: Keeps me going.

review: This app we mainly use for the sleep stories though I have used the meditations many times and love them. My two children and I all fall asleep to a sleep story each night. We love that new stories are added periodically. I do wish Keith Morrison would do more! He‚Äôs our favorite and he‚Äôs only got one story. We have to switch it up and listen to different stories or else they don‚Äôt put us to sleep so we often rotate through our favorites. We love his voice and the story! Please make more for him to narrate!! Thank you for an amazing and helpful app!
title: Love it

review: I love calm! first of all I love it because it helps me go to sleep at night. Second of all I love it because it helps me calm down when I get upset I guess that‚Äôs why it‚Äôs called Calm. Third of all I love that‚Äôs free because I really needed it. Fourth of all thank you because if this wasn‚Äôt free I would go to bed at 9 o‚Äôclock every night. And I‚Äôd probably sleep in school. So thanks again. I hope you love my message. And also I have a question for you with a meditation daily do you have to set a time because I might not be able to do it at the same time every day. Bye!
title: Thanks

review:
One feature that I would really like is if there was a way to have white noise play after completing a sleeping meditation. My body is very relaxed but once it goes silent I get back into my thoughts again and have to get back on my phone to play white noise. I don‚Äôt think this would be hard to incorporate but it would be very beneficial to many others like myself. 

Besides that I love this app and use it every night. The developers constantly come up with new updates with new features. Would recommend to anyone.
title: Improvement idea

review:
Every person in my family has ADHD with sensory processing issues. I really wanted to like this app, but trying to use it to help my kids meditate simply does not work. The sounds that play in the background of every meditation - with our sensory issues - actually inspire extreme sensory overload. It actually does the opposite of what the title suggests. My kids are MORE agitated after trying to do one of the kids‚Äô meditations. They actually prefer to do the meditations from another app that is only for adults that is blissfully silent in the background, allowing the words and calm to actually sink in. 

The brown noise is perfect, otherwise it would be a 1/5 star for me and my family. I wish this app was more inclusive.
title: Not inclusive for Neurodivergent Family

review:
I love most of the stories! The narrator's
have very SOOTHING AND MYSTICAL
VOICES!!  Some of the stories also have very soothing mystical background ‚Ä¶.(some musical and some sounds of nature) I would love for the volume to be elevated because they add to the soothing effects of the stories!! I also wish you could add more hour long stories when I am having a real hard time falling asleep! üí§ 
A reviewer complained about famous celebrities narrating the stories which really didn‚Äôt bother me though I prefer lesser known ones to narrate!! I was Exceptionally impressed that pop singer Shawn Mendes  could narrate a sleep story with such VERVE AND EMOTION
Matt  McConaghy did a decent read and Morgan Freeman is the KING üëë of spoken word!!
Overall I am  IMPRESSED with Calm and would HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!
title: Calming!

review:
This is a life saving app!  It was recommended to me a year ago.  At the time, I had been diagnosed with depression.  Like so many, the trauma of the time was weighing heavily on me.

Calm helped me to begin a new journey.  It touched me with great music.  I learned how to meditate from those who faced the same problems and found a way.  I‚Äôm enjoying guided and unguided meditation.  I feel healthier and I‚Äôm healing.  There‚Äôs a lifetime of meditation ahead.

Thank you to all who made this happen and walk with us.  I‚Äôm grateful.  Try it.  There‚Äôs nothing to lose and a life of equanimity, acceptance and peace to be found.
title: Life saving app

Calm is bringing me back to life, a wonderful, positive, Blissful and happy life. Thanks and Blessings to the people that created Calm; it‚Äôs a gift for humanity and the world.

title: Loved the app until

review: I‚Äôve been using Calm for a few years.  I love the daily meditation as well as others.  I enjoy very much Lebron‚Äôs series.  My son and I listen to a kid‚Äôs story every night.  That is how he goes to sleep.  Recently, we started reading the Bio of the narrators before starting the story.  They are very interesting and my son loves reading them.
