title: Love this App!

review: I use headspace often, love it. But I have been curious what Calm is about and I have to say I enjoy this app as well. I am an insomniac and easily anxiety prone and so I wanted to see if this app could provide me something different then headspace. What I like so far is the daily calm and the fact that I can put my mood, gratitude and insights into the software daily, almost like a journal. Helps me to slow down at the end of the day and reflect. I think I like the sleep stories in headspace a bit better, but with both apps I can get the best of both worlds.
title: Just what I needed

review:
Calm has helped me immeasurably - between meditations to relax/get motivated/destress; stretching exercises to energize and reset; sleep stories for bed time; and motivational talks to refocus and reach for goals - so many bases are covered! Sleep stories have helped me rest more easily, resulting in better quality of life when I am awake. 

The only thing Calm has missed the mark on for me is in giving racist trash Camilla Cabello a voice and an income stream. This isn‚Äôt about her music, it‚Äôs about her absolute hurtful & racist behaviors that she only owned up to and apologized for AFTER being called out publicly. Calm, please vet your celebrity guests and remove racist trash like Camilla Cabello from your otherwise delightful app.
title: Life changing app

review: After reading some reviews, I am glad to find that I am not the only person who can‚Äôt stand Tamara Levitt. The content is great and what she‚Äôs produced is amazing, but the way she guides the meditations is so...fake. She says everything in this exaggerated way, dripping with sweetness and condescension, like she‚Äôs forcing herself to be calm and nice and soothing. Nobody talks naturally like that! Unless you are a privileged white new agey woman from California. I cannot listen to her daily meditations, her courses, or her sleep stories. They make me angry! I don‚Äôt love all the narrators but she is the worst! I have never heard anyone with such an annoying voice in my life! Maybe she should narrate Fox News, it would fit the content better. Instead of Tamara I think you should replace her with Eric Braa. His voice is gold.
title: Can‚Äôt stand Tamara

review: I really like this app! I mostly use the sounds it comes with that are free! (You can find these sounds on the home page and in the top left corner you will see mountains and you click on that and you can play different sounds) My only problem is how much costs money. It‚Äôs kinda stupid how much costs because all you can really do is play those free sounds and do some ‚Äúhow do you feel‚Äù questions. I would really like to listen to the sleep stories because I‚Äôm a kid with ADHD and it‚Äôs very difficult to fall asleep at night, and all the stories cost! I don‚Äôt make that much money for a kid. My only request is please make more things free. Other than that this is pretty good! Have a nice day/night!
title: It‚Äôs good but...

review:
The Calm App has been a daily ritual in my life  for over a year now.
I love it!  So peaceful, the soundscapes are amazing. The daily Jay is my favorite which gives insight on daily life how to realign your thinking to get the most out of living.  I‚Äôve tried different apps and not renewed but this app is part of me now and has brought my breathing and meditation to a higher level.  Used daily and even at bedtime with the wonderful bedtime stories, relaxation meditation and soundscapes, it can propel your life to better sleep and deeper relaxation.
title: Calm App is such a daily inspiration in my life!

review:
Hi - I‚Äôve been using calm close to five years. The app has really grown with so many new features, tools, and content. Compared to earlier versions of the app I now find the app overwhelming. When I need a moment to deescalate or need urgent breathing meditations it is not helpful to have to ‚Äúfind‚Äù my saved sessions. I would like to see a personalized Home Screen‚Ä¶a way to pin meditations like daily calm or Daily Trip or just pin sessions that you want to listen to over and over or when you need to have that session on hand at a moments notice.
My thoughts‚Ä¶.
title: Calm App Overload

review: I‚Äôve been a long time user of the app and it‚Äôs been great! I love the daily trip with Jeff Warren and the music helps me focus. However, the platform feels overwhelming to navigate. I also don‚Äôt like how I have to scroll all the way down to find my Favorites. This should be at the top, followed by For Today and Recently Played. I dont need to see all these rows with suggestions. Also, the music playlists stop after the first song. This seems to be a bug. Would be great if this could be fixed because it‚Äôs annoying to have to manually hit next after each song.
title: Long time user

review:
I have been a long time user of calm, but my streak ended at 665 days due to LOUSY, POOR support. When my subscription came up for renewal I was trying to pay on their website. My credit card kept getting refused. It should not have been. I tried for three days. DID SUPPORT REPLY TO MY INQUIRY? No. It finally got accepted but then my subscription was locked! 

I do not mind if they do not have phone support. But I do like easy access to email support. The app does not have that. The alludes to having it. But it is not there. 

I have lost my streak and my faith in this app. I am going to request a refund. Given the lack of support, I will probably have to cancel my credit card payment and deal with the bank.
title: Good content, lousy support

review: I enjoy using calm.   Lots of interesting programs within the app to help settle your mind and body. I love the masterclasses with a wide range of topics, also spark has speakers who have had something out of the ordinary change their life and that guest speaker  shares their journey.  Meditation lessons also range from a wide variety of topics.   Sleep stories are wonderful too.  Sleep stories have put my grand son to sleep quickly he is age 3.   I use this app a lot and have just started using the exercise guidance routines.   I love this app very beneficial to my health.   Thanks
title: Very good and easy

review: I suffer from many mental issues.  Ever since I began using the noting process, I have released so much anxiety and pressures off of my whole entire body.  I do not even have to take some of the medication prescribed by my Psychiatrist anymore as a result of this.  It is a true blessing.  I believe in this so much, I recommend the lifetime subscription to anyone going through these same mental problems.  It can be a matter of life and death!!!  Thank you Lebron James for introducing me to this APP.  You do not know me, however you saved my life.  God bless you always üíõüíõüíõ
title: Life Saving

review: Thank you for how supportive you‚Äôve been and you help me fall asleep every time nothing doesn‚Äôt stop me from sleeping in your app. My parents separated when I was 3 years old and I miss my dad slit and wouldn‚Äôt be able to fall asleep. At first I used to think calm was for grandmas who have sleep issues but I learned there are different meanings to this app and many of them are helpful to me. Once again thank you so much for this app you have created I‚Äôm only one of the many people you have helped with the same kind of problem.
title: Thank you calm

review:
I‚Äôve been using this app for about 3 months. The beginning meditation course is really great and worth taking. Also like the sleep stories. But I will not be renewing. Should have gotten 1-2 months instead of a year. Here‚Äôs why:

TLDR: App is poorly designed; make sure you like Tamara Levits way of speaking before subscribing bc she‚Äôs 90% of the guided meditations:

1) The app is very confusing to navigate, which when half asleep is especially frustrating. I surprised that there is no one clear place to see all of your saved/fav recordings. Also, ever meditation has a huge picture which seems ok for people new to the app, but unnecessary for whose who just want to find what they're looking for. These things can easily be fixed and I hope they do something about it. 

2) After I finished beginning mediation course, I realized 90% of the other guided meditations  are by Tamara Levitt. I understand a lot of people probably like how she speaks (vocal fry, trying too hard to sound soothing), but I find it too distracting. So basically I can‚Äôt listen to 90% of the guided meditations.
title: 1 year subscription not worth it

review: I absolutely love the CALM app! It has truly transformed my daily life for the better. The soothing meditations and sleep stories help me unwind after a long day, and the mindfulness exercises keep me grounded and focused. The app's user-friendly interface makes it easy to navigate, and the variety of content ensures there's always something to suit my mood. CALM has become an essential part of my self-care routine, and I can't recommend it enough for anyone seeking peace and relaxation in their hectic lives. Thank you, CALM, for making mindfulness and tranquility so accessible!
title: Amazing

review: I was skeptical when I learned about the Calm app. Can technology like this really help people? I needed some calm in my life and wanted to learn to meditate, so I gave it a try. I‚Äôve done the ‚ÄúHow to Meditate in 30 days‚Äùlessons twice now, as well as many of the other daily guided meditations. Jeff Warren has changed my life with this meditation course! I now understand how seek equanimity and clarity so I can be responsive, not reactive, to life‚Äôs ups and downs. What a gift! I‚Äôm forever grateful for the peace these meditation skills have brought to my life. Jeff, you are a hero to me!
title: Positive use of technology

review:
I‚Äôve been using this app for many years now and it‚Äôs helped me so much. I listen to them almost every night and when I have anxiety and put one on  I just think of the story and not my anxiety and it helps because tell me..would you rather sit in darkness and be panicked and upset and worried and tense and AWAKE or would you rather sit there awake and listen to a story to keep you calm and entertained. And mostly I will fall asleep when I can and I just love this app and recommend for anyone with troubles for sleeping. Someone like me! 
Thank you calm üôèüèª‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Best thing ever! ‚ù§Ô∏è

review:
I mainly joined calm for the Sleep Stories and I rely on them to help me fall asleep 4-5 nights a week.  I also enjoy the daily Calm meditations, other directed meditations and the new sleep music. I really enjoyed the chaptered sleep stories ie,  The Pacific Crest Trail.  Please more! 
Lately I‚Äôve been disappointed that there is not enough ‚Äúnew content‚Äù for adult sleep stories.  The new content appears to made for children, ie. fairy tales, cartoonish stories and Thomas the Train. Please more ‚ÄúNew‚Äù adult content with low toned male voices.  I suffer from tinnitus and high pitched women‚Äôs voices are the opposite of relaxing. Thanks Calm for getting me relaxed and asleep!
title: Calm lover for more than 3 years

review:
I use the kid sleep stories for my children every night and it helps them fall asleep nicely. If I wake and can‚Äôt get back to sleep a sleep nature sleep story helps my brain shut down and stop keeping me awake. Not all stories work but there‚Äôs enough variety to find what works. 

The meditations are guided and a nice way to recharge and there‚Äôs music options too. Mostly I use the sleep stories but it‚Äôs nice to know there are so many options so each person can use what they need to either calm their brain, get to sleep, or recharge.
title: Works like a charm

review: I just checked to see how many apps are on my phone right now and it‚Äôs 116. Of all 116, Calm is by far the most important one to me. It has been so impactful in my life, even before the pandemic. It‚Äôs not just hippie-dippy meditation mojo. It‚Äôs mindfulness, healing, laughing, dreaming, calming. Without even trying, I‚Äôve found myself in situations where I react differently simply because I‚Äôve done a few meditations through this app. And there‚Äôs SO much to choose from. So definitely start with Jeff‚Äôs 30 Days of How to Meditate. I‚Äôm not exaggerating when I say: it‚Äôs life-changing.
title: Only One

review:
I can‚Äôt tell you how many times I‚Äôve been wound up tight and said , ‚Äú I really need to meditate ‚Äú. I say this to myself because I Know it helps. Spending a few minutes , maybe even 15 or 20 minutes , has this effect: change in my thinking. All of a sudden , what seemed urgent and irritating , scary or anxiety causing, is not how I‚Äôm viewing it anymore . It‚Äôs not that the situation is gone , but my thinking is now different, and this thinking seems more balanced and rational . 
The Calm App makes attaining this Easy. 
Thank you many times
title: Calm really works

review:
I am paying for a subscription right now and I enjoy the app. My number one biggest problem is that Tamara Levitt narrates what feels like the majority of it and I feel bad saying this but I find her voice to be very irritating. So basically I avoid anything with her and she does *most* of the series :/ I hate myself for being this judgmental. Feels very unmindful but I just can‚Äôt help it.

Seems like a lot of reviewers are having the same issue. I will probably switch to Headspace when my year is up and see if I like that better 

I will say though I LOVE Jeff Warren‚Äôs content. I wouldn‚Äôt use the app every day if it wasn‚Äôt for his daily trip
title: Good but less content than hoped

review: As someone who wants an accessible and easy way to meditate, listen to white or background noise, or just listen to sleep stories, Calm would be a great solution. I have actually downloaded this app once before, but I deleted it because there were too many locked items, meditations, and stories. Other than this significant issue, Calm is still great for if you just want to listen to background noise. I wish there were more things i have access to without having to pay so much.
title: Too many locked items

review: Has a lot of good relaxing sources all at your fingertips instead of searching them out yourself. Wouldn't reccomend unless you've got cash to burn. But the kinds of sources it offers are genuinely helpful. Turned me on to Brown noise and, as a chronic insomniac, that's been LITERALLY lifechanging. I can finally like actually sleep. It's really the only reason I'm writing this review. Yeah, give this app a try. It's at least worth the download. I only wish there was a monthly subscription option vs a yearly one, bc oof I can't afford that kind of chunk out of my paycheck.
title: Nice if pricey

review:
I‚Äôm not even close to utilizing all that Calm has to offer but it was definitely worth it to subscribe, and then subscribing for life. 

One suggestion: it would be really helpful to see the YEAR on the date stamp on the different check-ins. I like to look over my successes/progress/regression and not knowing the year just makes the entries not useful. I mean I can‚Äôt go back to that date in my journal to see what was going on, or to my calendar, or‚Ä¶ you get the idea. Thanks a lot if you do update the app.
title: Wonderful, I bought a lifetime membership!

review: Amazing app with good content - BUT each section is poorly catalogued. Within each category of content, things are not organized in an approachable manner. Content in each section seems to be listed by release date, NOT length, subject matter, or course. I wish for example, when looking through the ‚ÄúAnxiety‚Äù category under ‚ÄúMeditations‚Äù, I did not have to scroll through two dozen 2-3 minute long random items, before finding the more popular offerings. Doesn‚Äôt seem like a customer-focused way of presenting items, rather just a hap-hazard jumble of whatever their system happens to push into each category.
title: Poorly cataloged

review: I need help sleeping and this just didnt help. Everything costs money and you have to pay just to fricking SLEEP. If it was free my review would be five stars but it costs soooooooo much money! Its stupid and I found something better. It truly stupid how you need to pay TO EXERCISE RELAX OR SLEEP!!!!!!! Some people actually need help to sleep or are so stressed and need something calming and this looks professional so you download it and then see YOU CANT DO ANYTHING CAUSE YOU NEED TO PAY!!!! I get y‚Äôall need money but at least give us some free stuff and not just one thing of each genre like lots of stuff in each genre. Conclusion dont make people pay to sleep or relax or you get reviews like these! Have a horrible day calm team!‚ò∫Ô∏è also have a great day to all the people who read this farüòù
title: Horrible

review:
I was on the fence about purchasing this app due to the high price, and the fact that you can obviously get anything on this app, on You Tube or on internet.

The attractive intro rate was enough for me to give it a whirl.

I‚Äôm thoroughly enjoying this app. I‚Äôve not dug in enough to set a meditation schedule, or to use this in the evening to wind down, however, I‚Äôm loving that everything one would need to relax, is at your fingertips.

I‚Äôve listened to the SoundScapes endlessly. They are so beautiful and very decompressing. I use this feature to wind down after work when I‚Äôm alone; feeding the dog, setting meal prep, etc.

Loving the Acoustic Guitar tab as well. Very inspiring if you‚Äôre a guitarist.

Over all, I highly recommend this app.
üåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåü
If you‚Äôre a beginner meditator, this is a great learning tool.  From there, you can utilize the SoundScapes to meditate and change your life, completely, effortlessly, consciously ‚ò∫Ô∏è
title: Enjoying Immensely üòå

review: I have long been told that mindfulness would help my anxiety and ADHD (51 year old adult here), but every time I tried over the years it was so boring and simply maddening to just sit and try not to be distracted. Calm isn‚Äôt like that at all! I do the walking meditations and the moving meditations, I listen as I lay in bed at night and I‚Äôm doing it often enough I can listen to the meditations while I do other activities such as drive and just focus on listening and breathing. It‚Äôs a game changer and I‚Äôm learning to let go of my anxiety and panic. Thank you!
title: ADHD and anxiety tools

review: I was skeptical at first, I thought this was just another app that was going to bombard me with advertisements. I‚Äôm glad I was wrong, its been a great addition to my self-care routine. I enjoy the daily check-ins, a wide range of meditations, sound scapes and I can add the things I like to my favorites. No cap, I use this every day, some days multiple times a day. I recommend this to anyone and everyone.. I absolutely love this app and could not see my days without it. Thank you so much to whoever created this, its been a life changer for me.
title: Improved my life

review: This app has helped me center and ground myself. I listen to the daily calm every morning and I am always so inspired by each lesson I learn following a meditation. It‚Äôs a wonderful way to start my day and has become a lifestyle routine. People may say ‚Äú$70 is a lot for a meditation app‚Äù. I respond by saying that some people spend that money on a one time restaurant meal. Why not invest the money on something that you get for a whole year to improve your emotional - mental health? It is everything to our vitality, independence, and quality of life. I love this app!
title: Transformational

review:
I wanted to stay with Calm a lot longer than I actually did, but for me it had a fatal flaw that ultimately caused me to stop using it: The Daily Calm meditations don‚Äôt have enough guidance.

What I mean by this is that the gaps between spoken guidance are too long, giving too many opportunities for my thoughts to focus on something else, ruining the experience.  This can be blamed directly on Tamara Levitt ‚Äî yep, naming names ‚Äî who apparently assumes that you have the basics of letting your thoughts go down pat before you listen to her insights.  

Unfortunately Tamara, I have news for you: Some of us need spoken guidance because we‚Äôre incapable of meditating on our own, and your work leaves a lot to be desired.

It‚Äôs too bad, because I found some of the sleep stories actually useful, which would have been a bonanza for people like me who often have nightmares.  But the fact that the Daily Calms are TOO quiet and don‚Äôt have enough guidance meant I was getting nothing out of them, and I had to walk away after that.
title: Does its job well, but‚Ä¶

review:
Overall, I have loved the Calm app for almost 2 years.  I use it for my meditation, for my yoga, and during my stretching activities. 

But there is a rogue bug that that has apparently been in the system for a while according to my Google searches! Most recently, the bug started impacting my experience from my iOS device randomly. When the app is "not on", the soundscapes will activate randomly at various times in the day. In order for me to turn it off, I am forced to open the app and close the app. 

I have found it at times extremely startling and at other times it has come on while I am in the middle of a conference meeting. The first time was comical, but now it just seems unruly, and frustrating especially during my business day where my phone accompanies me into meetings. 

I have owned this app for almost 2 years and may not renew in the coming year unless this bug is fixed. This is the reason I am giving the app a two star rating because without this stressful frustrating bug, I would rate it a five star app.
title: Great app except for random bug!!!

review: The app feels so unorganized. The types of meditation on the main page are all over the place: ‚Äúquick and easy‚Äù , ‚Äúrecent daily trips?‚Äù , ‚Äúeating stress‚Äù ‚Ä¶.oh and then random celebrities telling me a story mixed in (I personally DGAF what Matthew McConaughey or Shaun Mendes have to say, but I can see how that would he a nice touch for others) Then if you click into any of those, there are random durations (10 min, 7 days) and/or random people providing the meditations (a professional, an influencer‚Ä¶). I guess I‚Äôm looking for structure and consistency of some sort, even if just a pattern so I know where to look in the app once I find something that works. I‚Äôm coming here for help with help for anxiety afterall, just didn‚Äôt find it here. This was a disappointment given the price, back to headspace for me.
title: ü•¥

review:
The sleep story I tried was effective for helping me fall asleep, however these are only about 30 minutes long.  I woke up several times during the night and restarted the story, which worked, but if the story was longer, or if it could have been configured to repeat, it would be much less disruptive and possibly I may not have actually had to fully wake up.  

Another missing option is to have one of the ambient tracks, or anything, play automatically after the story.

The interface is not good for sleepers.  Controls should be large, obvious and omnipresent.  Mucking around with controls is disruptive for sleep and for those of us who do not sleep with our glasses on, (read everybody) very frustrating.

The subscription model for this is very expensive.  The idea that new stories and content is an important aspect for sleep is flawed.  Good content does not need to be replaced as familiarity only helps with falling asleep.

For now I am going back to using boring Audible audiobooks played at .6 or .7 speed.   These play all night and never need to be touched once started.
title: Limited functionality for sleep

review:
i have been using the calm app for years now thanks to a generous gift from our daughters place of employment during the pandemic. when that ran out i invested in it just because i deserve and depend on it. recently my employer offered it (Southwest Airlines considers mental health important!). i already had a subscription so i couldn‚Äôt use that gift but was able to share it 
i have only scratched the surface of all there is on the app, i don‚Äôt have THAT much time, but it is in my top three of daily am habits.
title: such an important way to start the day

review: I love using the app, and use it everyday.  I had sent in a request to cancel my subscription once it expired and they replied and cancelled it.  I then changed my mind, and I have sent so many messages to their support group and not one of my messages has been answered. They have everything on their website except a link to renew your subscription.  The chat option is useless because it is not a chat just a place to leave a message but no one answers those messages.
title: Disappointed with support

review: I don‚Äôt know what I would do without Calm. I‚Äôve had a paid subscription since it 1st came out. I use the daily meditations and sleep stories every day. I‚Äôve learned with Master Classes and the many ‚Äòhow to meditate‚Äô series. One of the best things is that the meditation teachings are from various people and I have benefited from this. I have my favorites too- my own gurus. I‚Äôm now exploring the huge collection music. TY Calm. I show up differently in the world with more peace and ease. The vast and varied content of the app has been a big part of my journey.
title: Essential

review: I‚Äôve enjoyed the Calm App. I always fall asleep before the story gets to the 1/2 way point and I barely remember what the story was even about. I‚Äôve listened to one story 4 times so I could hear it in it‚Äôs entirety. One small complaint, on occasion the app seems to glitch, rendering it useless. A story or music will appear to be playing, while there is total silence. I‚Äôve had to do a hard reboot of my phone to get it to play. Not sure why this has happened, nor do I know who to contact about this annoying problem.
title: Wonderful Sleep Aid

review:
I have meditated before, but not for quite some time. For the past month or so, I found myself getting only 5 hours of very intermittent sleep, and it‚Äôs exhausting. This despite listening to ‚Äúsleep soundtracks‚Äù on my iPhone. 

Well, last night, I downloaded the Calm app, did the 30 minute Deep Sleep Relax meditation, and set a sleep playlist for 8 hours. I slept the whole night through, no waking up, for the first time in over a month. 

I am going to continue to use this app to meditate daily.
title: First full night‚Äôs sleep in a long time

review: What I love most about Calm, is it is only 10 minutes a day, if you choose, or you can select up an hour meditation. It is guided and you choose the way you meditate, whether lying down, in a nice bubble bath, or sitting in a comfortable spot. Doesn‚Äôt matter how you do it, just as long as you find 10 minutes a day. There are a variety of sleep stories and now the new Daily Trips 10 minute meditation is great because it gives guidance on daily mind situations we encounter and how to be mindful of those moments. Definitely will be a customer for life with Calm.
title: Great for All levels

review: When I  got this app I was expecting it to be free like the commercials on TV said and like the description said however they did not tell you that if you wanted all the meditation stuff anxiety  relief and depression relief  that that you would have to pay $70 a month for it and I was not happy with that so you could really only do the mood check in as many times a day however the only other thing you could get was the background noises and the mood check in not anything else and sometimes in the daily calm thing with Tamara Levitt. That isn‚Äôt always free. If you have kids and they go to sleep with lullabies and stories, you have to pay for those too. I am not very happy with this app.
title: NOT FREE

review:
I don‚Äôt ‚Äúmeditate;‚Äù I spend enough time in my head as it is. But for anyone who wants a few moments to ‚Äúcheckout‚Äù of the chaos and ‚Äúcheck in‚Äù with themselves, this is an easy path to take. It helped me process my grief after my father died, and the sleep stories have become part of my bedtime ritual after a major depressive episode.

However, this is NOT a substitute for proper medical care or a support network of family, friends and colleagues. As a healthcare provider, I am well aware of the core pillars of wellness. But this is a tool to add to the box.
title: A Gateway to Calm

review:
I started using Calm 3 years ago during one of the lowest points in my life. What a difference it has made for me!
The sleep stories are amazingly beautiful and effective, the guided meditations perfect for beginners or seasoned meditators and the inspirational bits just what I need when I‚Äôm feeling down. 
My favorite is the Daily Trip with Jeff. Love all his series, especially the beginner ones. He literally teaches the fundamentals of meditation in such an easy and unpretentious way. 
I am very grateful to all the creators and contributors behind this app.
title: First and best thing for my mental health

review:
I look forward to a daily session with Jeff, Tamara, Jay, or Mel. So far so good...

But Calm has added a "feature" that bugs me to no end: there's now a giant widget on the app's main screen to shove in your face some numbers and checkmarks to communicate your adherence/streak (# of times you had a session on the week). And more of the same nonsense when you finish a session. Uh... thanks??

It feels like you're assigning me homework. This clumsy attempt at gamification only serves to raise my anxiety, not lower it. There's a "Show Streaks" option in the app Settings, but turning it off has no effect on this dopey intrusion. It just seems so ill-advised and out-of-sorts with the whole tranquility vibe. I come to Calm because I could use some help chilling-the-eff-out, not to be spurred on to "Close your rings! C'mon lazy guy! DO IT!".

I Calmly beg of you: please make this "feature" optional and opt-IN, or better yet just scrap it. Not every app is suitable for trendy user engagement elixirs.
title: Great, except for "streak" jibba jabba

review: After losing my daughter, one of the harder things to do was to lay down at night and shut my brain off. My mind would constantly go and grief was the worst when everything was quiet. I heard about the calm app and tried the free trial. I was listening to stories while drifting off to sleep or imaging myself outdoors while listening to night sounds or beach waves. It was great!!! Thank you Calm for literally keeping me calm during the worst times. Now, years later, I still use Calm to wind down, relax, and reset.
title: Helped through a loss

review:
If you get stuck in your head, unaware of the source of anxiety, the Calm app can help. 

I grew up without a correct understanding of meditation, therefore avoiding it until I encountered Calm. After attempting to practice self care using other apps and podcasts, I was underwhelmed at the thought of trying again. I believed that I wasn‚Äôt built for meditation and therefore could not benefit from it. 

Calm has helped structure a meditation and reflection routine in my life that has set a path of predictability during panic or any unsettling emotions/feelings. I rely on the content that is released to maintain a sense of self-awareness and stability that I have never been able to trust. 

If you are someone who passes by apps that teach meditative practices and self care techniques with thoughts that this just isn‚Äôt for me, use a free trial and just try it. You may be surprised and enjoy this new coping mechanism.
title: Most cost-effective breath of fresh air

review: Disclosure - I pay for the yearly subscription so I‚Äôm not sure what limitations there are with the free version. Nonetheless, the subscription is beyond worth it for me. Sleep stories have helped on restless nights. Guided collections help target different areas for personal growth. There‚Äôs so much to this app that I have learned which I now apply to myself and others. Compassion, allowing space, learning to be comfortable with the discomfort of emotions. This is an excellent tool no matter where you are in your mindfulness journey. Been using the app since 2017.
title: Great Variety

review: I love this app and use it almost every day. Mostly now I‚Äôm just doing the timed meditation but I still really like the picture and quote that comes up after Tamara‚Äôs Daily calm that had been included after the timed meditation as well. The last couple of times I‚Äôve just finished with some sort of business request and the green screen. Please let me finish my self guided meditation beautifully with the calming picture and quote and without business ‚Äúapp‚Äù options. Thank you!
title: Go back to pictures after timed meditation

review: One of the most used apps on my phone is my Calm app. I meditate daily, always in the morning. I try to record my daily gratitude and in the Hemings I always sleep to soundscapes and occasionally a sleep story. I also use the app from time to time when I am stressed and need to slow down for a few minutes. If you‚Äôre reading this calm, it‚Äôd be great to have an option for a twenty minute daily meditation. You could simply add more quiet periods between the narration. Just a thought! Regardless, I love my calm app.
title: Calm a day keeps the Doctor away

review:
Love this app. I use it daily/nightly. Never thought I would fall asleep to talking as I can‚Äôt focus but I did! 
Only things I wish I could change is that a soundscape counted toward your ‚Äústreak‚Äù, and that you can create your own playlist! I love certain narrators and wish I could mix and match a few. I hate waking up and not hearing something so I‚Äôd love to have a few hours worth stacked up of my choice. (The preset ones are ok but the ability to pick your own would be great) Overall a great app to have. Not a fan of Shetty after his fakeness but hey can‚Äôt win them all!
title: Love‚Ä¶ but wish for a change!

review: I love Calm!  There‚Äôs so many options.  Each day you can listen to a new guided medication, select a specific mediation to fit your emotional needs for the day, or escape the stress of the day with a narrated story that will melt away the stress!  Every night with my kids (10 & 6) we do the daily meditation.  Then, they drift off to sleep listening to a narrated story.  They‚Äôve learned so much over the last two years about how to label, understand, and cope with their emotions.  Every child (and adult!) would benefit from daily practice!
title: Great daily practice

review: I have been using this app for several months , mainly for guided meditation. I like that it has several options with different guides and different approaches. I loved the background music , which used to play as soon as you opened the app and continued through the meditation. Birds chirping and soft waves. But suddenly it‚Äôs gone! Maybe some found it distracting, but it‚Äôs half the reason I chose this app. Tried to find if there is a setting where I could turn it back on, but did not find one. Please bring it back or tell me how to retrieve it!
title: Like the app, but what happened to the music?

review: I‚Äôve been using Calm since 2015 and it is surprising just how much they‚Äôve improved & given you so more when it already was amazing. This app is my #1 must have. I rave to everyone about it all the time bc I wish everyone shared the same joy & peace that this app gives me. I also highly suggest turning the notifications on so you can get reminders throughout the day to check in & take some deep breaths. You can tell that the creator puts a lot of love & care into this app. Thank you Calm for everything that you do!
title: Above & beyond

review: Hello, Calm. I loved your app and the calmness it provided when I was in college‚Ä¶ That being said, coming back to the app, you‚Äôve put almost everything in the app on premium lock. Understandable for the celebrities and music made by creators. Although I believe that sounds such as trains passing by, forest full of crickets at night, & raining background noises shouldn‚Äôt have been on premium lock. I wouldn‚Äôt have minded paying premium but the only subscription available for me to sign up for was the yearly plan, I would‚Äôve been more inclined to pay if there was a monthly payment one. [I didn‚Äôt bother to look as I was done with the app.] You‚Äôre app was great while it lasted before your promotion with celebrities. Good bye.
title: Sad.

review:
I suffer from panic disorder and major anxiety. I was having panic attacks every single day that were so bad I even told my boyfriend to call an ambulance because I thought I was dying. I‚Äôve done everything and been on multiple medications that either haven‚Äôt done anything, or have made it worse. I‚Äôve never tried meditation because for years I always thought it was a waste of time. This was my last resort and I almost rely on it now to calm me down. 
The only bad side is that it costs $70 a year to use it so I will probably look for another app that‚Äôs the same.
title: It really helped

review:
I very much appreciate that I get the premium version of Calm through my healthcare provider (KP). I meditate on a daily basis and find that the 10-15 minutes that I take early in the morning allows for me to be better prepared for the day regardless of what that looks like. 

I especially appreciate the daily meditation that Tamara Leavitt offers. It is a very helpful and thoughtful perspective on something that I can almost always find application for and the deeper I engage in the many parts that are offered, the more I get out of the practice.
title: Appreciation for Tamara

review: In August of 2019, I applied to get Calm for free. The people at calm said that if you worked in education and wanted to try it - let them do it for free! I am a social worker in a low Socioeconomic school district and people in my circle laughed ‚Äú you are going to get these kids to meditate?‚Äù  Let me scream it from the rooftops- THIS APP HAS CHANGED THESE KIDS MINDSET. I love this app and would pay for it every year for the rest of my life!! If I am honest, I don‚Äôt think I could personally live without it in my daily life, either ! Thank you Calm for bringing peace to so many of my patients and to my life, as well!
title: Could not live without

review:
As someone who just started using this app I can definitely recommend it. The content is spot on and it is organized in such a beautiful and helpful manner.
The thing I use the most within the app is the rain sound as it has a huge impact on my mood. I would love if they added more diversity to it though to feel more natural like if it changed the intensity of the rain or add some thunder sounds every now and then. I‚Äôve used other apps before that did just that but I would prefer to use everything within calm.
Please take it into consideration.
title: Add more sounds

review:
Update:   Your newest update repaired the glitch caused by the previous update. No more crashes. Thank you!  I mostly use Calm for the background sounds and sleep stories however I have enjoyed several other features like The Spark.  I would suggest that the Daily Calm be narrated by other voices in case the main narrator‚Äôs voice doesn‚Äôt work for your listeners. A little variety is nice.  Overall a good app. 

Old: I enjoyed Calm until the latest update. Now I get a purple ‚Äútake a deep breath‚Äù screen and then it crashes and closes. No access possible.  FIX THIS PLEASE!
title: It‚Äôs fixed!

review:
Unfortunately, the main voice on the app is like nails on a chalkboard to me, not soothing at all. So, the daily sessions she offers and many of the specialty sessions, I can‚Äôt listen to. I realize we are all different, but I wish there were more voice options for situations like this, or that she would hire a voice actor with a soothing tone like all of her guests. At this point, I can only enjoy guest sessions so I will be discontinuing my subscription and switching to another similar app that I‚Äôve found. 
I do like this app and find that it helps my child and myself. Let me know if the voice options come about, and I‚Äôll subscribe again. There are some nice exercises and affirmations here.
title: Tamaras Voice

review: We use this app far more than anything else I‚Äôve ever paid for (well NYT Cooking excepted). My husband and I both love the daily mediations that are short and approachable. But the sleep stories really take the cake for us AND our toddler. They are a welcome salve in these confusing and challenging times; a place to park your brain long enough to drift off. Our kiddo loves the sleep stories; especially the three available Thomas the Train stories. That would be my only request for improvement: more Thomas please!
title: Love this for everyone in the family

review: Calm app is a great way to learn how to deal with your daily struggles. Everyone has issues and it‚Äôs hard to believe that one app could facilitate you going in a less stressful direction in life. It‚Äôs important to make time for yourself and this app has a 10 min daily meditation that has helped me tremendously. I am so glad I found this hidden treasure. I hope everyone enjoys it as much as I do. Give it a chance and I bet you will be able to accept life and feel better about any negativity coming your way. Excellent app.
title: I was a stressed out mess until I found this app

review:
I was hesitant to drop $70 for the year, but made sure when I started the week trial I was really ready to put it to the test. I have been using Calm for a couple months now and it‚Äôs well worth the less than $6 per month price tag. 

The variety is great, Tamara is awesome, and I love that you can identify meditations as favorites. 

The one thing that I really find myself wanting is the ability to also identify ALL meditations that I have tried. Some I don‚Äôt care to return to, but don‚Äôt have a way to know which they are. With that functionality, Calm would be an easy 5 stars from me.
title: Love Calm, BUT

review: It would literally take me hours to fall asleep because my mind would just wonder, but the sleep stories and soundscapes have put my mind wondering to an end. They‚Äôre interesting enough to keep your mind focused, yet soothing enough to let you fall asleep (not like having the tv on while trying to sleep). I use this app every night when falling asleep and sometimes turn it back on if I wake up in the middle of the night and can‚Äôt get back to sleep. I highly highly highly recommend the Calm app and everything it has to offer.
title: So helpful

review: This is a fantastic app and continually adds new content to and for sleep stories, meditations, classes , music and more. I especially like the daily Calm and the new Daily trip. I love Eric Braa and Jeff Warren‚Äôs soothing and clear voices. Some of the story tellers and speakers have voices that are difficult (for me) to hear or listen to, but these two men have wonderful voices, clear enunciation, and soothing speech. I love the constant updating of new material and variety. If a person is serious about calming their life, he or she will not regret purchasing this wonderful app.
title: Great selection of meditations

review: Once upon a time a little boy wanted to go camping but this is mom and dad said no because he can‚Äôt right it is a TV because he broke his arm in a cast So he needs toWait until he gets all the cast then they can go camping go on ATV rides and have fun sports do you so many stuff with his friends Play hide and seek think he should be until he gets all the cast in maybe get a girlfriend and then do it because he likesAubrey and I think she would like to go on a ride with him and enjoy some kind of be like a date for him the end. 12 ‚Äì 16-22
title: By Jacob Smith

review: I have been using this app consistently for 6 months for falling asleep. With this app, I‚Äôm usually asleep within 10 minutes. Without it, my brain spins for up to a couple of hours before I can drift off.  And since using it, I find that my bedtimes and hours of sleep have become more consistent because I actually get drowsy at bedtime now.  I paid for the annual subscription and it is worth every penny. My only gripe is that I wished that released sleep meditations more often.
title: Sleeping Better than I have in Years

review:
Taking time for yourself to be still is important.   But I often forget and this app has helped me focus during meditation and ultimately be a better person during the day hopefully for everyone‚Äôs benefit not just my own. 

I‚Äôve used the sleep parts to help me relax and prepare for sleep.   
Keeping the phone out of the bedroom is best for me but when I‚Äôm really restless I‚Äôll use the Clam app.  
If I wake up in the middle of the night I move the phone out of the bedroom and fall back to sleep quicker.
title: Being still became a priority

review: I came across this app through an Instagram app and decided to try it out. I love the wilderness sounds especially living in the city. Once in a while I can hear birds chirping in the morning but it‚Äôs very minimal so that‚Äôs why I love just hearing the sound of wilderness while using the app. The second time I went on Calm, I decided to try out the sleep cognition sound for about 30min before actually going to sleep and I fell asleep right away. I‚Äôm excited to explore the app a little more. Definitely recommend Calm to anybody!
title: Such a great app

review:
Love the messages that Tamara gives in the conclusion for each of her daily calms, but during the body of the meditation she does way too much guidance. Feels like your being lectured at times. How can you focus on the breath if she‚Äôs constantly talking? Usually saying the same thing repetitively 

There are meditations on the app with less guidance but they don‚Äôt provide the concluding messages that the daily calm does. They should try and offer something that gives the ending message of the daily calm but gives you the option to limit the amount of jargon during the middle 7-8 minutes of the 10 minute session.
title: Too much guidance

review: I won‚Äôt waste your time with a painfully long read so I will simply get to the point. Although this app features a very, very few audio options for sleep but they almost seem impossible to find. It‚Äôs almost as if they are trying to coax you into buying their premium but making it hard to find. Almost 90% of this App is a pay wall and little to no free options but, to add to that the free options are high grade quality -In my opinion-. It is hard to support something that does not keep a good balance of free and paid options. I do not recommend if you are not willing to pay for premium but if you are this app is perfect for you.
title: App is a Giant Pay Wall

review: I tried it a few years ago and I liked it but I have it free for a year through being in an HR program and I‚Äôm really liking the daily calms and also the sleep meditation but it doesn‚Äôt seem to be a lot of sleep meditations which is kind of bothering me at only looks like there‚Äôs like 10 or 15 so what happens after I do it for a few weeks I thought it would be like hundreds so if the developer is reading this I‚Äôm a little disappointed about that but maybe I‚Äôll find other stuff to listen to at night
title: Doesn‚Äôt seem like it has a lot of sleep meditations

review:
Excellent guided meditation. Easy to use, even as a beginner. And has a positive message. There are also master classes which delve deeper into particular subjects - like anxiety. Sleep stories are very relaxing and help when I‚Äôm traveling and can‚Äôt quiet my mind. There are sounds to choose from too. Basically it‚Äôs one app that offers all you could need to help calm, relax, restore and better your meditation practice.

After years of use since my initial review the app remains excellent and has expanded its offerings. I highly recommend.
title: Excellent App

review:
I want to start off by saying I absolutely LOVE this app. It has been a tremendous help and I really enjoy the guided meditations.

The only reason I‚Äôm not giving Calm 5 stars is because I prefer to use it at home on AppleTV and the app there is not nearly as organized or user friendly as the app for the phone. 

There‚Äôs no ‚ÄúDiscovery‚Äù (search) option. 

There‚Äôs no ‚ÄúFavorites‚Äù option. 

There‚Äôs basically three categories and you just have to scroll through them until you find what you‚Äôre looking for.  

Also, I enjoy doing the guided series of meditations. I do the majority of them at home, but if I‚Äôm away from home and attempt to do one on my phone I can‚Äôt pick up where I left off, even though my phone and AppleTV are signed into the same account. 

If the AppleTV version of the app was as good as the phone version this would be an easy 5 stars. Hopefully these small fixes can be made.
title: Please Reconfigure For AppleTV

review:
I went from 2-3 hours sleep to 7 average over the last 54 days. Two suggestions tho. I track it and it asks what helped you before sleep and during sleep. Almost all the choices are negative like anxiety, interrupted sleep, etc. they should all be positive choices. 

Also don‚Äôt like the way you put your hours slept in. There should be an option for split sleep. I‚Äôd like to record interrupted sleep as well. Like 10-12 and 2-6. Otherwise great app and love the stories, especially Chike!!
title: This has saved me‚Ä¶

review: Get the subscription for the year, it is more economical. If you want try it for a month, then renew for the year. It is wonderful, the soundscapes, the guided meditation and they are always adding more options. I did this during a time when I was experiencing a lot of stress and anxiety and it was so helpful. My husband even likes to use it. Sometimes we just put on the soundscapes at bedtime and listen to the rain or a crackling campfire and drift off to sleep. Try it and just enjoy the relaxation and personal growth.
title: This is amazing

review: I know it‚Äôs expensive but you can get a free trial! Helps me go to sleep & helps me meditate. This is the best app of all years. I go to sleep in 5 minutes! Please get it now! But wait I have more to say.  I‚Äôve have been using this app for 4 years now! (2017)Ever since I‚Äôve never had any problems. So many things to chose from! Helps me go to sleep in 5 minutes! One year ago I got this app and thought eh they‚Äôll fix this. STILL HAVENT FIXED IT. I‚Äôm done with Calm, going to headspace if this isn‚Äôt fixed soon.
title: Terrible offline functionality

review: It‚Äôs good for meditation breathing daily check-in‚Äòs sleep stories in music and sleep stories are the best because I typically listen to them 24 seven every single night so the most recommended that I would choose for you would be either if you want to sleep good night if you sleep, Chinese robot or kids, and you should listen to Shekinah and Tamra and Chike LeBron James, in many others, such as the calm or else, you‚Äôll never be able to fall asleep without anything like this.!‚ù§Ô∏èüß°üíõüíöüíôüíúüñ§ü§çü§éüíî‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçü©π‚ù£Ô∏èüíïüíûüíùüíòüíñüíóüíì omg it‚Äôs the best.
title: Call Matt review

review:
I‚Äôm having a lot of gratitude right now for the Calm app. After a long week, I got up early and just wanted to read a book. My mind was so busy that I couldn‚Äôt focus at all.

Today, I just picked up my phone and opened Calm, which I put on my home screen earlier this week. Almost immediately I could settle my mind and focus again.

I‚Äôve used the calm app as my go to example of a well thought through app for a while. Even though I generally hate subscriptions. This one sparks joy.
title: So grateful for this app

review: I use this app every night and most mornings. I love the sleep stories and now with the Daily Jay and Daily Move, there‚Äôs even more to choose from. The first couple of years there was no way to search and now they‚Äôve had that feature for quite a while. I signed up for a Lifetime membership over four years ago and I‚Äôm so glad I did because I‚Äôve more than paid myself back. The price of lifetime went up since then but it‚Äôs still well worth the money.
title: Best investment in myself ever

review: I fell upon this app as I‚Äôm getting older it‚Äôs hard to sleep at times in addition to the awareness there are outside factors that can stir up negative thoughts, feelings, etc. yes this is normal but sometimes these are two factors as mentioned above that this app has allowed me to bring inner peace, sort through and let go of. I for myself decided to make this a lifetime choice and live my daily calm choices. Never once did I say buying into this content was a bad choice, this helps push a milestone in my life.
title: A year of calm and a lifetime to go

review: First of all most of us don‚Äôt want to have a free trial and then start paying for this stuff. This needs to be free especially for parents who have kids and need some stress relief. Yes, the meditation and breathing stuff is awesome.. but that‚Äôs not enough. Second the stuff you have on the add, yes, it‚Äôs true, but it requires premium and most of the stuff on the app requires premium. So please fix this and I hope you can. Sorry if the review is a little harsh but I‚Äôm just being honest. And for the kids calming section most of the things need to be free truly if you have very energetic children. I hope the people who are reading this heed to this and have a blessed day!‚ù§Ô∏èüòä
title: Needs a lot of improvement üòë

review: Calm app helped keep my newborn happy and me relaxed through quarantine. Whether playing our baby, or myself, a sleep story, or using the soundscapes while working from home, the content is practical: volume doesn‚Äôt fluctuate like on some podcasts, stories are just stories and not ads, and everything is organized well. And it‚Äôs all relaxing. They also add new content often enough to keep it fresh. One request: please keep the train and non-fiction sleep stories coming! Thanks.
title: Worth subscription!

review: I use this app to sleep and everything is great. Only issue is that u should be able to adjust the volume of the sound independently of the phone volume. I use my phone to wake up, and want my alarm at full volume. But I find the apps noise at full volume to loud. So I cant use the app, because if i do my alarm will be to quite to wake me up. There seems to be a feature in the app for the scenes thing, but it doesnt work at all. Would really like to see this added because otherwise the app is great and has a lot of good sounds and stuff.
title: Adjustable volume needed

review: I think this app could and does have great potential. But to grow, you have to let the people that can‚Äôt pay the subscription have a wide variety of things as well. I‚Äôve looked around this app and 99% of everything I saw was locked behind a pay wall. I know it‚Äôs a free app and you still have to make money but don‚Äôt practically force us to buy the subscription to play any of the music, stories etc. I‚Äôm not saying open Everything up for free. You can still have payed stuff but make sure you don‚Äôt have all the content locked. I really hope you take my comment into consideration.
title: Too much locked ._.

review: I really love the calm app and it has made me see the value of meditation in my daily life. However, if you don‚Äôt have the premium version you can only do about 5 of the meditations, and they have hundreds in their library. This is frustrating to me because I know that not everyone has the financial means to purchase the premium membership, yet apps like these strive the make mental health care accessible to people of all walks of life. I think it would be beneficial for the calm app to unlock at least a few more of the meditations so that the largest number of people can benefit from their great resources.
title: make mental health care more accessible

review:
I actually get headspace for free through work and have tried many others.

I come back to this one because none of them have the daily content Tamara puts out. I have no idea how she comes up with something new every day.

The other features of these apps are pretty comparable - lots of cool stuff to check out like bedtime stories , specific types of meditation, music, etc.  also works on watch, I like to break during a run sometimes.
title: I‚Äôve tried them all - best of the meditation apps

review: Jeff Warren has a very strong but kind way iof teaching. In all my listening to his meditations I have learned something. Sometimes I listen to same message many times because feelings he encourages to feel but doesn‚Äôt insist upon it are feelings I could never say to myself. This message on balance is so helpful. I have always felt unbalanced that is why concentration is so hard but when it is put the way Jeff puts it I don‚Äôt get so angry with myself when I feel my balance is off. I am very greatful. flowerpot
title: Balance

review: I have enjoyed this app for 3 years. My daughter recently moved to attend college and I recommended she try it. I offered to look into getting the Family Plan (since she‚Äôs a broke college student). None of the information on the Help page actually helped me upgrade my subscription to a family plan. Nothing offered on the App Store. And, there appeared to be no way to get a hold of a live person to ask for help. I am greatly disappointed in their lack of customer service.
title: Sucky customer service

review:
Most features are locked if you don‚Äôt have premium, but to be honest I don‚Äôt care because for me the Check-Ins help me take out the stress of the day. You can add a note of all the things that make you stressed, check how well you sleep and why and even help remove those things, helps you reflect on all the things you are thankful for ( which helps so much more that you would think).

The stories however that are unlocked are the most relaxing and nice. The only thing that helps me sleep.

I haven‚Äôt tried many meditations but I do prefer to start my day with those because they help me have a better outlook on the day and help me remember that today is a new day, make it better that your last.

Overall the best app I‚Äôve used to help me sleep, my mood has improved so much is a couple days.

 Thank you!

‚ú®A Friend You Didn‚Äôt Know You Had ‚ú®
title: Best App For Anxiety

review: I got this app thinking that I would get better sleep and not be tired all the time‚Ä¶ I was wrong!! You guys charge way too much for the subscription and I‚Äôm so done because I am going through these reviews and there are tons saying that they can‚Äôt afford it and you respond with,‚Äù email us for any questions or concerns.‚Äù THIS APP MAKES ME SO MAD!!!ü§¨you guys expect people to pay for good sleep?!! I‚Äôm sorry but you guys need to fix this I need better sleep but I don‚Äôt wanna have to pay for it because I can‚Äôt control if I need a sleep app to help me a little bit to fall asleep!! Please at least make half of the stuff available and half of the stuff premium so that you can still listen and do stuff without having to PAY for mental health!!!
title: I‚Äôm D-O-N-E, DONE!!

review: Whenever the manic pace and daily stress of life pushes my brain into overdrive, careening from all that did not get done today and bouncing off all that must be done tomorrow, the soothing music and simplistic sounds of nature embrace the soul ever so gently.  Somehow my mind  is transported to simpler times and back to a place of Calm.  As stress is gradually replaced with a sense of well-being, my entire spirit is regenerated and healed.  What a wonderful gateway to peace.  In this state of being fully present,  I am once again centered on all that is truly important in this journey of life!   All else falls away... Thanks Calm!  I needed that...
title: Insomnia‚Äôs antedote

review: I lost my husband suddenly last year. Mornings were the worst part of my day for months & months. I found the music on the Calm app helped soothe & settle my racing thoughts & emotions. I wasn‚Äôt sleeping well so I always woke very early, I would sit on my deck with a cup of coffee & stare out at the fields & empty my mind of everything but the soothing music & beautiful scenery. Thank you Calm for helping me through the hardest year of my life! I have used this music on long flights & middle of the night worry sessions to help me find a bit of serenity.
title: Morning Calm

review:
PLEASE allow users to delete unwanted stories!!!!!
i have had this app for a couple of years. I enjoy the non-fiction sleep stories almost exclusively and my sleep has improved since purchasing the app. Many of the narrators are superb! I wish that they would allow you to remove the stories that you don‚Äôt care for from the ‚Äúplaylist‚Äù so you wouldn‚Äôt have to sift through them each time you look for something you want to listen to! This expensive app should be more customizable !!!
title: needs options for customization

review: Calm offers an array of possibilities for transitioning to sleep. My favorite is the sleep story. Stories often take you somewhere else and bring it to life, sometimes back in time. You might learn about an ancient guitar maker or the woman who showed how metamorphosis worked in her botanical drawings - real people you can look up and feel you already know from the story. Some of the meditations are really helpful. I use a headband with earphones in it so I don‚Äôt disturb my husband. A lovely idea well executed.
title: Enjoying the Trip to Dreamland

review:
I‚Äôve been using the Calm app for over two years now, and wouldn‚Äôt want to be without it! 

The ‚ÄúDaily Calm‚Äù is a great meditation training tool and all-around positive influence on my daily life. I love to alternate it with Jeff Warren‚Äôs ‚ÄúDaily Trip‚Äù, for his wonderful, down-to-earth approaches meditation. 

Calm is  continually adding great new content,  making it increasingly valuable. It is an amazing and powerful resource. Sleep stories are great, and when I‚Äôm wired up at bedtime, the sleep meditations help me relax and drift off to sleep. I highly recommend Calm!!
title: Great Meditation App

review: I was introduced to meditation in my teens in India by my father and various other teachers but after moving out of India more than a decade ago I lost touch with my practice with life getting busier and and busier. I was not able to find time and a good instructor( I enjoy guided mediations) but then I came across Calm and Tamara Levitt! I enjoy her 10 min daily calms where she offers great breathing techniques and wisdom in each session. These 10 mins a day have put me back in the habit. You will find good sleep stories,guided mediations and amazing music here!
title: Love it!

review: My experience with calm has been amazing. It‚Äôs great for people like insomniacs and students with busy lives and nights filled with stress and worry. It has helped me a night owl to want to go to sleep and even sleep better!! I love calm but the one thing I really wish was better is the voices and music, there all amazing but sometimes to loud! so loud that I can‚Äôt get it to a point where it‚Äôs just right maybe I just have sensitive ears? Over all calm is a great experience and you should definitely give it a Try.ü§ó‚ò∫Ô∏èüëçüëç‚ù§Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏èüß∏
title: Calm

review:
The calm app is one of the best resources you will ever come across. There are so many ways to use it. The lessons learned are insightful and encouraging. It‚Äô s like having a new best friend that you can access no matter the time of day. It has definitely helped me learn how to deal with anxiety. My sleep has improved as well. I love the sleep stories, the meditations, the daily meditations, and all of the other applications. It‚Äôs always being updated.
Do yourself a favor and give it a try. You‚Äôll be happy you did!
title: Calm app

review: I only wish that Calm would diversify the  voices and narrators for the daily meditations. Having the same person for all of them is a bummer, especially because her voice is kind of annoying. Some voices just are for some people, and for others they are perfect, which is why I would love it if Calm used different voice actors for that section, they way they do with the sleep stories. Other than that, I love Calm! Highly recommend it! Use it almost everyday. üôÇ
title: Wonderful sleep Stories

review: As someone who used to struggle with, and occasionally still does, emotional regulation, intrusive thoughts, and so much else, this app has changed my life. I look forward to each meditation, listening to the soundscapes at bedtime, and all the other little treats that this app has in store for us. It‚Äôs great. I feel like I‚Äôm actually making a change in my life through the practices this app has help me put in place in my life. Thank you devs - so much - for coming up with something so life changing.
title: Life changer

review: I use Calm in the morning for meditation, daily Jay for inspiration and Mel for movement which gives me energy and gets me ready for the day. Using my Calm app every day keeps me in alignment with my goals and finding my peace early in the day. I look forward toUsing my Calm app each morning. I use the sleep stories and meditations for sleep when I go to bed and if I wake up in the night I turn them on again and it definitely leads to peace and allows for better sleep. Highly recommend calm app
title: Great start to my day

review: I started using this app because my psychiatrist highly recommended it I am extremely grateful to her. The guided meditations have changed my life, you‚Äôll hear comforting words that you need, that those around you may not be able to offer. I 100% believe this should be a part of everyday life and it so easy to use everything is perfectly titled. Even when baby sitting I put the kids calm on and they actually like it! Thanks calm!
title: This is a must for every family member to have

review:
First off the app makes it look like you must sign in using email, google, Facebook, apple but as soon as you click the X it bypasses. Why not just have an option to say ‚ÄúI‚Äôd rather not create a profile right now‚Äù? Instead you are using what feels like a ‚ÄúDark Pattern‚Äù to collect user data before letting users into the app. 

Second, once you get passed the sign-up it wants you to subscribe with a seven day free trial. Really, let me look at the app first. And your pricing?!? 

Third, once I‚Äôm in there‚Äôs really nothing that I can find to try out that‚Äôs actually free. Clicking everything on the screen takes me to the Sign Up for Subscription. And on top of that the subscription isn‚Äôt really cheap, I mean it‚Äôs super pricy for what this app is supposed to do. 

Overall the app feels like it‚Äôs out to collect your data and take your cash but for what? The pricing is way too high for what this app is supposed to do. At one time it may have been a good app, it won an award like five years ago but since then it must have gone down hill. 

I‚Äôll have to pass on this one people‚Ä¶
title: Kinda Sleezy

review:
I‚Äôm obsessed. I opened this app months ago and couldn‚Äôt commit to the yearly payment; however, I thought to myself that my therapy sessions are $10 less than this app and if I‚Äôm willing to pay some guy to talk to me each month, then certainly I can pay for this app that will help me on my journey to self clarity and gratefulness. I wasn‚Äôt quite ready before, but happy to be here now!

Best app ever- I promise I‚Äôm a reallll regular person. This app is the top notch app of our time.
title: Cool App. Truly unlike any other. Kudos to the design team!

review:
I used the free version of Calm for a year before I got the paid version. I wanted to make sure I was going to consistently use it. During that first year I used it almost every night!

And I still do. It has proven to be the most consistent method of helping me fall asleep. The stories are engaging (well the part I hear before I doze off), the variety of narrators is excellent, and there are always new stories being added.

If you have any trouble sleeping, do yourself a favor and get Calm.
title: Do yourself a favor

review:
Add your commercials to the app ‚Ä¶. Even if I have to play the 30seconds one on loop ‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs so relaxing to try to relax for sleep ‚Ä¶. I love actually looking at rain flowing down and hearing it ‚Ä¶. Ocean too ‚Ä¶ lately I‚Äôve not been going to my app but more on your Instagram so I can see those videos again ‚Ä¶ even the sand one with the poking sticks going inside while it‚Äôs going in circles 

Please add those videos and make it a wonderful one stop shop for relaxation ‚Ä¶ u can make a tab ‚Äúquick on the go relax‚Äù ‚Ä¶ I love the app already and this will make it phenomenal
title: Wonderful app but add one thing

review:
Relax as you calmly drift off to a peaceful sleep with Calm...it works wonders! I have been sleeping much better lately since I downloaded Calm. And I need beauty sleep! Anyway, listen to stories that are so serene, they make you fall asleep in a sentence of them. The Calm songs have a relaxing beat to them that you can just lie there, listening to music, or just drift off to a relaxing sleep! 
Calm, thank you for everything you do, we love you, always, and hope you keep updates going. You have my moral support. ‚ò∫Ô∏è
title: Calm For All

review:
For an app that is supposed to create calmness this app sure does cause a lot of stress and annoyances. 

First songs do not always load when clicked on. Often times I‚Äôm having to close out the app and reopen it in order to play the song/sounds I want. Second. The UI is way too cluttered after the UI change. No quick access to my favorites and way too many categories and too much going on. 

Clean up the interface. Simple is better especially for a calmness app. Fix your ongoing problem of songs not loading. That should be a basic operation of a music playing app.
title: App continues its decline

review: I love this app. Some nights I drift away to the gentle sound of the ocean, mesmerized as each wave invites me to enter uninterrupted sleep. My favorite is the crickets and meadow stream; I feel like I am camping and the song of the crickets shut out every stressful thought that tries to infringe on much needed rest. The purring cat is soothing during the day, and comforting when I am alone grading papers. I pass on the washing machine and do not find it relaxing. Anyone that enjoys the sounds of nature or struggles with insomnia needs this app. I am sleeping better than I have for years.
title: Amazing sleep every night!

review: I love this app. The only thing that would improve is being able to have a que for listening.  So I could do a short meditation, that immediately goes into a sleep story, then  turn on one of the sound scapes.  If I‚Äôm on the edge of sleeping but the story ends and I realize it,  I will wake up to put another one on.  I use the sound scapes a lot to drown out noise that wakes me up, but that doesn‚Äôt work if I fall asleep listening to a sleep story.  So makers please add this feature.  I can‚Äôt be the only one that would like this.
title: Awesome app, needs one improvement

review:
I tired maybe 10 different meditations apps and after nearly a whole year of searching, I decided on this one. Even got the lifetime subscription for it since I personally hate to add to my monthly expenses and feel a lot more relaxed knowing that I‚Äôm not wasting my money by not using it ‚Äúenough‚Äù in a month.

It has bells, nature sounds, music, stories, pretty backgrounds, it looks nice and it‚Äôs quite polished for an app. And yes, it has a good meditation collection as well as new daily ones. 

Some suggestions for future updates:

More nature sounds and higher resolution backgrounds.  Casting this app on tv would be great too. And I definitely would not complain if you would add binaural sounds option for those of us with headphones.

Overall, if anyone out there is still hesitating on which meditation/calming app to get, I would say: just get this one. It‚Äôs good and it gets updated regularly.
title: Best of them all

review: This is one of those classic apps where you can‚Äôt really do anything with the app‚Äôs features unless you ‚Äúunlock‚Äù them or pay for them. BUUUUUT on the other hand‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..if you‚Äôre going through a difficult time, this may help. It has many great features to help with your mental health like breathing routines (üí°gr8 b4 bedüîç), quizzes, noises to fall asleep to, podcasts and more. An easy to use app like this is a great way to start getting into habit of taking care of your mental health.
title: Worth it if you‚Äôre willing to pay

review: I think you should have more options for people who can afford your app. Anxiety and mental health is a real thing! I would love using the app if there more options then me having to pay for. Most people who having mental health don‚Äôt have the option or the means to pay for little things like this that could help more than you could image. Start sponsoring ads and have us watch some ads to unlock some features (like most apps do) stop trying to earn money off of people‚Äôs mental health problems!
title: For us poor people with anxiety

review: I really like this app. It allows you to be able to meditate, practice mindfulness, listen to sounds when trying to fall asleep, and practice techniques to work on anxiety and stress. Not only that, it is very aesthectically pleaasing to the eye. This app is easy to navigate through. I also like that this app is availavle for people of all ages to use. I suggest using the 7-day free trial to see if you want to pay for it, or if you just want to stick with the free app.
title: Great App!

review:
Largely, I love this app and it has saved my sleep! That said, the new way sleep stories are categorized is a miss. I just want fiction, nonfiction, travel, trains, nature etc.. 
Also, and I really hate saying this because I‚Äôm sure Tamara is a lovely person, but a lot of us (check Reddit) find her voice irritating and she narrates a large majority of the meditations offered. I use a different app because her approach is like a Disney caricature of the ‚Äúyoga voice‚Äù. I‚Äôd love to hear just normal, down to earth, grounded, real voices by instructors who aren‚Äôt performative.
title: Simple catalogues and less Tamara please! (Sorry Tamara)

review: I can‚Äôt even start with how bad this app is. I will not pay for something that is supposed to be given once you download the app. It is one thing for maybe half the content to be locked unless you  buy it but it is another thing for 99% of the content to be locked. I found three sleep stories that were unlocked and they would put you to sleep not because they were calming and relaxing it boring and dull. There was literally a story called the rules of tennis. I would love this app if I didn‚Äôt have to pay for most of the things I should get for free. I do not recommend this app if you are not willing to pay for the content. This app was more trouble that it was worth.
title: This app is not worth the hassle

review:
I‚Äôve loved Calm for years, but the latest update broke the app on my iPad. Now when I go to play a sleep story and close the lid on my iPad, within 10 seconds the story stops playing. Update: They fixed the bug I reported to their support team.
title: Latest update broke my iPad

review: So handy and so helpful. I love the sound of rain and they‚Äôre are many different options for just rain. But not only for rain. review: I was paralyzed due to a autoimmune disorder , and I had to relearn how to walk  again , and that caused a lot of anxiety and depression and I was put on  medication for it ! , I was reluctant to try an app lol but I was desperate for a release from my torment , so I gave it a shot! I promise If you stick with it for a at least a week , you will see the amazing results of meditation!
title: Best decision ever

I specifically enjoy the ‚ÄòDailies‚Äô, the meditations, the music and the sleep stories. I not only play them at night, but sometimes do a quick ‚ÄòDaily Calm‚Äô in the afternoon, which sometimes leads to dropping off to sleep or in the least, a refreshed feeling. I recommend it. Calm is a complimentary subscription through my medical provider.
title: Have used Calm for a few years‚Äîit‚Äôs a help and comfort for insomnia.

review: This app saved my life. Other apps are nice and help a bit but this one is a completely different level. So happy with this! Yes I did have to pay, but it was worth it. From my crippling anxiety, ptsd and insomnia, this is everything. Helped with mindfulness while falling asleep, very effortlessly. Other apps it feels like I have to try harder, but this just lulls you into getting better. This app is the equivalent of a hug and makes me feel like a kid again, being comforted. review: I am extremely lucky that I can take advantage of this FREE 7-Day Premium Trial, offered by Calm from the Apple App Store. title: 5 Stars, over and over again!

For a while, me and my family loved this app. It was great for sleep and stress and there were a lot of options. 
But then Calm decided to what all apps just CANT RESIST.

Now there aren't hardly any options at all. All the sound loops are locked without premium except for one. It gives you about 1 meditation per category and that‚Äôs it. title: It was better
