I‚Äôve updated the app on numerous occasions but it is a consistent issue with only this app and seems to be only with stories and not music, however I only subscribe for the stories. It is very frustrating and working against my sleep at this point.
title: Keeps crashing phone

review: I can‚Äôt praise this app enough. The 10 min Daily Calm is part of my morning routine and sets me up for a better day.  It centers me, grounds me, calms me.  It helps me become more focused throughout my day.  My thoughts are less scattered. Tamara Levitt‚Äôs voice is soothing. The stories and lessons she teaches are life-giving. I‚Äôve had to manage anxiety and depression my entire life.  Incorporating this 10 min routine each morning for the past year, along with other treatments, has been quite healing. Thanks to the entire Calm team.
title: Healing

review: Like other users I used to enjoy this app.  It is used as part of a program for my work place benefits.  We can use the app to get points but now this one, along with Headspace, (these are the only ones that work with my benefits) charge for almost all of the meditations.  The cost of this app compared to the points I get for my insurance make it not worth it to pay for.  I‚Äôm really disappointed as it was nice to use for some quiet calm time and especially for sleep.  Maybe if it was cheaper it would be more worth my while.  ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
title: Used to like it

review: I‚Äôve used this app for a little over a year and love it. Love the sleep stories, check ins, and the meditations. But sadly, I (and a bunch of other people too apparently) can‚Äôt use it anymore because I‚Äôve just been stuck on the take a deep breath screen for weeks now. I thought they would fix it, but I guess not. I would cancel my subscription but it just renewed and I‚Äôve already paid for the year, so if at some point between now and the end of the year the fix it. I will happily revise this review because it is a great app but since I‚Äôve already paid for an entire year I would like to be able to use it.
title: Can‚Äôt use it anymore.

review: Calm has changed my life every single day. If I say it‚Äôs made the world better. . . that is not true. It‚Äôs made me better. I see more. I feel accepting of me and then I feel acceptance of all those around me. I am the recipient of wonder and peace. . . how can I not share with those I meet? With those I care about ? With those I love? Calm has been my daily companion for over two years. I will Not live without my daily blessing ever again.
title: The Gift of Calm

review:
I find trying to maintain streaks in apps stressful and anxiety producing. I meditate to when I can and to help myself, and not meditating one day is not a failure, it‚Äôs just a day I didn‚Äôt meditate.

I was so happy to find Calm had a setting to turn off streaks. I turned it off immediately and enjoyed not being guilt tripped by a relaxation app.

Welp, the latest update launched and immediately prompted me to add a ‚Äúgoal‚Äù of three Calm meditations per week, and added a seven day checklist at the top of the home tab. :( now I can‚Äôt even open the app without it guilting me towards obsess e behavior :(
title: New goals and streaks even when streaks are turned off

review: Has some nice spoken relaxation segments, that are quite well done.  Also a lot of natural sound segments, rain, distant thunder.  My main complaints are:  Not enough spoken content, and of those they are very brief - less than 10 minutes.  Calm is a captive app, you can't download useful content to any other app like iTunes.  So if you find a spoken exercise that really helps you, you have to maintain the Calm app account to listen to it.  There is a lot of sound files that seem to be there as 'filler' as opposed to useful spoken content.  Finally, the price is ridiculously high for what you get.
title: Has some good features ... BUT

review: Despite turning off notifications in general settings and more specifically in app preferences, I‚Äôm bombarded with reminders to turn on notifications every time I open the Calm app on my phone. Hopefully this is a bug in the latest version, and be corrected quickly. It‚Äôs a shame there isn‚Äôt an email for sorting out these issues like some other developers. Instead it‚Äôs necessary to file a complaint and write a negative review. I‚Äôve enjoyed the content and am a Premium subscriber, but will cancel immediately and find another source if this persists.
title: Notifications won‚Äôt turn off

review: I‚Äôve been a user of Calm for a few years now. I first started using the app to help me sleep. The sleep meditations and sleep stories are so helpful after a long stressful day and get me in the mindset for sleep. I now use the app to meditate several days a week. I find that regular meditation helps with my anxious tendencies and helps to keep me grounded. I have a habit of getting caught up in negative thought patterns, but Calm helps me to center myself.
title: Keeps me grounded

review: I truly enjoy the sleep stories and the variety of content as well as narrators. There is one suggestion I have. If it‚Äôs possible to set it up to show what the reader‚Äôs accent is. Sometimes I want to hear a specific accent I‚Äôve heard in here before. Also, is there a way to set the programming so that whatever nature or white sound a person prefers will start when the story ends? I have found that the sudden silence can be jarring.
title: A lovely app

review: I have thoroughly enjoyed using the Calm app every night. I enjoy the sleep stories to help calm my thoughts at night that allow me to drift off to sleep. The recent update has a new look making it easier to scroll through available stories, however they have removed some stories giving us less options to choose from. I really miss some of the stories they‚Äôve removed.
title: Peaceful sleep

review:
Update: tired of sound cutting off when I am reading in other app while enjoying the ambient sounds. Then have to trick the app to turn back on nature sounds by playing a story but advancing to the end just to restart the nature sounds. What a PIA. Not loving this app, over-all.

Stories and nature sounds are helpful, but some of the central meditation guides over-enunciate to a distraction. It‚Äôs just irritating and not relaxing at all. It would be great if they could expand the variety of guides, because there is a certain female guide who is almost the only one they‚Äôve got. Glad I have a special price offer. I would not subscribe at full price.
title: Calm doesn‚Äôt have to be over enunciated

review: I was slow to come around to meditation and spent far more time wishing that I was meditating than actually doing it for several years. Eventually little by little it grow on me thanks to the Calm app. I absolutely love it in the mini features it offers like sleep stories, meditation music, all the dailies, and the master classes. I Particularly enjoy Jeff Warren's dailies and his "how to meditate" class. I also enjoyed the LeBron James class on mental and emotional strength.
title: Life changing

review: I‚Äôve used Calm premium for a few years and and in the last year the layout has been changed into an overly categorized version of the old layout. I think the intention was to give users multiple paths to the same destination but in this attempt Calm has really lost its simplistic charm which made it such a welcoming app to navigate when in an anxious state or prior to sleeping. Other unfortunate issues are a decline in the quality of app content and the continued neglect of customers‚Äô requests for the ability for a playlist/ queue function for the app. Hate seeing developers lose touch with their customer base.
title: Latest layout has led to me using Calm less

review: I have been using this app for a little over a year and absolutely love it. I did purchase the subscription, which is inexpensive for what you get. They are always adding new things. I highly recommend this app because it has helped me learn to meditate, keep my stress levels in check, and settle down in the evening. They even have children sleep stories and meditations. This app is definitely worth getting.
title: Love this App

review: I love this app and it‚Äôs amazing but if I can barley get anything for free on it then forget even getting the app. I keep getting frustrated when I can‚Äôt find anything free. It‚Äôs really ridiculous that on one page there is usually only one free thing. It‚Äôs almost like you are forcing me to buy your premium. Although what I‚Äôve experienced about the app other than the free problem it‚Äôs great and I totally recommend it. It‚Äôs a great way to calm yourself down after a hard day.
title: This app is great but‚Ä¶

review: This is a fantastic app! It‚Äôs very effective for relaxation and will usually put me to sleep within 15 minutes. It has lovely sleep stories and I‚Äôve become addicted to several narrators. Very soothing and calming. It has a large selection of stories and sounds to choose from, but you will find, as I did, that you will quickly pick favorites to listen to every night. Forget the Ambien, go with Calm instead.
title: Wonderful!

review: I recommend this app all the time. After every daily calm, I say ‚ÄúThanks Tamara‚Äù. She does a fantastic job with the daily guided meditations. I like the balance of stillness/silence and guidance. Even as a longtime experienced meditator I find value you in it and so do my children. We all do the 10-minute daily meditation together as a family every evening before we go to bed. There are many other meditations as well, and all of them are fantastic.
title: What a great app

review: The Calm app is harder to navigate than other similar apps, especially when I wake up at night and need a quick sleep story or guided meditation ‚Äî too hard to find‚Ä¶. I also generally prefer male voices for guided meditations, but most on Calm are the same woman‚Äôs voice, which isn‚Äôt always relaxing. Last of all, I‚Äôd prefer the option of looping my favorite sleep stories or sleep meditations over and over, as when they stop, I wake up, but most do not offer that option. I paid for the premium app, but am disappointed in it.
title: OK, not great

review: The app is great and it would be even better if it was free but we know how that goes. I would like to suggest if you guys can add a custom playlist for sleep, meditations, and music. I have hearted my favorite songs and sometimes I would only want to play those without having to go back. So I would suggest adding a playlist option where you can put all your favorite songs and meditation practices in one.üôèüèæ Thank you.
title: SUGGESTIONS üôèüèæ

review: It's a great app with really helpful guided meditations. It's helped me a lot. However, my one issue with it is that almost all the meditations are voices by Tamara Levitt, and while I'm sure she's a wonderful person and does a great job writing the meditations, I honestly cannot stand her voice. It's so nasally. I pretty much only listen to the meditations that she doesn't do, which eliminates a lot of them. If they had a second voice option for every meditation, I'd 100% give the app five stars.
title: Great meditation app, unfortunate voice

review: In theory this app sounds like a great idea. This app was not what I expected nor what I have seen advertised. I have been on the 7 day trial and have been using it before bed to help me sleep. I like that you have the ability to set sleep timers for the soundscapes and meditation, however I tried multiple sounds and most of them stopped within 10 mins on their own (even though I had a timer set for an hour, 1.5 hours). So getting pulled out of relaxation just as you‚Äôre starting to fall asleep is a bit jarring. I definitely won‚Äôt be spending $80 on this app.
title: Not what I expected

review: So, i have been listening and enjoying sleep stories for years but there is one that is completely and totally possesses me for a long time.. It‚Äôs not just the voice of narrator and it he certainly not his looks lol.. but the story itself. Today, i am in Paris and it‚Äôs raining.. and i never thought i would enjoy as much as i do today, the day as it goes now.. Thank you for emotions it evoke and for the memories associated with your story.
title: A rainy day in Paris

review: I love this app. I‚Äôve been using (subscription version) every night for the past two years. I almost always listen to a sleep story because my mind tends to race with all kinds of thoughts. The stories calm my mind by giving it something to focus on. Erik Braa and Alan Sklar are my favorite narrators by the others are great too. I also like the soundscapes and some of the music, like the piano covers of current and 90s pop songs.
title: Calms my mind

review: I‚Äôve always been a skeptic of so-called ‚Äúwellness apps‚Äù but the way Calm is built, it feels like more of a personal service than people trying to tell me how to live my life. Now, I always drift asleep listening to words that either give me a new perspective on the world of soothing tales that entrance me into a comfy slumber (if you‚Äôre new I recommend Camilla Cabello‚Äôs ‚ÄúBreath Into It‚Äù). Thank you so much for cultivating comfort and bliss with this truly wonderful app!
title: This app is incredible!

review: Try it‚Ä¶I have lived in 7 different countries, 5 different states and been in 3 different war/hot zones. When I am asked how my day is going‚Ä¶my usual response is, ‚ÄúAny day I am not getting shot at and nothing blows up is always a good day.‚Äù It is all about perspective. The CALM APP is something that CAN DEFINITELY HELP to provide meaningful perspective and redirect our focus to a wonderful reminder to RECONNECT with our better selves. Mahalo (Retired MSgt, USAF)
title: Everything has a beginning‚Ä¶ Even gratitudeüôÉ

review: I‚Äôve used this calm app for a couple of years now and I‚Äôve loved it . I am very autistic and this app helps me a lot to not get that upset . I would definitely recommend it because it‚Äôs not just for calming you down there are sleep story‚Äôs for little ones and big . I think that if you were searching for something to calm you down or help you go to sleep you found the right place !
title: Best way to calm down

review: I thoroughly enjoy the sleep stories. It‚Äôs funny because they must be designed such that they do make us fall asleep, maybe the cadence or maybe I‚Äôm already very tired, so I fall asleep anyway, but I seldomly finish a sleep story. One day I will have to start them in the middle so I can hear how they end. I enjoy the soundscapes and the daily meditations as well. I wish it was slightly less expensive but I do appreciate this app.  ‚ù§Ô∏è
title: fall asleep easily

review: Calm‚Äôs daily meditations with Jeff Warren have been such a grounding force in my life. They‚Äôve reminded me of perspectives that I hold in moments that I‚Äôve greatly benefited from remembering. They‚Äôve inspired changes in my perspectives in ways that have caused me to feel more open, free, and connected with those around me. Equanimity, letting go, being real‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs all gold. Thank you to Jeff, and the team at Calm. I appreciate what you do from the bottom of my heart.
title: Grounding and life-altering

review:
The goal of this App is to gain CALM. After TEN FAILED attempts to get the app to open and continue playing, I am beyond frustrated and not the LEAST BIT CALM!!! I open the App, it tries to boot up but then disappears and the screen reverts to its original. Night after night I have this issue. I‚Äôve just downloaded a white noise app that will hopefully work far better and more reliably than this hideous operation. I need a new app to become ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù after dealing with this calamitous excuse of an app. How ironic. I‚Äôve wasted almost half an hour dealing with it..
Update, 2 years later:
It now opens and plays, thanks to a paid subscription.
Tamara Levitt‚Äôs voice puts me to sleep within minutes, which is a great thing.
HOWEVER: I should have been careful what I wished for in turns of being able to access the various soundscapes.
I don‚Äôt know if this is an IOS problem or an App problem, but I CANNOT get the background soundscape to turn OFF!!
This severely depletes battery life and is generally annoying.
title: Terrible bugs

review: Mostly very happy. Consistently, though, I will start a track, and the time bar indicates the track is progressing, but no audio comes out. This happens both on my iPhone 12 Pro and my wife‚Äôs iPhone SE. it also happened on my iPhone 8. It also happens when connecting phone to an external Wonderboom speaker. I‚Äôve experienced this for years and can only troubleshoot by trying various combinations of restarting the app, phone, Bluetooth, etc. Please fix this bug!
title: Love it. One issue

review: Today marks 6 months of daily meditation with Calm. Had the app for two years and unequivocally recommend it. It‚Äôs an endless journey but the guided meditations by Tara, Jeff and Jay have made so much of a difference in my perceptions of acceptance, openness, and purpose. That, of course, improves attitude and leads to peace. Also listen to Calm music and the back-to-sleep offerings regularly. Nothing better out there and it‚Äôs 1000x better than therapy, medication, drugs, alcohol, denial or avoidance.
title: Life changer

review: When I first downloaded this app I did not use it for several months. A friend told me about at a retreat I was at. When I finally started to use it I was annoyed I had waited so long. I use it daily, sometimes for meditation and other times for help in falling asleep. I have my favorites and I‚Äôve sent them to friends as well. My favorites are the sleep stories!  They are amazing!  Thank you for making this app my favorite!ü•∞
title: Best app ever

review: I have had trouble sleeping for years and one day I came across your app through my health provider. The bedtime stories and meditations have helped me immensely. The daily check-ins on how I‚Äôm feeling are therapeutic and help me really reflect on what emotion I‚Äôm having and why. I just want to say thank you to all of you who contribute to making this app amazing and helping people like me. I appreciate every single one of you. Thanks again!
title: Thank you!

review: I love how I can end the day with calm. I just love how relaxing it makes me feel and helps me cope with stress and help me wind down for bed. Calm helps me with a daily move every day and with an endless catalog of sleep stories for adults and kids. And if you are not In to sleep stories there is also an endless catalog of sound scapes, which are one of my favorites. I totally recommend getting this app if already don‚Äôt have it.
title: Over all just great

review: I‚Äôve never recommended an app as much as I recommend Calm. My delivery nurse told me about it while I was in labor and since then I‚Äôve been using it every day! I appreciate the lovely, organized, easy to use interface and the endless variety of mediations, wisdom, and sleep aid. There‚Äôs so much to it that I feel as though I‚Äôve barely used any of what it has to offer. Thank you for such a diverse self help tool! ‚úåÔ∏èü•∞
title: Most useful app on my phone!

review: I really enjoy calm and the guided meditations and the new options they have daily. I enjoy trying the daily trip or the daily calm based on which one seems to suit where I am in my life that day or what I think I need. I know there are a lot more features that I am interesting in trying out and overall it has taught me very important and interesting lessons and I look forward to using it daily more.
title: Really great mediation app

review: Calm has become one of my favorite rituals in my life. It allows my heart to reconnect and to disconnect all at the same time. I notice the days I forget to do my meditation how much more anxious and distracted I am. Tamara and all the other teachers on this program, THANK YOU. For always putting your best so that others can follow your lead. This app has helped me heal and to grow! I have always loved meditation but this has taken it to a new level üíï
title: Calm to Any Storm

review:
I have never payed for this app and my favorite song used to be free sobre la oratoria but I recently got a new phone and forgot about the app for a while and was in the mood to hear it I can‚Äôt listen to it anymore that‚Äôs unfair and don‚Äôt tell me you had to get paid because it was free before and they could‚Äôve made other songs the ones you have to pay for I really liked that song and am very disappointed
Edit: this was a draft I made like a year ago still pretty angry but I‚Äôll get over it(since sobre la oratoria is on Apple Music ) but I still had a bunch of songs I can‚Äôt remember the name to that I used to love^
title: They don‚Äôt let me listen to my songs anymore

review: During the beginning of the pandemic I developed a return of anxiety and panic that I had struggled with a long while ago.   I started making time for meditations and listened to soundscapes at night and enjoyed the music as I walked outdoors.  It has truly saved me from so much that was taking away from my joy in life.  Iam grateful and I realized that more calm and focus on myself was what I needed.  I hope it helps you as well.  Grateful for this app.
title: Saved by Calm

review: I like a lot of things about this app. I had it before but canceled after a year due to Tamara Levitt‚Äôs awful voice and the irritating way she says ‚Äúbrath‚Äù instead of ‚Äúbreath‚Äù among other speech oddities. Well, I forgot about that and recently resubscribed. I was hoping she‚Äôd be gone, but nope. She‚Äôs still there and still irritating. So I just avoid the stuff she‚Äôs in and do everything else. Kind of a drag since she‚Äôs in so much of it. I‚Äôll probably get Headspace next time instead. Hopefully she doesn‚Äôt work for them too. Lol
title: Great, except for Tamara Levitt‚Äôs voice

review: So I thought I‚Äôd give this a try. Not a single item that I could find was available without paying a $70 premium unlock fee. I‚Äôm sorry but this seems a little steep for sounds that I have seen on many other sites and apps for free. Further, if you truly do want to attract users, give them an opportunity to use the app without requiring them to sign up for the $70 service first. That is so sketchy! It guarantees you get your money if they forget to cancel before the 7 days- and does nothing for the user. You‚Äôre ultimately looking out for your profit only, not the well-being of the user. Such a shame to see apps that do things like this. SMH.
title: $70 calming app?

review: I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôve ever written a review for an app before but it‚Äôs been a year since I downloaded Calm and it‚Äôs legitimately changed my life! Like a lot of people, I was in a pretty bad head space during quarantine 2020, decided to give meditation and this app a chance and between the daily Calms, the specific topic meditations, and the calming music options, I use this app every single day! Well worth the price if you can afford it!
title: Saved my life

review: Calm is honestly amazing and has helped me through many hard days.  The daily meditations are always great and only 10-12 minutes so you can fit them into your day, and there are cool journaling exercises and a mood check-in so you can do some self-reflection after the meditation.  Highly recommend to anyone who suffers from anxiety, depression, or just wants to get more into meditation at a beginner level.
title: My favorite meditation app

review:
I love this app, it is such an incredible tool anytime I feel anxious, stressed, or overwhelmed. 
 PLEASE include a Daily Calm & Daily Trips tab under the meditations to have access to all of the daily calms. I think recently the creators included the recent daily calms but they go away and refresh after a little while which is awesome, but I would love to have access to the abundance of Daily Calms and Daily Trips! I love Jeff Warren so an abundance of Daily Trips would be so cool
title: Love this app

review: This app is amazingly useful. I read about it and always wanted to try but the price was holding me back! I tried the free trial version and enjoyed it fully. Great help for beginners. There are stories, different meditation modes etc. that helps you calm. I finally purchased it as promo from one of my credit card and I am loving it. I started using when I needed extremely. As I used it I realized this must be use on daily basis. Anyone who wants to calm and meditate must try this.
title: Must have.

review: The music, stories and meditations on this app are great. But it‚Äôs missing one huge feature IMO and that‚Äôs a sound fade with the timer. If you‚Äôre trying to gently doze off to sleep the sudden cutting off of music or a story is jarring. Ever woken someone up by turning off the tv who had fallen asleep watching? Yea same. The timer is helpful but I either turn it off myself before I fall asleep or it wakes me up when the timer is up. I‚Äôve gone back to my old free app for white noise.
title: It‚Äôs missing one big thing

review: My boss purchased a subscription for everyone last year. It has been the best single gift. I manage logistic coordination and the stress can be intense. It‚Äôs perfect to listen to all day while working to focus or calm down as needed and then helps me to get to sleep at night. I probably couldn‚Äôt have made it through this year without it. I highly recommend it as a corporate gift for employees, coworkers, and for yourself.
title: Best corporate gift

review: I absolutely love the parts of the app that I can use with voiceover on my iPhone. I have vision and hearing loss and benefit greatly from the offerings in calm. Sadly, some sections cannot be accessed at all using voiceover and with low vision, the color themes make it difficult or impossible to read the text, depending on which screen I am trying to discern. I really want to recommend this app to all my friends in the vision loss community. but they won‚Äôt be able to use it either until Accessibility is fixed
title: Serious accessibility issues

review:
I did the free subscription whihc forces you to enter CC info. I attempted and thought i had canceled it before i should have been charged. When inrealized i had been charged, i canceled it again‚Ä¶

I ended up paying for 2 years of this app, which, i never used because my first experience using it was so frustrating. The guy leads a ‚Äòmeditation‚Äô visualization and asks questions; it does not respond intuitively, the guidance is very specific and not useful. 
Unfortunately I heard about this app on Huberman Lab podcast when the founder (another stanford professor) was a guest.
Very frustrating to be tricked out of $180 and got nothing but annoyance from this app.
title: Frustrating

review: I have been using this app for years now and it never fails to make me fall asleep. I highly recommend this app for anyone who has ever had trouble falling asleep. Along with sleep Stories of various lengths, this app has daily meditations called Daily Calms, sleep check ins nightly, ( if chosen), calming music and lullabies for anyone from babies to adults, and while this app is not free, I think that this app was TOTALLY worth paying for. - anonymous calm userw
title: Why I love the Calm app

review: My husband (he doesn‚Äôt know it really helps him get a deep sleep because i turn on sleep stories about 5 minutes after he‚Äôs snoozing, ha)! My 9 year old son uses it every night, it‚Äôs truly the o my way to calm him down and drift off to sleep! Thank you! Can you add more stories about being kind & respect everyone? It‚Äôs really helped my son. Oh, and can you get Luke Combs as a celebrity sleep story teller?! Ha! Oh, Donnie Wahlberg too :)
title: My whole family uses this app!

review: The variety and value of each practice and session really make this my go-to app for mental self-care. I wish there were more guided meditation sessions in the 5-6-minute range, and/or shorter, practice-only follow-up / maintenance sessions without as much explanation, in the themed meditation series. For example, I‚Äôd love shorter sessions from Lama Rod, Elisha Goldstein, or Tara Brach that are like quick reminder or check-in sessions touching on the practices and focus of their existing series.
title: Excellent resource

review: This app is amazing, but I have anxiety and it kinda gets in the way of my sport. I started an anxiety calming course. After the first lesson I noticed that the next lesson was only for if I subscribed. And I don‚Äôt want to pay for something I can‚Äôt help. I think that is just really stupid that someone has to pay to get help relieving their mental health. And even if you guys lower down the price I‚Äôm still not going to pay the fee. Yes this is a great app, only if you want to pay for it to be a great app.
title: Amazing! But‚Ä¶..

review:
Calm - is absolutely a God send. I recommend it to anyone who needs to find peace in their crazy world. I found the people‚Äôs voices very soothing and calming. The nature sounds are important . There is also a ton to learn about meditation and mindfulness all of these things we are not taught until we seek them ourselves. 
Taking time everyday is important to get the best benefit of calm. I will be back tomorrow ! Peace be with you all who use everyday to CREATE. 
-jessy üòÄ
title: The most Tired Mom

review:
I‚Äôve been using this app for about 1 1/2 years and it is wonderful!  The app is easy to navigate.  The choices of 30 minute mini audiobooks, loop-able soundscapes, and music selections cover a wide variety of genres.

The only improvement that I could ask for would be to add the ability to make a ‚Äúsleep play list.‚Äù  Playing 3 or more sleep stories back-to-back would help me get into a deep sleep quicker.
title: Love It!!!

review:
I really like this app, it‚Äôs well laid out and easy to use. I‚Äôd like some new ASMR sleep stories, but otherwise I‚Äôd had alot of content to try. I generally use it to help fall asleep and love the sound scape and stories!

I don‚Äôt like that it doesn‚Äôt work with Family Sharing. My daughter could really us it to help with sleep as well, but hate to spend $50/yr each. Adding a family member for $10 would likely get more income that making it an additional $50. 

Keep updating! Love the app!
title: Very helpful

review: For some people it takes more than 30 mins to fall asleep. Longer stories please and a function where you can set another story to start automatically one the first story is over. Otherwise you have to unlock your phone and click on another story which wakes you up and defeats the purpose. So please add an auto start feature where you can start another story of you aren‚Äôt asleep yet.
title: Needs auto start to play stories back to back

review: I‚Äôve used and subscribed to Calm for about 6 years and have used it to help with my anxiety and as a part of my daily sleep routine. Since the newest update I have been stuck on the take a deep breath page and am unable to get onto the app (over 2 weeks and counting). I would love to revise my review because I love this app more than anything but it is frustrating paying for an app you use everyday but can‚Äôt even get into.
title: Newest update is a fail

review:
This is my third year with a premium subscription to ‚Äúcalm‚Äù. I have really enjoyed it and recommended it over and over again. 
Lately, and when I say lately I mean for at least a month, it has been opening at completely random times. I can be talking on the phone and the Wizard of Oz pops up. I can have my phone sitting on the console with a podcast on and all of a sudden  Calm is playing.
I have deleted the app and reinstalled it. That does nothing. Just now on the phone with a client a meditation began. 

I‚Äôm not sure what‚Äôs happening but it‚Äôs not pretty! Ready to go to the social media route and shout to the masses!
title: App randomly opens with no prompting

review:
Two and a half years ago I started listening to calm after the death of my parents during the pandemic. They passed two months apart and had been married for almost 70 years. They were my rock! Calm saved me! Then my husband and I both got cancer this past year and again i turned to Calm. I‚Äôve shared my story with so many, and will continue to share the power of Calm. 
Thank you!
title: How Calm got me through

Sometimes a free story would lock within the same browsing session!
title: Free version used to be way better

I really didn‚Äôt think this app would remotely help me in anyway‚Ä¶. I‚Äôm so glad I was wrong a million times over!!! This app genuinely helps me stay sane! My sleep has improved by 3 hours! I‚Äôm sleeping harder now too! When I start spiraling, this is my go-to! Calm App has helped me calm my mental storm.

review: At first, I didn‚Äôt use this app for much, only when I was hallucinating, which happens like once every 5-6 months. title: Lebron is the GOAT

review: My daughter told me that in Sienna the Sleepy Sloth, that they say it‚Äôs the afternoon, but the sloth and jaguar say good morning to each other. She‚Äôs the type that catches details like that.I think it‚Äôs weird that animals talk at all, but stuff like that I don‚Äôt care about. But saying it‚Äôs the afternoon then saying good morning to each other really bothers me and I think someone should fix that. I listened to it, and it wasn‚Äôt just my daughter. I heard it too.
title: Good but something.

review: I love this app so much because it helps me go to sleep every night so then I can actually get some rest and not just be flopping around in my bed for hours and it‚Äôs just such an amazing app because it really calm you down or boost you up whatever you need. It‚Äôs such an amazing app and I really hope that they keep coming out with brand new stories so we can have more to listen to. Thank you calm so much.
title: I love this app

review:
Meditation is my ritual. Every day except Sunday for church at 10:00. The alarm goes off or Even before I say Meditation and my dog heads for the bedroom. I guess he meditates
or goes to sleep. After I meditate I think about it for a moment and then text my daughter about it.  It‚Äôs usually in my words from Tamara‚Äôs lessons and I call it a relaxation moment for her. And she knows Mom is on schedule and okay. But it‚Äôs also good for her. It‚Äôs wonderful for me. Thank you!
title: Meditation

review:
This app is such a gift. It has been instrumental in my development of being more present, finding emotional stability, and gaining wisdom and centering on truth. 

I love Tamara‚Äôs morning meditation and also Jay‚Äôs wisdom meditations.  The music for sleep in the kids section has been helpful for bedtime for my 4 year old to fall asleep to in her season of being scared at night. 

I especially enjoy the mood check ins. Having a journal space to write out how I am feeling and who before and after the meditation is a huge support for my emotional well-being. 

One recommendation I have for the developers: please add more emotions to the, ‚Äúhow are you feeling‚Äù check-in. I‚Äôm frequently thinking, ‚ÄúI need more dynamic words to express my emotions‚Äù in the check in. 
Thank you!!
title: Worth every penny

review:
My wife got the app to help us put our kids to bed at night and I found the piano Disney songs very relaxing. To the point it was putting me to sleep. Then I got the app for myself and I use it every night to relax my brain and allow myself to fall asleep. Just trying the breathing exercises now and those seem to be ok. The meditations I haven‚Äôt explored yet but look forward to it.

I‚Äôd recommend this
title: Yep, I‚Äôm Digging It. Really helps with sleep

review: I‚Äôm 17 with bad anxiety and insomnia, when I found this app through instagram and then saw the amazing reviews I got really excited. Now as is the case for many; I was quite skeptical on the whole ‚Äútelling stories‚Äù concept. And I still am. The free background sounds that are given are quite nice, and you can use them with your phone off. But I would recommend adding a few stories for free so we know what we are going to pay 60$ a year for, so I will be able to have the confidence to invest in this app.
title: Disappointed :(

review: I got the app because I‚Äôve been seeing a lot of tv ads and ads on my phone so I said ‚Äúwhy not try it?‚Äù. I understand that the people behind the app want to gain money for their work but come on.. the majority of things are locked unless you have a subscription. I will not be getting a subscription because I‚Äôm just a teenage girl wanting to have more comfort within herself without having to pay so much of a price. So as you can see I got the app but I don‚Äôt really know if I will want to continue to scroll and look for things that might work for me but idk‚Ä¶ :/
title: What can I even do..?

review: I surfer from very bad anxiety. To the point that my arms and legs go numb and chest pain. Headaches.  Sometimes even feel lie fainting. This application has definitely help and I see improvement in my attitude with the meditation and sleep sound effects. Like ( rain, snow, forest, ocean, etc.) I would recommend anyone to try this out even if its not because of anxiety, but simply to re-focus and relax your mind and body!. Definitely worth the money.
title: So helpful

review: Calm is like one of the best things that help me calm down I could never doubt calm it helps me with depression and sadness it helps me with so much there is nothing bad I can say bad about this app you need to show calm some love tell family friends this is the most calming apps in the world I mean if your upset or need to calm down or need help going to sleep or really anything‚Äôs that it well calming get on this app I love this app 5 star most definitely
title: ‚ù§Ô∏è

review: I‚Äôve been using Calm for the two years since the unexpected death of my husband. It was the only thing that helped me return to a healthy sleeping pattern during the stress of losing him, being isolated by the pandemic and having to shutter my business for months. I continue to find new readers, stories and music that ease me to sleep, help me to sleep more deeply or return to sleep if I wake in the night. Calm has been a life saver for me.
title: Peaceful sleep

review: I was severely depressed at my age 13. I have done something very bad a year ago, I have cryed almost every day of my life because of all the anxiety and guilt building up. I had suicidal thoughts even. Then I downloaded this app, and I got better in time. I learned to live in the present and focus on surroundings and what is happening in my present time. Without this app I would be dead. Thank you so much creators of calm
title: This really changed my life,

review:
Falling asleep is the hardest part for me, much of the day is going through my mind.  When I listen to a sleep story, I don‚Äôt think of anything else. I always fall asleep without reaching the end, but that‚Äôs a good thing. I am biased though, my personal choice are the stories told by men but there are many narrators to choose from, lady‚Äôs and men, and they are all excellent.  I got a life time membership, it‚Äôs a wonderful way to fall asleep.   

Maria
title: Sleeping Peacefully

review:
I‚Äôve had this app for a little over two years, and the yearly subscription you pay for this app is definitely worth it! They have sleep music, for all kinds, sleep meditation, and all sorts of different kinds of sub categories you can chose from for your guided meditations. 

I never meditated before this app, but this is a really good starter app if you‚Äôve never meditated before, it was really easy for me to start this up. Wonderful app, and love the way it‚Äôs laid out!
title: Amazing

review: First let me say that I love, love , love this app.  I have had problems sleeping and this app is awesome.  It puts me to sleep quickly.  HOWEVER, the recent constant crashing and restarting of the app is starting to just plain aggravate me before I go sleep. It will crash on me 4 or 5 times a night. This started recently. Any ideas on how to fix? I have deleted the app and downloaded it again. Still having same problems. I love this app and I am seriously bummed that I pay for it and it is not working correctly.
title: App issues

review: Stress has been a big thing since last year, and thankfully I was able to get the free subscription through Kaiser. It is so so worth it. I was definitely starting to let myself fall into a bit of a depressed state, but this is such a wonderful app to take mental breaks, and even share with loved ones since socializing is so important! The check-ins, the music, meditations, stories, the sounds, everything about it... it‚Äôs great.
title: BEST APP TO GET THROUGH THE COVID-19 blues

review: I‚Äôve been struggling with falling asleep for several weeks after the death of a loved one.  I missed him most when I went to bed at night so it was very difficult for me to stop reminiscing about him. Last night I listened to a sleep story by Harry Styles. I do not know how the story ended because I went to sleep before it ended.  This alone is very much worth the cost of the subscription to me. Thank you!
title: Sleep Story

review: The sleep story‚Äôs are amazing and so good they have helped me fall asleep even on the hardest nights. I love the check in, I do them almost everyday. But my one complaint is that you can open any of them in the app except for the mood check in you need to open it through a notification. Also there is this weird glitch we‚Äôre if like merges all the words together and makes them almost impossible to read. But other than that AMAZING APP HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
title: MUST READ!!!! AMAZING BUT‚Ä¶.

review: I was pretty skeptical about using an app for relaxing or meditation. While on a business trip my sister insisted I try out the Daily Trip and sleep stories and now I‚Äôm sold. So many new meditations and music daily and even a great movement video series. Endless quality content! So clich√© to say but truly something amazing for everyone can be found in Calm.
title: Endless quality content & a great way to take a moment for yourself

review: Great app - lots of different guided meditation sessions and stories/music to fall asleep to. The ‚ÄúDaily Calm‚Äù section is new everyday and is excellent. They also have a yoga section! Unfortunately it is entirely too expensive. That‚Äôs the only reason it went from 5 stars to 3 for me. It was $60 a year before, I just cancelled my subscription because they raised the price to $70 a year. I would recommend to the company that they reduce the cost of the subscription, not raise it. You will likely get a lot of cancellations because of the price raise.
title: Too expensive!

review: Please don‚Äôt ever discontinue this story. It brings me so much peace. Southern California holds a very special place in my heart. It‚Äôs my happy place, a place I can‚Äôt get to very often outside of my own memories. Maybe you could consider a sleep story about Griffith Observatory or the iconic Safari Inn in Burbank? These places are near and dear to me. A sleep story describing them as I drift off to sleep would bring so much peace, just like the Joshua Tree story. Thank you.
title: Joshua Tree sleep story

review:
If you need guided meditations to quiet your inner thoughts they got you!
If you need calming music or white noise they have that too!
If you simply want to revert to your childlike state for a half hour, they supply you with bed time stories!
Or if you simply want to listen to a peaceful voice teach you grounding techniques the App is there to meet you! 
Try it and you‚Äôll find satisfaction in either one category of your life or multiple!
title: The Calm App is the BEST

review: I have enjoyed the general meditation practices, the soundscapes, breathing exercises, and implementing theses into my daily living. however i was really disappointed by advice given in the 2 recent Daily Calms for this past week. it felt judgemental towards those struggling with addiction with some words like describing a relapse as the worst when a common idea among addicts is that relapse is part of recovery, unhelpful language like 'going on a bender', and unhelpful tips about coping skills. i was really saddened by this, it totally took me out and i lost my 34 day streak bc i didn't even want to go back

review:
I love the app and it had help me so much to learn to meditate and keep track of my emotion day by day. However, with the new update, the daily check-in font is too small. I used to be bigger, it made it easy for me to read and even share the quotes and questions.

Developers: please consider giving users the option to increase the font of the daily check-in tab.
title: Check in daily calm reflection

Even though I‚Äôve just started again, I‚Äôm hoping the other fantastic opportunities will help me build my sleep hours up. Thank You  CALM üåª

title: Great app

            Randy Paggi

I use Calm on a daily/nightly basis, when visiting my grandkids we‚Äôve fallen to sleep to kids sleep stories and they love it. If you have trouble turning your thoughts off at night try this APP.

review:
I absolutely love Calm. I actually don‚Äôt know what I would do without it.  It really helps me at night when I go to bed. title: Calm App

review: I‚Äôd love it if you‚Äôd provide an option to have a white noise/fan sound underlay to any of your other audio. When I am trying to use a meditation in a noisier area (airport/plane, park, etc) I can often get distracted by exterior noises that come in through my noise canceling headphones. The option to layer a constant ambient noise under the chosen audio would alleviate this problem and make your app MUCH more useful. Would definitely be a 5* app if it could be used in more situations (especially stressful ones). Thanks!

review: From the time I started listening to Tamara Levitt on a daily basis for over a year until now, some 3 years later, I always find what I need on this app. There are so many wonderful sleep stories that have lulled me to sleep and left me dreaming of wonderful places in the world that I‚Äôll never go to but feel like I have. title: Always what I need

review:
I was checking out Calm because it said you can cancel at anytime!   All of a sudden i found myself locked in to $69. I panicked but then it said you can cancel anytime. I thought, ‚Äú thats ok, I can do it for a month!‚Äù You can cancel but you don't get your $69 back. You can use it for a year, it just won‚Äôt renew at the end of the year. 
Now it wants my password but since I didn‚Äôt sign up for it really, and didn‚Äôt put in a password, it won‚Äôt let me in. Everytime i tried to do something it asked for a password and since I didnt have one, i was anything but Calm. I will try to get my money back through my bank.
title: Frustrated

review:
I thank the makers of this App everyday and recommend it to my patients dealing with insomnia stress and aggravation. Thank you üôèüèªüôèüèª

title: Favorite app ever

I get that people need to make money and not everything can be free. I looked on the internet to find out if there are any meditation apps that are completely free. Calm showed up and I decided to give it another try. 
I have used the calm app in the past (years ago) then deleted it because more and more stuff within the app became locked unless you bought the premium version. I downloaded it again to see if anything changed and literally almost everything is locked and requires you to pay.

Oh wait, literally everything on here is locked and requires the premium membership. 2 sleep stories are free, absolutely none of the music is free, and you can do a few of the mediations. Everything else is locked. Another reviewer said they went online to see what was free and there‚Äôs ‚Äútons of content,‚Äù but I haven‚Äôt found any available. title: Premium membership required

review: I was never big into meditation but new I would benefit from it given my anxiety, stress, etc. I downloaded calm and have not looked back since. After week 1, I bought the premium version and am blown away by the amount of content on the app. There is truly something for everyone! Whether you‚Äôre new to meditating or experienced, you can‚Äôt go wrong!!
title: favorite part of my morning routine

review: I‚Äôve been using the AP over a year now. It has robust selection from Sleep Stories for adults and children, great if you like to be read to, meditations led by world renowned teachers such as Jeff Warren, Tamara Levitt, and Jay Shetty, moving meditations, and Dharma talks. It helps you track your meditations and streaks and encourages you to log your sleep hours, gratitude, and checks in with you to see how you are feeling. I love it!
title: Easy way to get consistent

review: I‚Äôve had this app for years‚Ä¶. However many it‚Äôs been around, I think. I haven‚Äôt used it for quite some time (a year or more) and then just randomly opened it today for my morning practice. WOW.  Just WOW.  There‚Äôs so much new content to explore and so much of what I‚Äôm looking for‚Äî walking meditations, ambient sound tracks, focused music ‚Ä¶ and now a couple of MASTERCLASSES??? Seriously?? Hi, Calm, my new best friend!  Let‚Äôs get out there and have a great day!
title: Wow!

review:
I don‚Äôt get it, I open the app and the only thing it says is ‚Äútake a deep breathe.‚Äù Which is fine, and helpful at first, but it says it for 20 minutes and the screen never changes. It doesn‚Äôt even introduce me to the app or what I will get if I do subscribe. There are no meditations, no sounds, no nothing except a blue screen with one sentence! I was so hopeful because the reviews are great, but I don‚Äôt understand how something I could tell myself in one sentence is worth an entire app.
Also if anyone has recommendations for apps that say more than to breathe, please let me know because I do have anxiety and could really use it.
title: What‚Äôs the hype about one sentence?

review: I‚Äôve been using the free version of this app off and on for a year or so. I received an ad on social media trying to persuade me into paying for the premium version‚Ä¶ and I‚Äôm so glad it did! I particularly like the ‚Äúkids‚Äù section. For the last 3 weeks my 5 year old has been drifting off to sleep with ease. If you have little ones‚Ä¶. Check out the bedtime stories narrated by the singer Pink. She‚Äôs amazing! ‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Amazing app

review: I love this app, especially the sleep sounds, but some of the statements made during the guided meditation are pretty weird and distressing. For example, awkwardness and shyness aren‚Äôt signs of low self esteem. They don‚Äôt project confidence but you can totally be awkward because you have intellectual differences or anxiety and also have high self esteem. There have been a few other moments like that, and it‚Äôs not a nice thing for folks who might have those differences to encounter.
title: Love but some weird ableist statements

review: I enjoyed the Calm app immensely when it featured in-depth masterclasses. Those are gone and we‚Äôre left with lightweight dailies‚Äîthe only really decent one is Jeff Warrens. Another negative is the Daily Shetty. Jay Shetty is  a notorious charlatan and plagiarizer with an annoying and patronizing speaking voice.. There‚Äôs not even an ignore option for shows one doesn‚Äôt want‚Ä¶ The stories are generally good, but the music is new age and ambient sounds‚Äînot really music at all‚Ä¶ I give it three stars because there is some useful material, however, most of it is archival.
title: Was good, going downhill

review: I have found that I do not use this app EVER. I can see where many people would use it with a full and happy heart however, that does not apply to me. I was not aware of having subscribed but it happened just the same. Now I have received notice that my subscription is renewing and that is absolutely the last thing I want to have happen. I‚Äôm having a hard time learning how to make my wishes known. I am disabled and feel some level of bad most of the time, so the frustration of dealing with this makes me feel worse. If you enjoy this app, more power to you. Unfortunately, it is not for me.
title: Just CANCEL my subscription!

review: I have had problems sleeping for a long time but this app solved them! I love listening to the stories as o fall asleep especially because they auto shut off after it is done! I highly recommend!! I also use this app for meditation, and I find it extremely useful. I didn‚Äôt even buy the subscription, and it was great. I can only imagine how awesome would be if I got the subscription.
title: Love this app!

review:
This app has very useful guided meditations and soundscapes for getting to sleep, getting *back* to sleep, naps, and just relaxing in general. I do recommend.

If you want to sample the full paid content in the app there *is* a way to get a 1-month subscription to try it out (rather than jumping into a 1-year subscription), although it‚Äôs not publicized. Search the internet for more info.
title: Quality content

review: Love it‚Ä¶ the only criticism I have is that it would be nice to have more bedtime stories that are actual stories.  Somehow listening to a narrative about someone walking down a path or a story that goes on about nothing is more frustrating and annoying than calming- at least that‚Äôs my opinion.  I will say Calm has way more actual stories than Headspace, which is why I use Calm- just wish there were more new ones.
title: Awesome! ‚Ä¶but more actual stories please

review:
My life has been a real struggle for me for the past 2 years. The past 8 months have been horrible. Had it not been for this site I‚Äôm not sure I would be here. Thank you for all the wonderful work that you do.
You truly are saving lives. Between Calm and therapy I can stay focused and know that there really is more out there!

Thank You Truly you will never know what you have done!
title: Pursuit for Peace

review:
I love the premium version of this app. It is absolutely worth it. The design is gorgeous and comforting, I truly feel at ease after listening to the water background style that I chose.

My only critique is that Mel's Movement Moments need to be longer. 4-7 minutes is not enough time to connect deeply with your body if you are seeking guided movement. I use movement for meditation primarily and would love to see longer options, even 1 or 2 sessions!
title: Need longer movement options

review: This app helps me sleep, focus, and enjoy living. Good non-medicated sleep is priceless. The sleep stories are great for this but I also find that some of the meditations help too. The vast selection of meditative music is wonderful for driving, studying, cycling and doing things around the house. Since I have a paid subscription I can download them to my phone, which is great. I can't recommend this app enough.
title: As good as apps get

review: I really love Calm‚Äôs diverse content - something for every need. I fall asleep to Calm every night. However, there‚Äôs one thing I really dislike, and it has just become a thing in the last couple months: the Daily Calm auto plays every time I open the app, and it doesn‚Äôt appear that I have an option to change this. It‚Äôs really irritating. I get trying to help people develop a meditation routine, but not everyone has the same needs.
title: Mostly great

review: The calm app really helps me with my softball because I get emotional very easily. There is a podcast with LeBron James and I like to listen to that one. The only problem I had was when I first got it I tried it out, but there was only a few things that I could do without a subscription. I recommend getting the subscription, because it really unlocks a lot of things. Hope this helps! üòò
title: I love the Clam app

review: I originally wrote a review last year. In that review, I wrote about how wonderful the iPhone app was and how I wished the Apple TV app was as good. At that time it didn‚Äôt have much content. Since my last review, they have really done a wonderful job of adding new content to the Apple TV app. It appears they read reviews and respond. Thank you! One request‚Ä¶ I listened to the, ‚ÄúDeep Rest‚Äù sleep meditation by Oren Jay Sofer every night for months. It‚Äôs been removed from the Apple TV app. Please add it back.
title: New Review

review:
I love, love, love this app! It has changed my sleep for the better. I love the narrators. I enjoy the new playlist by some of the narrators. I often need more than one story to get me to sleep. I have to choose another story. Having continuous stories works really well for me. 
What I would love, is to have ability to make my own list of stories to run continuously.
That would be awesome!
Keep up the great work!
title: Love the app! But‚Ä¶

review: I love the app so Much but all of the children's sleep story‚Äôs are way to Boring and they don‚Äôt even have a plot I know they are supposed to be boring but there to boring. But what I love is that some sleep stories have there own melody like my favorite one witch is turtle dreams it‚Äôs sleep story made me fall asleep at the discovering the ocean for the first time so now i don‚Äôt even know how it ends! P.S. I think this app might be a medication for sleep apnea, ODD, ADHD, and OCD
title: Great app

review: I have been dealing with extreme anxiety for a year and have been able to stay off meds by simply using this wonderful app. Even if there may be some huge simultaneous events requiring me to use medication, I find the soothing music during the workday or movement to assist  with body aches or sleep stories at night INCREDIBLY HELPFUL. I signed up for another year and I recommend it to all my friends.
title: It‚Äôs my survival tool

review: Had anxiety issues most of my life and I did had control of it til Covid happened and took me back to where I used to be. This familiar place of anxiousness and panic attacks‚Ä¶.replaying the same thoughts same feelings over and over again. I was referred to Calm app by a friend and so far I like that it offers so get the paid subscription. There are a lot of tips and things you can do to maintain a quality of life.
title: Covid anxiety

review: I discovered your app a few years ago thanks to an advertisement while watching Ellen‚Ä¶ I was going through some physical and mental challenges and Calm truly changed my life! I don‚Äôt know what I would do without Tamara and Jeff now!! Their daily meditations are so vital and necessary in my journey ‚Ä¶ Calm has been a KEY part in bringing much needed happiness and peace and clarity to my life‚Ä¶ THANK-YOU from the bottom of my heart ‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Thank-You Thank-You Thank-You üòä

review: I don‚Äôt want to ding it much just because it‚Äôs not for me, but I‚Äôm not going to resubscribe. The last thing I want to see when I go to meditate is a bunch of sports/tv/movie people. Rather than calm, it seems VERY LOUD with all these pop culture icons staring at you. The invasion of tv culture, even in apparently popular meditation apps just confirms (to me) the coming idiocracy. I liked Jeff Warren though, and I‚Äôll see if he‚Äôs got anything somewhere else in a more peaceful environment.
title: To many tv ‚Äúpersonalities‚Äù for me

review: Calm will change your life.  There is nothing like falling asleep to bedtime stories.  The nature sounds and music is amazing and I love the daily calm mediations.  Even if you don‚Äôt do it every day, you‚Äôll keep coming back for a relaxing experience and when you want to unwind.    It‚Äôs really a wonderful thing to have. There are so many wonderfully creative and inspiring people involved.  I highly recommend it
title: An Incredible app

review:
Dear People Who are interested,
This app is crazy awesome! It's so calming. I listen to books, and listen to sessions (some are free), and my favorite mood journal! It's beautiful books like 'Floating With The Florida Manatees' and 'Luna's Lullaby' and much more. I love doing daily sessions and being able to show my friends how much it does. It changes my heart and makes me feel confident. When I feel weak and scared I just go on calm and start some sessions and listen to some nice books. 
Sincerely,
SmartReviews
title: The Best App EVA!

review: I have been a poor sleeper forever. I have had trouble falling asleep and staying asleep for decades.  After just two nights at the trial in this app, I have fallen asleep in less than 10 minutes of just the body check preview!!!   I am so impressed and extremely thankful for this app. My healthcare provider recommended this and I was skeptical. I‚Äôm a believer now. This is a true blessing. I can‚Äôt wait to put my EarPods in tonight and shut out the world.
title: Best Sleep Medicine Yet!

review: Love listening to bedtime stories, as well as learning‚Ä¶.it may take listening to the same story for days before I ever stay awake long enough to hear the end, which is just what it‚Äôs meant to do, but I have learned of glass makers in Murano, elephants in Nepal, caves in Patagonia, train rides across Europe, Asia and so much more!  Love this app!  Wish there were an option to gift it to others.  Would be an awesome gift for anyone.
title: Bedtime ritual that is awesome!

review: While having most content on the app locked behind a subscription paywall is disappointing, trying to find anything as a free user that I can actually listen to is downright frustrating. Many times I find myself scrolling through content I can‚Äôt access, and simply give up and close the app before finding it. It would make the experience a lot better if the app showed free content for non premium users on the main page in a certain category, or as a search filter itself.
title: A Frustrating Experience for a Free Subscriber

review: Ok so I have been using calm for about 3 years and I Love it and I mean LOVE it they have great calming music relaxing scenes and wonderful yoga! I wake up every morning feeling like I can‚Äôt do it today but it can even help with that to! And I‚Äôm also a cancer so I get mood swings ALL the time and it even helps with that! It really makes me feel good about myself and is SO worth your time seriously!!! ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Definitely recommend

review:
I have incorporated Jeffs daily calm into my mornings for the past couple of years now. I do definitely feel more grounded, centered - and yes - a sense of calm and peace in my world. I have and will continue to recommend incorporating meditation into anyones daily habits - very positive!
I also do some of the sleep meditations and so love them as well.  
Looking forward to taking the time to explore the other content available
title: Daily Calm

review: I would love to give this five stars, but I really think it would be great to be able to make your own playlist when listening to sleep stories. I listen to the same playlist all the time because I have such trouble falling asleep, and I wake up/ become alert when ever a story stops. For example, it would be great if I could set five hours worth of stories, back to back each of my choosing.
title: Sleep stories & Playlists

review: I love the Daily Calm with Tamara. I get bored with listening to the same meditation over and over, so the new content is awesome. I do love the guided meditation called ‚Äúbody scan‚Äù too, and will listen to that regularly. I am not a fan of any sleep stories, so I meditate to sleep every night with Calm. Would love some sort of pregnancy meditation to help prep mind and body for birth! Love this app, though. Highly recommend.
title: Perfect complement to my meditation practice

review: This app used to be amazing. I used it years ago and loved it. I just recently stubbled upon it again and remembered how much it used to help me sleep. Now, I get on this app and you have to buy a subscription to use ANYTHING. There is like zero free stuff. I understand having some/most things locked for the people that want a subscription and for them to profit from the app. But having a free app with nothing to use? It‚Äôs pointless. Downloading the app is completely pointless unless you‚Äôre willing to pay about 70 dollars. I miss the old calm, when there was actually things you can do on it for free.
title: Used to love it, now not so much

review: Calm has helped me sleep through many nights where if Calm was not there, I could not sleep. Calm also has many meditations and features like recoding how you feel everyday. In pricing terms, a pay for the yearly and it is very much worth it to have all this. You can also download your stories to watch them without internet! In conclusion, this is an amazing app. Definitely 5 stars!
title: Amazing

review:
I love the app, been using it for about a year now. Thank you for the recent inclusion of ‚Äúdaily gratitude‚Äù, its something that was missing.
Update: recent changes only made it better! Would give 6/5 if I could. By the way, I am officially a lifetime member! Hopefully everyone gets to enjoy the price during black friday, I strongly recommend the commitment!
title: Thank you for including the daily gratitude question.

review: I never have trouble falling asleep when I go to bed, but staying asleep and then trying to go back to sleep is tough. Since I started using this app I fall back to sleep within a few minutes. The story option is so calming and keeps my mind from over thinking anything. It‚Äôs amazing. Can‚Äôt express enough, if you have trouble falling asleep this is a great tool help you.
title: Asleep in minutes

review: This is a great app. I was having some very bad anxiety and fear surrounding me all morning- restlessness. I cannot afford a therapist weekly- or even monthly- so when someone recommended this app and I decided to pay $70 dollars for the potential to take care of my own mental health- i saw it was worth it. Just took the the first day of learning how to meditate and I am already feeling calmer, more settled. Highly recommend.
title: Just did first meditation.

review: I have been using the daily meditation and sleep stories. My son heard a story and has been asking for one every night. The Glassmaker of Murano is a favorite! Haven‚Äôt looked into the other options but happy I have this option right now! Not too mention Calm teaming up with medical insurances to offer a free year. So nice to see mental health taken seriously. I‚Äôm really considering continuing using this app for my son and myself.
title: Great app!

review:
While I don‚Äôt use the services often, this app notified me of my upcoming renewal and made it easy to cancel my premium membership. This is in contrast to many similar apps that make it all but impossible to cancel. The experience of a clean ‚Äòcancel‚Äô process makes me want to sign up again... I know that seems counterintuitive, but it does. 

Thanks for a great product and treating customers ethically!
title: Ethical company

review: I‚Äôm not sure what happens in these stories because I typically fall to sleep before they end. I wake hours later with my Bluetooth face mask half off my face feeling very rested .All of the story tellers voices are so calm and just relaxing it really works . Since I‚Äôve gotten older I find it harder and harder to shut my mind off , listening to this at night is making my sleep more restful .
title: Great Bedtime stories

review: I am a health care worker that lives on a pager. My sleep is disturbed regularly by getting woken up in the middle of the night. I used to lye in bed unable to fall back to sleep. Knowing I would be exhausted when I had to go to work the next day. Calm changed that! Listening to a sleep story helps me to fall back to sleep quickly. It‚Äôs comforting to know I have this app to help me on those nights.
title: Quality of Life

review: Tried this app for one reason only: walking meditations on my Apple Watch. Ready for my walk, I started up the app, selected my walk duration, and hit play. Nothing ever started playing. Tried multiple times for over 5 minutes and the content just never loaded. I thought maybe the cellular connection on my watch was poor, but when I opened Apple‚Äôs Fitness app, I was able to start playing a Time to Walk episode right away that I hadn‚Äôt previously downloaded or anything. Tried Calm again when I got home. Still wouldn‚Äôt load. Canceled my free trial and uninstalled the app.
title: Maybe the content is great, I‚Äôll never know

review: Tried a long time ago.  Was ok.  Worth $70?  Maybe, maybe not.  Definitely not when their competitor - also highly rated, was offering a year for half that amount.  Now I get an email - try us again for free for new years - a new free 7 day trial  if you do it before 1/31.  Nope.  Each time I try to launch and use it wants $70.  I guess we won‚Äôt be trying the latest version‚Ä¶.
title: Ok app, can‚Äôt try update

review: I subscribed to this app because I wanted to start meditating.  I started with the 30 day beginner to meditation course, and that was a really great way to start my journey. I find the app to be be very good. The content isn‚Äôt organized well and the search bar isn‚Äôt very good.  What keeps me coming back is Jeff Warren. His guided meditations are amazing. He speaks normally not in that ‚Äúwoo-woo‚Äù yogi tone many narrators do, and he also discusses very relatable life matters.  His meditations have helped me tremendously.
title: Good meditation app

review: I LOVE this app! i downloaded it last night and it absolutely made me feel so relaxed! Best sleep/meditation app EVER! Use this if you are stressed and find your self tossing and turning every night. I have the same problem mostly because i have trouble focusing because of my ADHD, but besides that, my point is that this app is AMAZING! download if you want to fall asleep in less than 10 minutesüòå

Great app and use it often. However, the volume of the soundscapes are too low, in my opinion. I have to have it at the highest volume and many times, that‚Äôs still too low. 

I would like the ability to have them louder. I‚Äôve already tried everything possible, including raising the scene volume slider,  it that doesn‚Äôt affect this function.

Anyway you can increase volume of the soundscapes?
title: Love it but soundscape volume is too low

review: I used to use Calm intermittently for my insomnia and paid $15/month for it, but canceled it 1.5-2 years ago. I come back now to try to get back into the sleep stories and meditations and the only payment option (to unlock 99% off the app‚Äôs content with no free trial period) is billed as a yearly $70 fee, no option for a monthly fee. What if I was a new user who had no idea what the content was like on there, do they really think I would spend $70 on a whim for a whole year‚Äôs worth of content with no trial period? Ridiculous. Calm‚Äôs creators must have sold out.
title: No Monthly Subscription

developerResponse: {'id': 7844929, 'body': 'Hi there, I‚Äôm sorry to hear you did not enjoy the app. If you have any additional feedback to help us improve or for support canceling, please send us an email to support@calm.com.', 'modified': '2019-03-21T20:50:57Z'}
review: Navigating to find what is right can be a chore, time consuming, and some times frustrating, I found the ‚Äúdaily calm‚Äù to be just OK. And some of the music soothing. But short in duration. review:
I‚Äôm surprised because I don‚Äôt always hear the ending to some of the stories. They serve their purpose. 

I often times cannot fall asleep at a decent hour. I was thinking this morning that I‚Äôve not tried the meditation yet. Maybe if I do that right at bedtime I will be more relaxed and get 8 hours of sleep and not 4-5. 

One thing I would like to see changed is the ‚ÄúWhat made your sleep better?‚Äù questions. There are  before and after sub questions. Some of the choices, for me, are reasons why my sleep would be difficult and not causing me to sleep. The same thing for the why I slept well. I‚Äôd also like a section that you check for when you have broken sleep.

title: I‚Äôm surprised, I like it

review: I have problems sleeping. Decided to try this app and see if it helped. If it did I was going to purchase the premium membership. Unfortunately when I opened the app I could not find anything without a lock on it telling me I had to buy the membership. Now I do buy memberships to photo, calendars, games for my granddaughter etc but every app I‚Äôve bought into gave me a basic version  to try out. title: Disappointed

review: Went through a mental health crisis that left me with crippling anxiety( panic attacks at the slightest provocation) and situational depression. I bought a weighted blanket and started the meditations, sleep stories, and sound scapes. It‚Äôs been amazing. I‚Äôm finally able to fall asleep. The guided meditations help me slow down and deal with the mental health issues. It is a great tool to heal, but it is also great for people who just want to relax.
title: The only way I can fall asleep.

review: I haven‚Äôt given every feature a try, but the sleep options are wonderful. If I wake up, which previously wold have kept me up for hours, I refrain from reading news or social media and instead go to this app. It‚Äôs a game changer. I am amazed at how quickly I can fall back to sleep. Note that I have small children that wake me up frequently and this will work multiple times in one night.
title: Works to improve insomnia

review:
This app has help to calm my lambic system several times. Whenever I have anxiety, feel sad, or just looking for a moment for myself this app helps me to come back to balance. 

Remember balance... it is not perfection, it is more the fact you are conscious about your feelings and look for an answer of why you feel them. Let them come with compaction and from there, start going through them to reach peacefulness.
title: Exceptional

review:
I started meditating to preserve a shred of sanity in the pandemic. I purchased Calm Premium and am really happy with it; I love the daily and special meditations, the reminders, the music options, really just a fantastic program for anyone who wants to become less reactive and more accepting.
My only suggestion is to mix up the narrators. Tamara Levitt does an excellent job, but at a certain point it‚Äôs like a radio station with one host. I wouldn‚Äôt change anything about her, but I‚Äôd love some other options.
title: Great app, please mix up the narrators!

review: I've used this app for some time and have enjoyed every moment of it. The options to suit your needs (anxiety, focus, sleep, etc.) provide something for everyone. I highly recommend this app to always have calm moments available to you when you need it! I also recommend this app to my clients as something to try and potentially integrate into their daily routine.
title: Sheer Perfection.

review: Calm has helped me to learn how to become ‚Äògrounded‚Äô in this big bad and beautiful world. It‚Äôs amazing to learn how to become a part of the good, while also being mindful that opposing forces will try to hijack our thoughts and actions to melt our resolve. With Calm, we learn that each of us can exercise and develop our best self. With or without wrinkles, each one of us is still grand and quite mysterious, too!
title: To become grounded

review:

I cannot access subscription! Sign in with Apple, no access.  Log in with email and newly created account, no subscription.  Logged into website, no subscription. title: Best app for everyone, every mood and every event

review: I was on it for a few seconds and everything I could see was just you had a premium for it I had searched around there was nothing and if there was anything I missed it be very very very few overall I see a lot of good things about it but just know I know a lot of people don‚Äôt really care about kids opinions but I‚Äôm a kid and I think this is terrible for a kid that wants to just do something like calm down and relax and if their parents don‚Äôt want to buy stuff like that for them then they can‚Äôt have that override its not the best and you should probably look for a different app that doesn‚Äôt cost money
title: no

review: I previously wrote a review about how Calm kept glitching out. I have a new phone, and that might contribute to it. They also might of fixed it. title: It‚Äôs Better

review:
After using the Calm app for for four months, my mind senses when I need to relax and my body responds. My should relax, my mind gets quiet, and I automatically concentrate on my breath.

It has been great that, even though I started using Calm for an specific reason, it has opened my mind to a thousand paths‚Ä¶. Thanks!
title: Did not believe in it‚Ä¶. Know a firm beginner

review: I struggled to sleep every day so my gmom told me to download it so I downloaded it created an account and i was just getting started but the problem is almost everything is calm premium I couldn‚Äôt find a single thing that doesn‚Äôt need calm premium so when i check the price tag it was 70$ wow what a waste of money I mean how many ablums are that doesn‚Äôt need premium? title: Im gonna be honest

review:

title: Calm has been a soulsaver

title: No good sleep

review: Love love love calm app. The only and I mean only time I couldn‚Äôt get to sleep with this app was when I had changed time zones and my waking hours were during the night. title: Always helps me sleep

review: I have been using Calm for over 3 years now. It‚Äôs become a happy habit to start my day. I‚Äôm grateful that I have this to fall back on for spiritual and emotional support. Calm keeps reminding me to stay positive & peaceful, & patient.
title: So much to choose from!

review: I really love the app. One thing I wish could change is the ‚Äútime played out of app‚Äù. It goes from nothing (0 minutes) to 15 minutes. I wish there was a 5 minute option. review: I quit using calm because I found a number of other free meditation apps that I liked. Next thing I know I had a renewal charge on my credit card for Calm. review: This app has helped me learn to meditate. It‚Äôs not as easy as it sounds! It definitely helps calm my anxious mind. I still go back and do the refresher ‚Äòhow to meditate‚Äô course every few months I pick up new things every time I re take that course. Try it!
