When I came across the app, I had doubt that I wouldn't use it as often to justify the price.... I was wrong. Year two now and loving it. Short meditations in the morning, mid-day session to collect myself, a tool to fall back asleep in the middle of the night.

Excellent app!
title: Don't hesitate!

review: Love this app. I‚Äôve been using it for 12-18mths and noticed and exponential shift in my focus, presence and mindfulness. I am able to be more attuned to being present in such a way that I am more aware, perceptive to the tiniest of what is happening in any experience or interaction. I‚Äôve also been able to create more self discipline and bring my mind back when it drifts.
title: Reduced tension and increased focus, mindfulness, presence

review: I think this is quite an odd business model. I get that there are contents, including stories, talks and meditation source, but it‚Äôs really not intuitive at all to a person who barely started using it. It starts, ‚Äúwhat do you need help with?‚Äù, and it starts talking about $70 per year subscription without even offering how I could be helped for the purpose I need. It lists all the things premium subscription provides, but how would I know which one would help me before purchasing it..? It feels a bit rude to force it so. I‚Äôm not sure where to begin with, and it‚Äôs pretty confusing.
title: Why does it force subscription?

review: I enjoy the sleep stories but Tamara Levitt talks through 80% of the ‚Äúmeditations‚Äù. How can I quiet my mind if she‚Äôs talking the whole time. They should not call this a meditation app. It‚Äôs a life lesson app where you breathe for a few minutes in between her talking on and on. Today we were supposed to pull ourselves back from thought every time we heard a bell. She spent a whole minute explaining the process AGAIN (after she already explained what to do) after the bell went off. I was so frustrated I just closed the app. This is only good for sleep stories if you actually enjoy meditating:
title: I‚Äôd give this zero stars if I could

review: I find Calm to have very effective options for helping to relax, unwind, and fall asleep.  The ambient sound choices are wonderful.  I also like the sleep stories however I have found the the French Wisperer‚Äôs story of Atlantis to be distracting as it is full of false information about where lemurs occur.  FYI lemurs are not found in Australia (other than in zoos) and never have been.   Unfortunately this part in the story stirred, rather than soothed, my discursive mind.  Ah well.
title: Very Calming But‚Ä¶

review: We LOVE the Calm app! There‚Äôs stories and mediations for everyone in my family. It‚Äôs a must have at bed and nap time for my children. I use the app all throughout the day simply to center myself, do a more in depth meditation, or to help me get to sleep. The soundscapes are so calming and sometimes I enter the app just to listen to and look at the relaxing sounds and visuals. This app is a MUST HAVE! Family approved!
title: Great for the Entire Family!

review: I have been subscribed to Calm for years now. At it‚Äôs core, you will find no other app that is this committed to bringing their subscribers peace as much as this one. I know this because I‚Äôm am one of the recipients. Times change and so do the methods of psychology. Calm has fond a way to understand proven modern methods to help people while always holding steadfast to timeless practices that will ensure a mind and a body that is indeed, Clam. -Greg
title: Your Guid to peace.

review: I know that‚Äôs a dramatic claim for someone who has only had the app for 4 days but truly - I‚Äôm starting not to dread going to bed anymore. I have routinely been falling asleep ok - then am wide awake at 2.30 - lying there worrying about everything under the sun. I have only used the stories so far but they work perfectly! title: Life changing!

review: I downloaded the Calm app to get into a meditation routine and it worked. There are many good series that I would return to, but over time I had listened to most three or four times, and aside from single Daily meditations there was not a lot of new (meditation) content to consume. Having only one narrator/voice as your guide is also limiting when that voice is not one that sits well in your ears (personal preference, I know). Amazing app to get into a meditation habit but not enough to keep me subscribed.
title: Great at the start, but limiting

review: I often wake in the night and the sleep stories become my salvation. They lightly entertain with soothing voices, which usually lull me back to sleep. In the mornings, if I wake with racing thoughts, the daily meditations help relieve them. The variety of content is amazing and always growing. I definitely recommend this app for anyone wanting to calm their thoughts, any time of day or night.
title: Love the Sleep Stories & Variety of Meditations

review:
My wife encouraged me to try Calm and sent me an email offer she received. I clicked the link and paid only to realize it paid for it under her account. 

I reached out to support on the Calm website and waited.  They did contact me a week later apologizing for the delay and very quickly fixed the issue and connected to payment to my account.

I will update this again once I have a chance to use the app.
title: Updated - Look forward to trying the paid version

review: Maybe there is an easy solution, but I can‚Äôt figure out how to get some of the sleep music apps with short compositions to play consecutively. But I‚Äôve only started using it regularly in the last few weeks. It‚Äôs exceptional & I‚Äôm enjoying splitting my meditations between Calm and Breethe.

title: I‚Äôve had this app for years‚Ä¶

review: The app is generally good, and there is a lot of variety for the types of meditation and voices you find the most helpful. My issue is that the app continues to reset my notification settings, alerting me for calm resets and check-ins even after I repeatedly turn these settings off. One reminder a day keeps me coming back, but more than that and I end up ignoring all of them (including the one I want). Once this is fixed I would give the app 5 stars.
title: App has a few bugs

review: Listening to a story is an effective way to distract my mind. Otherwise I would lay there and think about something troubling me. There is a great variety of subjects and the story tellers have soothing voices. Sometimes I listen to children‚Äôs stories I remember from childhood.  Other times I listen to a new and interesting subject. Regardless I fall asleep before the story is over.
title: Fall asleep in minutes

review:
I am more interested in guided meditations on loving kindness, or Tonglen or other Buddhist ideas. While I have found a couple meditations on loving kindness, they are hard for me to find. Also, I like meditating for 20 minutes a day, and finding 20 minute meditations is also a little difficult.

I have been using Insight Timer for many years, and I really like the way they organize their different meditations. A friend gave me a subscription to Calm, which is why I‚Äôm giving it a chance.
title: Organization

review:
All I can say is this app has helped me get and stay on a better path in I life.i am so grateful to Tamera and more recently Jeff to somehow give me some daily help with my current situation in my daily life.

I think it has been 5+ years now since I began listening to daily calms and the material has just been getting better and better.

Thank you! All the stars!
title: My all time favorite

review:
I‚Äôve used Calm almost daily since 2017. It‚Äôs clearly a phenomenal aid and accessory to meditation. I also use it as a nightly sleep aid with the rain scene, as well as use the fire on my Apple TV while working. 

Other than the suites of themed series, which I‚Äôve almost entirely completed, I use their daily meditation - switching between Tamara and Jeff‚Äôs wonderful and almost always beautiful meditations. 

However the three stars is because I‚Äôd love more indigenous, Black and marginalized voices in here for actual meditation series. Not just a bunch of white folks and random celebrities and‚Ä¶ aphorism cannon YouTubers like Jay Shetty. 

I know y‚Äôall got the money. So would be lovely to hear and see varied offers of meditation from potentially different practitioners and disciplines. 

Also Mel Mah‚Äôs sleep one is currently saving my life. It‚Äôs amazing.
title: Phenomenal App - More Voices Needed

review: I love all that this app has to offer: nature soundscapes, binaural soundtracks, meditations on everything from work anxiety to self-esteem.  However, I really wish the app let you choose your narrator.  I CANNOT STAND Tamara Levitt‚Äôs voice and it is EVERYWHERE on this app.  The vocal fry is distracting.  Her delivery often comes across as sounding condescending and insincere.  It‚Äôs like she is so focused on manufacturing a sound that she thinks will be pleasant/attractive to the listener that she forgets to connect to the material she is communicating.
title: Great app‚Ä¶except for Tamara Levitt‚Äôs voice

review: I love Calm, it‚Äôs always there when I need it. I can scroll through the different categories and find something that matches my emotions. If I want to focus on something a little deeper the ‚Äò7 days‚Äô is fantastic. It really breaks it down into 7 different daily views. I‚Äôve had the app for years and absolutely love it! My entire family listens to it from small to big!
title: Calm

review: Calm has helped both me and students manage and relieve stress during COVID distance as well as since we have returned to in - person. Students reported feeling more relaxed and self accepting. Many students even said they practiced meditation on their own because of this experience.  Thank you allowing me to use and share this app for myself and students!

review: It‚Äôs crazy to even say it, but this App has forever changed my life. I do wish there were daily options for longer meditations, and that there was more diversity in our choices. I don‚Äôt see any meditation teachers from India on your app. There are also very few offerings from people of color. Most of the pictures feature white skin.

review: I use Guided Meditations almost exclusively for sleep. All but a few of Calm‚Äôs offerings of sleep meditations are with one hypnotist, whose voice is grating to me. It may as well be nails on a chalkboard when I hear her voice. I had the premium subscription but will be canceling it. After 2 years of it, I hoped they would expand their offerings but it hasn‚Äôt happened and doesn‚Äôt look like they‚Äôre changing that anytime soon. Switched over to the Slumber app instead and much happier with that one. So far, they add guided meditations weekly.

I guess I need a constant distraction from my busy mind all night!  Thank you!

You may as well make people pay for the app, not for the membership! 
   Can you please make some changes and unlock more sleep stories? That‚Äôs all I want.

review:
I just downloaded the app because I can‚Äôt sleep and thought I would see what this was about.  And then I deleted it.  

 It‚Äôs obvious you‚Äôre only in it for the money and don‚Äôt care about helping people.   All I found unlocked was 2 sleep stories.  No music, no soundscapes, no meditations.  You‚Äôre not even charging a one time fee. You‚Äôre asking for $70 a year.  

You want to actually help people?  How about offering different tiers?  $20 a year for 1/3 of the content, $40 a year for half?  Maybe then, I‚Äôll reconsider.  For now, don‚Äôt imply you have free content.

Not only is this false, it‚Äôs eugenic in it‚Äôs orientation toward disability. review:
I have been a Calm user since 2020 and have only loved it more and more. I was diagnosed with severe depression and anxiety in 2019, had three panic attacks a day, insomnia, and more until I tried this app. I typically avoid paying for apps, but this is my NUMBER ONE resource for maintaining my mental health. 

I start my day with a daily gratitude check in, end my day with guided meditations and a daily reflection exercise, and fall asleep to a rain soundscape! 

Journals, therapy, and life coaching can become expensive, but Calm is truly an all in on resource.

 Tip: Depending on your employment, your company could pay for a premium membership, or your health insurance could cover the cost too.

review: This app has helped me with my anxiety and stress at work. review: This app is so worth it. If you stay consistent, you won‚Äôt regret it. There was a discount if you signed up within 24 hours of downloading the app, so it was only $42 for the year. review: Calm is my safe space and where I visit nightly for guidance and encouragement. I find Jay Shetty‚Äôs ‚Äú Daily Jay ‚Äù always reassuring and a source of comfort. review: I enjoy using this app. It‚Äôs been extremely helpful with sleep meditations and music to help my insomnia. Other music is great for quiet while working. To truly get the range of offerings, a subscription is required-monthly or yearly rates. The free version offers too little.

It was truly helping us take the doom out of nightly doom-scroll. Why was this feature removed? Will it return?

title: We need new daily meditations, Tamara

review:

review:
I love the Daily Jay, but having longer meditations would be helpful. 

Also, more variety of voices would be nice as some of the people used just don‚Äôt have a tone I enjoy. Perhaps add more accents too. 

More sleep stories, more variety of content as I don‚Äôt like the majority of what‚Äôs offered lately.  And don‚Äôt delete content that we have loved. Let us be in charge of our own content management.  It would be good to make it so we could customize what we like in a separate section to weed out the content that takes up valuable real estate on our phone screens. Having excess clutter is not at all calming. 

With the amount of money charged for Calm app, it ought to Really Deliver on high quality content choices! 

Thank you for your consideration.

title: An amazing app!

review:
Day one of Calm was instantly soothing. I became hooked-its been at least 10 years. Throughout the years, I‚Äôve changed from a  insecure person to an empathetic woman who loves others as much as myself. Here‚Äôs a üòÅfrom me to you.
Do yourself a favor and get this App. We all need a little me time.

review: Seriously, don't take a peek only at these front comments showing ‚Äúgood reviews‚Äù some people have money for this kinda stuff, thats normal and then theres 70 dollars pushed right into your face like a ruined birthday cake. one option is free, what about the others? nahhh. make em pay 70 bucks a year... terrible app just leave this to rot in the bin, don't waste space on this if you were looking for easy sleep, you'll be more sleep deprived trying to earn 70 bucks than actually not using this app.
title: Take a deep breath... and bin this crappy app.

review:
Either I am still too new for the app, or it is not very user friendly. 

So many options are given that it has taken me time to figure out what is the right meditation for the specific moment. 

The app might already be doing the following (and if so, this confirms it is not as user friendly as other apps in general) but, when it comes to my daily meditations, I don‚Äôt really have the same amount of time for it every single day. Therefore, being able to filter by time (and then by type or guide) would be very helpful. 

Just some thoughts.
title: Too many options‚Ä¶difficult to find the right meditation for the moment

review: I‚Äôve tried other sleep apps but finally bought the year long subscription to Calm when I discovered how much I liked all the different ways that it has to calm me down with courses on different topics, meditations, sleep stories, calming music audios and simple breathing exercises.

review: I got this for a very anxious stressed out kid in the hopes it would help him through bad days. He used it a small handful of times and stopped. The renewal hit and he immediately cancelled it as he hadn‚Äôt used the app in months. They continued to bill me until I finally disputed the charge with my credit card. Found out today I‚Äôm paying for another year of a product we aren‚Äôt using because their fine print says you must cancel ‚Äúbefore the renewal‚Äù. The same day it renewed was already too late. Absolute garbage.
title: Buyer Beware!!!

Question is‚Ä¶ am I missing the Nick Offerman option? Bought premium and don‚Äôt see a version done by nick other than the advertisement. Get Nick on board quick.

review: I love the app before on my other phone before it broke. On that phone I had time in and many of my options were unlocked. But now that I logged in on my new phone everything is locked. üòüThe app helped me go to sleep EVERY night. Now I have to calm down other ways.

review: I gave it 1 star because you have to buy everything like if you have to buy everything then just buy the app but do not push people‚Äôs hopes up because I was really exited about this and usually when it‚Äôs says free to download then there is some stuff that is supposed to be free and the only thing that is available is about lebron James and I want some more free content so pls change this and I will give it a better review but anyways really disappointed hope you change this

title: New update

review: Calm is the best. I start each day with it and often end my days with it. I enjoy the meditation classes and the Daily Calm. I highly recommend it for anyone who desires peace, joy and calm in their lives. It's for everyone especially a bustling, hectic world. It has inspired me to pursue a Certification in meditation so I can teach it in my work.
title: Best app to meditate

review: I love love love calm. It helps me sleep every night and I love all of the guided meditations. I would like to suggest being able to queue up sleep stories, and sort by length. It takes me a while to settle in, and sometimes I need to put on a second sleep story, but the light from my phone/ interaction with the app takes me out of my sleepiness.
title: Sleep stories

review: I only use Calm for the sleep stories for which I would give almost 5 stars. I‚Äôve tried the meditation and some of the other things, but find them grating and triggering. I don‚Äôt care for the main woman‚Äôs voice all over the app, but love the diversity of the stories voices. I have some favorites who have deep, soothing voices. The price is a bit steep for just stories that are only updated maybe twice a month, so I‚Äôd love a Sleep Stories only app.
title: Need a Sleep Stories app!

review: Daily Calm provides many teachers and many modes of working one‚Äôs awareness.  It would be impossible to spend enough time to explore it all and still do one‚Äôs regular life! The graphics and photos are gorgeous and the music also.  I‚Äôm especially grateful for the basics taught by Jeff Warren which got me to set a habit and stay curious.
title: Delightful variety of resources

review: I used this app for free when my baby was born to play lullabies, help with post partum insomnia and keep our sanity. I used to listen to one of the tracks called Milky Way- it was my favorite. These were free and required no trial or purchase. It‚Äôs all I wanted and guess what, those are LOCKED now. Very disappointed. Some people have a budget and can‚Äôt afford the full version but now there is nothing left at all to use -even for free- even things that were once free within the app. Will be uninstalling and hoping Bored Panda will be enough for me and the baby to sleep.

When I open calm it makes me feel welcome and safe. And every one

I‚Äôm glad it‚Äôs available, and I‚Äôm glad I have it.

Consistent practice is the key to getting the benefits of mindfulness meditation. Calm helps you stay on track with that as well.

I use it and I‚Äôve bought lifetime subs for myself and my daughter. Cant give higher praise than that.

review: I loved Calm. There was enough there that was free to keep me engaged with the app. Lately everything seems to be behind a paywall. I understand that you all need to make money but come on! I would deal with listening to ads if it would open up more content. Perhaps you should consider that as an option.

Thanks

review:

It's been well over a month since I canceled my subscription and it's still attempting to charge me for another month of the premium. This is a known issue according to the BBB. Many people are being charged after they cancel their subscriptions. 

Do NOT download this app if you value your hard earned money.
title: Complete scam. DO NOT DOWNLOAD

title: Calm

review:
You know there‚Äôs a problem when the in-app FAQ about the new interface includes the question ‚Äúhow do I cancel my subscription?‚Äù

This app used to be simple and great, but the latest interface (purportedly ‚Äúmaking it easier‚Äù) lost all my previous favs. I had to scroll thru a long list ‚Äúby narrator‚Äù just to re-fav them, and then search my profile to find the favs. All this when I just wanted to tap *one button* and fall asleep. 

The Daily Calm, Daily Trip and other content are good, but the cluttered interface seems intent on promoting high dollar narrators and authors. 

I use Calm to get away from mental clutter and marketing. Please try to think of how the users are *feeling* when they open this app at the beginning or end of a long hard day.

review:
I‚Äôm not one to write reviews for apps, but Calm presents me daily with the opportunity to hone my focus, control my thoughts, and evolve into deeper ways of experiencing the present moment and world around me. 

I‚Äôve used the other apps, however, the variety and value contained in Calm is much greater for me. 

When I started out two months ago, I had a wild monkey mind. I still do on occasion and my practice isn‚Äôt always perfect. But with Calm‚Äôs guidance, I‚Äôm now sitting in 45-60 minute meditations with no problems.

I feel balanced, my extraneous thoughts are silenced, and I‚Äôm living a much more aware existence. I‚Äôm very grateful.

Oh wait, even though the app is open and running, it doesn‚Äôt prevent my phone from automatically shutting the screen off and locking after 30 seconds.  But I‚Äôm SURE that feature is unlocked with the paid version.  Why even have a free version?  If this is your idea of advertising scheme, I‚Äôm not biting.

Three tries in the past week and I have heard nothing from them.  So much for relieving anxiety.  So sorry I ever signed up.

Great job!

Jeff's Daily Trip is the main reason I have this app. His easy-going style is the first meditation that has worked for me. High price but ultimately worth it.

Pros
¬∑ Jeff

Cons

review:
I have interstitial lung disease and pulmonary fibrosis due to Covid-19, where the disease destroyed over 2/3rds of my lungs. 

I like the look, feel, and ease of use of this app - but this app is not helpful for the pulmonary disabled, rather it‚Äôs useful to only those who can already manage their breathing. This is not the apps‚Äô fault. 

I‚Äôve emailed the developers and they‚Äôve been unable to provide any assistance. Again, this is not their fault. 

I‚Äôll just have to keep looking for help.
title: Not for those with pulmonary disability
